loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria López tiene 49 años de edad, mujer esforzada que ha logrado mantener su negocio desde hace catorce años puso una pequeña pulpería y ha ido creciendo, su esposo trabaja como responsable de seguridad, procreo dos hijos uno de 9 y 13 años de edad, los dos cursan sus estudios, viven en un barrio el Recreo en la capital de Managua,  ha venido teniendo ventas bajas, los cliente que la de crédito par ala quincena no le han pagado  todo, y en estos últimos meses no ha tenido las ganancias esperada, lo único que le ha ayudado son los financiamiento para lograr mantener el equilibro en sus productos este es su segundo ciclo el cual comprara, pollo, carne, huevo, pan, golosinas, jugos, gaseosas y una variedad de productos que sastifagan la necesidad del cliente como pagar sus cuentas básicas, cubrir los alimentos, los gastos del colegio, y el pago del préstamo que gracias a su buen servicio no ha perdido su pequeña pulpería. Que es su fuente de trabajo y de ayuda para dar a sus hijos  lo mejor.
texts.en:
Maria López, 49, is a hard-working woman who has been able to maintain her business. Fourteen years ago she set up a small mini market, and it has been growing. Her husband works as the head of security. They have two children, 9 and 13. The children attend school. They live in the Recreo neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has been having low sales. The customers to whom she gave two weeks credit have not paid in full. In the past months she has not had the expected earnings. The only things that have helped keep a balance of products are the loans. This is her second cycle. She will buy chicken, meat, eggs, bread, sweets, juice, soft drinks, and a variety of products to satisfy her customers’ needs. She will pay her basic bills, cover the cost of food, pay the school expenses, and pay the loan. Thanks to her good service she has not lost her small mini market. It is her source of work and helps give her children the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, eggs, milk, sweets, and a variety of products

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora  Martha Lorena Hererra tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la Colonia 1ro de Mayo junto con su esposo han logrado poner un estudio fotográfico el cual llevan  17 años ofreciendo sus servicios, su esposo inicio ofreciendo su fotos ambulante y ella lo apoyaba en su casa también tomando las fotografías, procreo tres hijos  de 12,18 y 19 años de edad, el mayor trabaja y estudia para cubrirse sus gastos,  por gracias a Dios han logrado tener su propia casa y ayudado a salir adelante a sus hijos, los prestamos en Afodenic han venido a mejorar su vida ya que han mejorado su tecnología, comprando las cámaras profesionales, hasta una computadora para  procesar y dar una mejor visión  a la fotografía, con este  préstamo es su quinto ciclo el cual comprara una cámara sony y cada día ofrecer a sus clientes lo mejor ya que la competencia es fuerte. Su meta es para con sus hijos es poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro dándole los estudios necesarios para una vida mejor. Con esta inversión esperan atraer más clientes, vender mas su producto, y mejores ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades personales de la familia.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena Hererra is 39 years old and she lives in the Primero de Mayo neighborhood with her husband. They have been able to open a photographic studio; they have been offering their services for 17 years. Her husband started by taking photos in the street and she helped him at home by also taking photos. They have three children, who are 12, 18, and 19 years old. The oldest studies and works to pay his expenses. Thankfully, they have been able to have their own house and help their children get ahead in life. The loans from Afodenic have helped improve their lives because they have been able to improve their technology. They purchased professional cameras and even a computer to process and improve the photos. With this loan, which is their fifth, they will buy a Sony camera so they can offer their clients the best, since there is strong competition. Their goal for their children is be able to offer them a better future by giving them the education that is necessary for a better life. With this investment they hope to attract more clients and sell more of their product, so they can have improved earnings with which to cover their family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a Sony camera so they can have higher resolution photos

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es: Doña Camila de 57 años de edad, mujer trabajadora se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos  y electrodoméstico que durante 17 años anda vendiendo para ofrecer a sus hijos lo mejor, como madre soltera le toco duro ya que desde horas tempranas bordaba los buses del norte con su mercadería para ir a vender  a los departamentos, reside en Villa Venezuela de la Iglesia madre de Dios tres andenes al sur, sus hijos están casados ya, que  lograron una profesión lo cual se siente una madre sastifecha, ya que pudo dar  a sus hijos la mejor herencia, con el transcurso del tiempo ha logrado  mejorar su vivienda lo esta contenta,  las dificultades es que abecé la gente le atrasa con  los pago y con las ventas bajas que ha tenido últimamente no ha mirado las ganancias, es por eso que con este préstamo que su octavo ciclo, invertirá en la compra de ropa, para dama y caballero, niño en variedad ya que viene la temporada buena de las ventas lo cual espera aumentar las ventas y mejorar su economía. Y poder mantener el equilibrio en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Miss Camila is 57 years old and is a working woman, selling clothing, cosmetics, and home electronics. She has been working this way for 17 years to offer the best for her children as a single mother. She gets on the bus very early with her merchandise to head to the northern departments. She lives in the Villa Venezuela of the Church of the Mother of God, three stops to the south. Her children are already married, and they all have careers which makes their mother very satisfied since she was able to give her children the best inheritance. With the passing of time she has been able to improve her house with which she is now content. The difficulty is that sometimes the people postpone their payments and with the low sales that she has had recently she has not seen much profit. It’s for this reason that with this loan - her 8th loan - she will invest in purchasing a variety of men’s, women’s and children’s clothing since the good sales season is coming and she hopes to increase her sales and her economic situation. And to be able to maintain equilibrium in her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas of men's, women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina T. D. H. resiD. en Zacatecoluca del departamento D. La Paz. Carmelina tiene 47 años D. edad vive con su esposo quien trabaja como motorista y sus tres hijos D. 21, 17 y 10 años D. estas, todos estudiantes. Carmelina ha dedicado la mitad D. su vida  a su negocio, una tienda con productos D. consumo, son veintitrés años D. constancia en su negocio, con el cual ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar a su esposo, ahora ella ha amplificado sus ventas con la producción D. antojitos que ofrece cada tarD., el deseo D. Carmelina es continuar creciendo en sus negocio y es por ello que solicita este crédito, que le ayuD. a surtir su tienda e insumos para sus antojitos.
texts.en:
Carmelina T. D. H. lives in the Zacatecoluca department of La Paz. Carmelina is 47 years old and lives with her husband, who works as a motorcycle driver, and their three children, who are 21, 17, and 10 years old respectively and they are all students. Carmelina has spent half her life, a consistent 23 years, running her business, a general store. Over the years, she has been able to use her business's income to support her husband. Recently, she has expanded her sales by making snacks and selling them in the afternoon. Carmelina's wish is to continue expanding her business, which is why she is seeking this loan to increase her store's inventory and buy ingredients for her snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
ELIZABETH ROSAR. A. P.; de 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 20 años. Ella integra D. grupo “Amigas Unidas” junto con 6 integrantes mas, quienes son muy entusiastas y emprendedoras.
Desde hace dos años, la Sra. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de pescado en el Mercado “La Hacienda”, en el puesto que alquila y el cual bautizó con el nombre de “Pescados y mariscos Charito”. Nos menciona que éste trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que debe madrugar todos los días sin excepción para dejar listo el almuerzo y salir a comprar los pescados y mariscos en el mercado mayorista. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien se queda al cuidado de sus hijos que ahora ya son jóvenes y también la apoyan tanto en el negocio como con los quehaceres de la casa.
Con su trabajo, ha logrado comprar su terreno, donde ha podido levantar poco a poco la casita en donde viven actualmente y sobretodo el pago de estudios universitaR. de su hija mayor.
Su mayor deseo es adquirir un puesto en el mercado donde trabaja para dejar de pagar alquileres y comprar un taxi que pueda alquilar y le de otro ingreso. Ella se está proyectando, ya que su hijo menor el próximo año debe iniciar sus estudios universitaR..
texts.en:
ELIZABETH ROSAR. A. P. is 36 years old, married, and has two children aged 17 and 20 respectively. She is a member of the “Amigas Unidas” group along with 6 other members, who are all very enthusiastic and entrepreneurial. Two years ago, Mrs. Elizabeth decided to start selling fish in the “La Hacienda” Market in a rented booth, which she named “Pescados y Mariscos Charito.” She says that this work is very burdensome, because she has to get up very early every day without exception in order to have the lunch ready and to go buy fish and shellfish in the wholesale market. Her husband helps her, staying to care for their still quite young children, helping with the business, and doing the household chores. With this job, she has been able to buy some land, where she has been able to build, little by little, the house in which her family currently lives, and she has been able to, above all, pay for her eldest daughter's university tuition. Her greatest wish is to buy a stand in the market where she works so she can stop paying rent and buy a taxi she can rent, which would provide additional income. She is already planning how she will pay for her younger son's university tuition when he starts next year.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en: Marie K., Marie C., Kama K., and Dorah K. are the members of a new loan group of market sellers called "Talapsu." They specialize in necessities, such as palm oil (a Sierra Leonean staple). The leader, Marie K., has been in business for three years. The ladies are seeking their first loan of 2 million LE through SMT and Kiva in the hope of expanding their businesses, increasing their inventories, and turning a greater profit. Marie is married to another businessman and they have two children, both of whom are now grown and out of school.

loans.use: Expand their inventory of palm oil

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en: The women of the Go Try Group are, as their name suggests, ambitious and hopeful. They are Aminata K., Fatmata K., and Fatmata S.. Aminata is the group’s leader, and at only 23 years old, she has already been in business for four years selling powders, creams, and other cosmetic goods. She is not married but has one child, who is not yet old enough to attend school. These women are seeking a loan of 1.5 million LE from Kiva and SMT to invest in and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their business inventory

loans.name: Ghana Star Bakery Group

texts.en: At 39 years of age, Maseray T. has already acquired 8 years of experience in her current business: selling bread from a stand in the town where she lives. She is the leader of the Ghana Star Bakery Group, which also includes Abdulai B., Alimamy B., Hawa G., and Mabinty K.. Maseray is seeking a loan to buy more flour and expand her business. She is married and her husband is a teacher. In his time off, her husband bakes the bread that Maseray sells. They have 2 children, both of whom attend primary school.  The Ghana Star Bakery Group is seeking a loan of 2.5 million LE from SMT and Kiva to increase their livelihoods.

loans.use: To buy flour to make more bread to sell

loans.name: Josefa Nuvia

texts.es: La señora Josefa Z. de 34 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa, con doce años de experiencia en las ventas el cual comenzó con ahorros propio que su esposo daba, el trabaja en una compañía de operador de comunicación, y han logrado tener su propia casa, a pesar de todas las dificultades, procreo dos hijos los cuales los dos estudian, y esperan poder dar el apoyo necesarios para que sean hombres de bien. Sus objetivo es poder hacer mejoras a su casa ya que no es toda de concreto y da inseguridad ya que en el barrio que vive Ayapal la delincuencia ha incrementado por la falta del desempleo, y la sequía de la siembra lo cual ha provocado en los hogares el desequilibrio económico por la alta que esta la canasta básica, también su piso es de suelo y desea hacerlo de embaldosado para una mejor higiene. Con el crédito anterior compro una vitrina para dar mejor vista a sus productos y con este comprara ropa, sandalia que es lo que mas le compran ya que vende y da crédito ala quincena lo malo es cuando no le pagan en la fecha acordada ya que tiene que pagar sus gastos a si como comprar su venta de ropa, espera con este crédito tener buenas ganancia para poder ir comprando materiales de construcción para ir mejorando su humilde casa. Agradece Afodenic por el apoyo y la oportunidad de su financiamiento.
texts.en:
Josefa Z. is 34 years old, and she has been selling clothes for twelve years. She started her business with her own savings that her husband gave her. He works for a telecommunications company, and together they have been able to obtain their own home despite the many dificulties they face. She has two children, both of whom study, and they hope to be able to provide the necessary support to watch their sons grow up to be good men. Her goal is to make home improvements, since it is not all currently made of concrete. This makes their home less safe because in their neighborhood, Ayapal, violence is increasing because of unemployment and economic instability due to the harvest drought. This instability has arisen from the increasing prices of the basic household groceries. In addition, they have a dirt floor, which they would like to replace with tile, because it is more hygienic. With her last loan, Josefa bought a glass counter to better display her products, and with this loan, she will buy clothing and sandals, which are the products in highest demand. She offers bi-weekly credit for payment, but unfortunately her clients do not always pay on the agreed date, so she has to front her own funds to buy more clothes. She hopes that this loan will help her make a good profit so she can continue buying construction materials for her humble home. She is thankful to AFODENIC for its support and the opportunity for this access to finance.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing and sandals

loans.name: Tamemsu Ii Group

texts.en: Hawa M., Fatmata K. I, Fatmata K. I., and Yeabu S. are the members of the Tamemsu I. loan group. This is the first loan they are seeking from SMT and Kiva, and they are looking for 2 million LE in order to expand their businesses. Hawa is the leader of this group, and she is 45 years old. She has seven children, all of whom attend either primary or secondary school. Hawa has been in business for five years selling such goods as palm oil, rice, and peppers to supplement her husband’s income as a driver in town.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of rice, palm oil, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en: Mariama B. is the leader of the Peace and Unity Group, which also includes Alusine T.Z. K. and Salamatu C.. Mariama is 40 years old and is married. She has 3 children who attend school. For the past three years, Mariama has been selling staple foods, such as rice and fish, and cooking supplies at one of the major junctions in town. The group is seeking a loan of 1.5 million LE, with which all three members will be able to expand their businesses and increase their incomes.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of their roadside shops

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en: The Believe in God Group is made up of Kadiatu B., Isata J., and Mariatu K.. They are seeking a loan of 1.5 million LE from SMT and Kiva lenders. Kadiatu is the group’s leader, and she has worked for 4 years selling ready-to-wear children’s clothing. She is 29 and married to a businessman with whom she has one young child. With her share of the group loan, Kadiatu is hoping to improve her business and income.

loans.use: Expanding inventory of ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Go Bifo Group

texts.en: The Go Bifo Group is made up of Frances I. S., Janet S., and Isatu K., businesswomen seeking a loan of 1.5 million LE from Kiva lenders and SMT. Frances is the group’s leader, and she is single with no children. For the past two years, Frances has had a business making and selling “gara lappas”, a type of locally dyed cloth. With her portion of the loan, she will be able to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: Buy more stock to create and sell traditional dyed cloth

loans.name: Alhadi Islamic Primary School Group

texts.en: The Alhadi Islamic Primary School was established in 1996, and with a staff of 18 people it currently serves 702 pupils. Several of the teachers of Alhadi Islamic have joined together to seek a loan for various reasons and purposes (some to pay school fees, some to invest in their personal side-business, and others to make household improvements). Abu B. B. is 38 and married to a tradeswoman with four children. Abu is seeking the loan in order to increase his income to the point where he is able to make much-needed improvements on his family’s home.

loans.use: Much needed home repairs

loans.name: Isatu's Group

texts.en: Isatu’s Group is made up of Isatu K., Marie K., and Gelikatu K., a group of women who sell fish around town. Isatu, the leader, has been in business for 5 years. At 40 years old, she has two children attending school and is married to a construction worker. This is the first loan sought by this group, and with the 1.5 million LE requested from Kiva lenders and SMT, they hope to expand their businesses, add new inventory, and generate more income for themselves and their families.

loans.use: Expand inventory of dried and fresh fish

loans.name: Diara

texts.fr: Madame Diarra B. est une sociétaire  très  expérimentée  au sein de la caisse de Baye Laye car ayant déjà rembourse cinq prêts  antérieurs.L’objet de son prêt est  l’achat d’huile de palme pour renforcer son stock. C’est une commerçante  qui a une activité très diversifiée.Elle a pris trois cantines jumelées en location  au marche de guediawaye ou elle exerce ses activités. En dehors de l’huile de palme qu’elle commercialise elle vend aussi des tissus et des produits d’entretien comme par exemple les detergents.Elle capitalise quatre ans d’expérience dans le domaine de l’aviculture. Elle est soutient de famille car elle est mariée  et mère de dix enfants dont l’âge varie entre 9 et 31 ans en plus elle a une autre personne a sa charge. C’est la raison pour la quelle elle est plus motivée pendant les veilles de fêtes  comme la Tabaski Korite ou Fin d’années  période ou l’activité  est plus rentable. Son but est de renforcer son épargne satisfaire ses besoins personnels payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et réaliser la chose qu’elle a toujours rêve c'est-à-dire faire voyager son fils aine.
texts.en:
Ms. Diarra B. is a member with a lot of experience within the branch office of Baye Laye because of having already had five previous loans. The purpose of her current loan is to buy palm oil for bolstering her inventory. She is a merchant with highly diversified businesses. She has rented three twin stalls at the Guediawaye marketplace where she operates. Besides the palm oil that she markets, she also sells cloth and maintenance products, for example, detergents. She capitalizes on four years of experience in the field of poultry farming. She supports the family because she is married and the mother of ten children, who vary in age from 9 to 31 years. Plus, she has another person in her care. For these reasons, she is more motivated during this period ahead of the holidays, such as Tabaski, Korite, or New Year's Day, when business is the most profitable. Her goals are to bolster her savings, to meet her personnel needs, to cover the costs of schooling her children, and to realize what she has always dreamed of, that is, to have her eldest son travel.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 1-4 Group

texts.en:
Mary is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Desarrollo (Women in Development), based in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic, and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Mary lives in Mata de Palma (Palm Tree), a small community northwest of San Pedro. She is a single mother with four children, ranging in age from two to twelve. Mary and her children live in a typical Dominican home with a cement floor, wooden panel walls and an aluminum roof. It shelters them from the rain, but is not secure and can be unsafe during hurricane season. In addition, Mary lacks reliable electricity and running water, and with just two rooms in the home and growing children, space is limited.

Despite these difficulties, Mary runs a successful business selling undergarments from her home. This is Mary’s fourth loan with Esperanza, and to date she has a perfect repayment record. With additional revenues coming in, Mary hopes to expand her business by selling shirts, pants and blouses. She would also like to make improvements to her home, such as constructing walls using cement blocks for more security and safety. Mary also hopes to send all four of her children to university so they can become professionals and have opportunities that were not available to her when she was their age. Thank you for lending to Mary and the Mujeres en Desarrollo group!

loans.use: Purchasing undergarments, shirts, and pants

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
VERONICA DURAND M., (A QUIEN APRECIAMOS SENTADA EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA) TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVE  CON SU PAREJA Y TIENE UNA HIJTA PEQUEÑA DE  5 AÑITOS. ELLA INTEGRA  Y ES TESORERA DEL GRUPO “MUJERES TRIUNFADORAS”, JUNTO A 7 INTEGRANTES MAS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA EL CARMEN, EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
LA SRA. VERÓNICA, ES ESPECIALISTA EN LAS VENTAS, APROVECHA LOS PRODUCTOS DE TEMPORADA PARA HACER SU NEGOCIO. DURANTE TODO EL AÑO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, Y AHORA QUE ESTAMOS CERCA DE LA NAVIDAD, NVERTIRÁ EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO EN COMPRAR PANETONES, EL CUAL OFRECERÁ A SUS FAMILIARES, AMIGOS Y COMPAÑEROS DE TRABAJO DE SU PAREJA.
DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA ELLA EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR, A LOS 5 AÑOS AYUDABA A SU MAMÁ EN LA VENTA DE REFRESCOS, SIGUIENDO SU EJEMPLO , A LOS DOCE AÑOS SE INDEPENDIZA EN EL NEGOCIO Y COLOCA SU PUESTO DE JUGOS, CON ÉSTE TRABAJO ELLA PUDO AYUDAR A SUS PADRES ECONÓMICAMENTE PARA LACOMPRA DE SUS ÚTILES ESCOLARES CUANDO ERA ESTUDIANTE.
HOY EN DÍA SUS VENTAS LE PERMITE CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE EDUCACIÓN DE  SU HIJA QUIEN ESTUDIA EN UN COLEGIO PARTICULAR.
texts.en:
Veronica D. M., who we see seated in the photograph, is 31 years-old and lives with her partner and her young, 5 year-old daughter. Veronica forms a part and is the treasurer of the group "Mujeres Triunfadoras" (Winning Women), along with 7 other members. The members of the group are all residents of the El Carmen area in the district of Carabayllo. Veronica specializes in sales, and takes advantages of seasonal products to earn money. During the whole year she sells beauty products, but now that we are near Christmas time she will invest the loan funds in the purchase of small cakes, which she will then sell to relatives, friends, and her husband's coworkers. Victoria has been working since a very young age. At the age of 5 she helped her mother sell sodas, and then, following her example, at the age of 12 had her own independent business and added a juice stand. With this job Victoria helped her parents with the purchase of her school supplies when she was a student. Today her sales pay for the cost of education for her daughter who studies in a private school.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of small cakes for resale

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Juan A. de 41 años de edad,  vive en un barrio marginal en donde tiene que vivir pendiente ya que ha logrado poner su negocio bastante surtido y la delincuencia anda en robadera todo esto debido a la educación de los padres, la mala economía, que atraviesa el país, no hay empleo. Gracias a su buena inversión con financiamiento ha mejorado sus ventas, su esposa e hijos le ayudan a despachar para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, tiene seis años de administrándola y gracias a los préstamo la hecho crecer en inventario. Con este financiamiento comprara granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, golosinas, cereales, productos de limpieza personal y una variedad de productos para ofertar. Espera vender mas y poder cada día hacer mejoras En su vivienda para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación para que sean personas de bien. muy contento con  Afodenic por dar la oportunidad a pequeños comerciante para iniciar nuestro propio negocio.
texts.en:
Juan A., 41, lives in a slum-like neighborhood where crime is common due to poor parenting and the difficult economic situation the country is presently in where unemployment is high. He has to be very vigilant of his store to protect his stock. Thanks to his good investment of financing his sales have improved. His wife and children help him tend the shop to provide his customers with good service. He has been administering his store for the past 6 years and, thanks to the loan, he has been able to increase his inventory. With this present loan he plans to buy basic grains, meats, dairy products, snacks, cereals and personal cleaning supplies as well as a variety of other products to offer. He hopes to increase his sales so that he can make improvements to his home and offer his children a better education so that they will grow up to be good citizens. He is very happy with Afodenic for the opportunity it gives small businessmen to start their own business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meats, dairy products, snacks, cereals and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia G. S. es una señora muy trabajadora que ha logrado muchos propósitos y también que hemos observado que es una persona responsable con el crédito, ella con este va por su tercer préstamo de esta institución los anteriores los utilizo para mejorar su vivienda en el que ella esta muy agradecida por que pudo realizar su proyecto. Ella siempre trabajo como  estilista desde hace 10 años y su negocio lo tiene establecido en otra parte de la ciudad donde ha tomado clientela por que confían en su trabajo. El salón de belleza es llamado “ESTETICA KENIA” por el que ahora requiere de un automóvil para poder trabajar ya es muy requerida por sus clientas para que el trabajo lo realice en casa como cuando es una boda, quinceañera o un evento especial. Patricia esta viendo mas oportunidades de trabajo es por ello que requiere de este carro para poder darle gusto a sus clientes y si sea recomendada para ella obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Patricia G. S. is a very hard-working woman who has achieved many things, and also we have observed that she is a responsible person with credit. This will be her third loan with this institution. The previous ones were used to improve her home, for which she is very thankful, because she was able to carry out her project. She has worked as a stylist for 10 years, and she established her business in another part of the city, where she has built up a clientele because they trust her work. The beauty salon is called "ESTETICA KENIA", for which she now requires an automobile. It is required by her clients so that the work can be carried out in their home, when there is a wedding, a quinceañera (15th birthday party for girls), or other special events. Patricia is seeing more job opportunities, for which she requires this car, in order to please her clients and obtain a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An automobile to help with her business

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel Jáuregui es un soldador desde hace 6 años el su negocio llamado “Taller de Soldadura Jáuregui”   esta ubicado en su domicilio para estar cerca de la familia. El piensa en el porvenir y el patrimonio de sus hijos, es por ello que el trabaja con mucha dedicación para darles mejor calidad de vida. El en la herrería hace variedad de trabajos como protecciones para las ventanas, puertas, portones y otros. Ahora el esta requiriendo de una maquina para soldar por que la tiene ya ha tenido mucho uso el cual  se esta deteriorando y empieza a fallar. El viene a nuestra institución para pedir el apoyo para obtener el capital que esta requiriendo para comprar esa maquina para no detener el trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel J. has been a welder for 6 years in his business called "Taller de Soldadura J.". It is located in his home in order to be close to his family. He is thinking about the future and the inheritance of his children. For this reason, he works with a lot of dedication in order to give them a better quality of life. In his workshop he does a variety of jobs, such as making window protectors, doors, gates, and other things. Now he requires a welding machine, because the one he has is deteriorating and beginning to fail, due to a lot of use. He has come to our institution requesting the support to obtain the necessary capital to purchase this machine, in order to not stop his work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita A. lives in the village of Prk. Mabinuligon, Barangay Sampinit, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She is 62 years old but still strong and healthy enough to earn a living. She is married to Nolito A., who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with eleven children, ten of whom already have their own a families but also help support their parents. Only one child remains single. Nenita and Nolito have ten grandchildren. Ten years ago, Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could put up her own business and help her husband support their very large family. Because her husband was a farmer and there were many rice farms in their area, Nenita decided to put up a rice retailing business with the help of her loans from NWTF-PD. She bought newly-harvested unmilled rice from the farmers at a much lower cost and made money by having the rice milled and retailing the polished rice within her community and in the neighboring villages. The income from Nenita’s business was able to help her family a lot, enabling them to pay for tuition fees and other household expenses. Earning an average monthly income of PHP 5,000, the business helped improve the family's living conditions, and it became a crucial source of income when her husband got sick two years ago. It is now a major source of income for her family, but Nenita plans to restock and reopen her general store to supplement her present income. In her previous loan Nenita borrowed Php 18,000 for her rice retailing business. The loan was, as usual, fully repaid on time without any delays. Now, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing Php 18,000 for her business and to reopen her general store. She intends to use the income to pay for her husband's medicines and support her household expenses. Nenita is considered as one of the pioneers of NWTF-Project Dungganon, Bago Branch. She is a very active member and consistently maintains her record as a good repayer. Nenita is shown in the accompanying photo posing with sacks of rice from her rice retailing business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams, earning the respect of people in their community. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - to be called Honorable is a mark of respect that everyone hopes to attain in one’s lifetime.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business and to restock her general store

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Maria de Jesús C. de 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores los cuales trabajan y le ayudan  su pequeño negocio es la venta de café, pan, comida,  y tiene 26 años vendiendo, y ha logrado tener su clientela, comenzó  con  préstamos y su objetivo ha sido mejorar su casa para tener una casa digna. Vive en barrio marginal donde hay aguas negras,  preocupante ya que cada familia tiene que pagar los gastos para hacer su sumidero y poder estar en condiciones higiénicas, sus planes es poder ampliar su negocio, vender mas. Con este crédito comprara zinc para cambiar una hoja mala que tiene en el techo y no quiere sufrir otro invierno más ya que tiene que mover sus cosa para que no se frieguen, también comprara cerámica para poner en la sala y poder estar en condiciones mejores todo esto gracias a los financiamiento de Afodenic que da las gracias por hacer posible los sueños de cada familia Nicaragüense
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de Jesus C. is a 47-year-old single mother of 6 older children who work and help her with her small business, in which she sells coffee, bread, and food. She has done this for 26 years and has managed to build up a clientele. She began with loans and her objective has been to improve her house in order to have a decent place to live. She lives in a neighborhood in the outlying area of the city, where there is contaminated water, which is troubling since each family has to pay expenses to make their own drain and be able to be in hygenic conditions. Her plans are to expand her business and sell more. With this credit she will purchase zinc in order to change out a bad sheet on her roof. She does not want to suffer through another winter this way, since she has to move her things so they don't get ruined. Also, she will buy ceramics to put in the living room and improve the conditions, all thanks to the financing of Afodenic, which makes possible the dreams of every Nicaraguan family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc to replace some sheets on her roof and ceramics to put in her living room

loans.name: Inés Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce del departamento de León, el señor R. ha comenzado a trabajar en su pequeña pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos los cuales son ofrecidos en su propia casa de habitación donde a diario oferta tales productos con el propósito de obtener el sustento para su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día, el señor Ines ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para la pulpería. Entre los productos que comprará se encuentran los comestibles y las golosinas. Espera en que el crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así continuará ofreciendo sus productos en la pulpería ubicada en El Sauce específicamente en la comarca Los Tololos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ines R. operates a grocery store out of his home in the El Sauce municipality of Leon, where he sells a variety of products with the purpose of earning income to maintain his home. Mr. Ines has requested a loan so he can invest in the purchase of merchandise for his store. Amongst some of the products he will purchase are food and snack products. He hopes he will receive this loan so he can continue to offer many products in his store, which is located specifically in the district of Los Tololos.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: La Beneficencia 2, 4, & 5 Group

texts.en:
Crismena is a 25-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator of her group, La Beneficencia (Charity), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Crismena lives in Batey El Cea, a small community to the northwest of San Pedro. Bateyes are small communities built by sugar companies for their field workers. They are synonymous with poverty and lack any kind of reliable electricity, have no running water, and are far from the nearest medical institutions. Crismena lives in a small and simple wooden home with her husband and three of their four children, the youngest of whom is three.

Despite her family’s difficulties, Crismena runs a successful business from a stand outsiD. her home by selling clothing and fruit to her neighbors and friends. Clothing sales bring in more profit, but the fruit is a stabilizing source of income for the sporadic clothing sales. When asked about her experience before and after working with her loans, Crismena said she and her family “are doing well now; we continue to move forward and won’t return [to the life we had before.]”

This is Crismena’s fifth loan with Esperanza International and, to date, she has a perfect repayment record. Thank you for lending to Crismena and La Beneficencia group!

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her clothing and fruit business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina G. se ha destacado en el municipio de El Sauce por elaborar deliciosas tortillas las que son ofrecidas en su establecimiento donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana le visitan sus clientes para comprarlas.

La señora Rosalina elabora y vende tortillas los tres tiempos de comida a los pobladores del barrio La estación del municipio de El Sauce y el crédito fue solicitado para la compra de leña, maíz, cal, los cuales son los insumos indispensables para la elaboración de las tortillas. Es por esto que ella espera en que su crédito será proporcionado por la institución y de esta manera mejorará la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalina G. has distinguished herself in the town of El Sauce by elaborating delicious tortillas. She sells them from her establishment, where beginning in the early hours of the morning customers come to purchase them. Rosalina makes and sells the tortillas before all three meal times to the people of the neighborhood "La estación" of El Sauce. The loan funds would be used to purchase firewood, corn, and lime, the three ingredients necessary for the production of tortillas. For this reason Rosalina hopes the loan will be approved by the institution and allow her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva P. lives in the village of Brgy. Buenavista, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She is 51 years old and married to Francisco P., a farmer. They are blessed with three children, one of whom has a family already while the other two are still attending school. One of Nieva's dreams is for her two children to finish their education so that they are able to earn a good income and help her in the future.

While her children were growing up, Nieva realized that she could not rely totally on the income her husband earned from farming. This is because it could sometimes be very volatile and dependent on so many external factors, including the weather, that may affect the volume of production. Added to this was also the increasing expense of educating her children. This is why Nieva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 so that she could access capital to start a general store. Using her loans over the next few years, Nieva continued to expand her operations, and began to include frozen products. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP – a very respectable income that has been a great help in improving her family's quality of life.

In her last loan, Nieva borrowed 11,000 PHP, which she used as additional capital for her general store and frozen products. She paid off that loan on time each week until it was fully paid. This time, she is borrowing another 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use to restock her general store and purchase more products to sell.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams, and earning the respect of people in their community. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" – to be called "Honorable" is a mark of respect that everyone hopes to attain in their lifetime.

loans.use: To restock her general store and purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos G. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en Laureles norte, es soldador desde hace diez años el cual inicio con fondos propios, viudo y con siete hijos mayores de edad,  los cuales le apoyan, la dificultad es que el trabajo a veces no le llega, y el dinero se escasea los cuales sus objetivo se no proyectan, debido a las crisis económica que esta pasando nuestro país, lo cual viene a desmejorar la economía, los precios de la canasta básica ha incrementado  y a veces el pan de cada día se hace difícil. Con este préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro lateral de su casa ya que en el barrio hay mucha delincuencia lo cual uno vive ala expectativa de ellos ya que con mucho sacrificio uno tiene sus cosas y de la nada se la roban. Es por eso la necesidad de cerrar su casa. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer posible sus metas.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos G. is 54 years-old and lives in northern Laureles. Carlos has been working as a welder for 10 years, a business he started with his own funds. He is a widow and has seven adult children who support him. The difficult part of this business is that sometimes there is no work and money becomes scarce, making it difficult to carry out plans. Due to the economic crisis that is happening in our country, that is hurting the economy, the prices of basic groceries have increased and sometimes it is even difficult to put bread on the table. With this loan Carlos would buy construction materials to build a side wall on his house because there is a lot of crime in the neighborhood and it is necessary to take precautions. Sometimes one can sacrifice a lot to earn their possessions and then out of nowhere they are stolen. For this reason it is necessary to close off the side of the house. Carlos is grateful to the institution for giving him the opportunity to make his goals possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stone, cement, iron, and sand to make a side wall on a house

loans.name: Yrene

texts.en:
Yrene lives in San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is 62 years old and a single mother of five children, with the youngest child still living at home. She also takes care of one of her grandchildren. Yrene lives in one of the poorer neighborhoods of San Pedro. Although most homes in the city have access to running (although undrinkable) water and electricity, Yrene’s neighborhood does not receive these utilities.

Despite these difficulties, Yrene runs a successful business selling used and new clothing to her friends and neighbors. Her shop is at the side of her home in a small room made from cement blocks. Yrene dreams of building a business that is separate from her home. This is her second loan with Esperanza International, and she says that while her loans may not be for a large amount, they have helped her a lot. Thank you for lending to Yrene!

loans.use: To purchase new and used clothing

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es: María Irene M. G. es originaria del departamento de La Libertad, es madre soltera, actualmente vive con su hijo quien ya la hizo abuela. María y su hijo Carlos siempre se han tendido mutuamente, son más que una madre e hijo, María manifiesta que su hijo lo es todo en su vida y lo único que ella tiene, y por el que ha trabajado arduamente para sacarle adelante, aunque ahora Carlos ya es hombre independiente económicamente, pero María sigue trabajando en su negocio por el cual es muy conocida en su cantón, es una tienda de productos de consumo para el hogar, la genera ganancias a María, ya que en la zona no hay muchas tiendas, ahora ella solicita de un crédito para poder surtir su negocio y bastecerse de nueva mercadería.
texts.en:
María Irene M. G. is from the La Libertad department. She is a single mother. She currently lives with her son; he has now made her a grandmother. María and her son, Carlos, have always taken care of each other. They are more than mother and son. María says that her son is everything in her life, and he is the only thing she has. She has worked arduously to get him ahead. Even though Carlos is now an economically independent man, María keeps working in her business for which she is very well known in her county. The store carries consumable products for the home. It generates income for María because there are not many stores in the area. She is now asking for a loan to be able stock her store with new merchandise. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana Del Carmen M. D. C. D. 61 años D. edad, originaria del departamento D. Ahuachapán, vive con su esposo don Carlos D. 70 años D. edad, quien se encuentra ya jubilado. Hace treinta años que Juana inicio su negocio, con el cual ayudado todo una larga trayectoria a su esposo ahora don Carlos se encuentra jubilado y Juana genera los ingresos a través D. su negocio con los cuales logran pagar los gastos fijos, Juana como una mujer visionario tiene la idea D. invertir este crédito en productos para surtir su tienda y así generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana Del Carmen M. D. C., 61, is from the Ahuachapán district. She lives with her 70 year old husband, Carlos. He is retired. Thirty years ago Juana started her business. With the business she helped Carlos with everything for a long time. Now that Carlos is retired, Juana generates the income through her business to pay their fixed expenses. As a visionary woman, Juana has the idea to use this loan to buy products to stock her store and generate greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Emma Estela

texts.es: ENMA TIENE 56 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA, TIENE 6 HIJOS YA TODOS SON CASDOS, NACIO EN UN MUNICIPIO DEL PAIS, LOCALIZADO A 40 KILOMETROS DE LA CIUDAD DE GUATEMALA EMPEZO SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ARTICULOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO HACE 5 AÑOS CUANDO SE TRASLADO A VIVIR A UNA COMUNIDAD A LA ORILLAS DE LA CIUDAD DE GUATEMALA, CUANDO ELLA COMENZO SU NEGOCIO, NO HABIA OTRO NEGOCIO EN SU COMUNIDAD POR LO QUE EL MISMO ERA MUY IMPORTANTE PARA LOS VECINOS DE LA COMUNIDAD ELLA VENDA MUCHAS COSAS NECESARIAS PARA LAS PERSONAS D DE SU COMUNIDAD COMO FRIJOL, ARROZ, MAIZ, AZUCAR. ETC. ENTRE MUCHAS COSAS TAMBIEN TIENE A LA VENTA ARTICULOS PARA FERRETERIA Y MEDICINA, EMMA NECESITA EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER SURTIR MAS LA TIENDA YA QUE SUS CLIENTES NECESITAN QUE ELLO COLOQUE MAS PRODUCTOS. ELLA CONFIA QUE EL PRESTAMO LE AYUDARA PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Enma, 56, is married and has six married children. She was born in a municipality of the country that is located 40 kilometers from the city of Guatemala. Five years ago, when she moved to live in a community on the edge of the city of Guatemala, she started her business of selling daily consumable products. When she started her business there was not another business in her community. Therefore, her business was very important to her neighbors in the community. She sells a lot of necessary things to the people in her community. She sells things like beans, rice, corn, sugar, and may more things. She also sells hardware and medicines. Enma needs a loan to be able to stock her store more. Her customers need her to place more products. She has confidence that the loan will help her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy daily consumable products

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia G. reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad y estudiantes. Ana apoya a su esposo con los gastos que requiere tener un hogar con cuatro hijos, Luis el esposo de Ana, recibe un sueldo muy bajo $180.00 US mensuales, con los cuales no logra cubrir todos los gastos y necesidades de la familia, es por ello que Ana inicio su negocio instalándolo en su casa, para generar ganancias que son un gran pilar en la estabilidad económica de la familia G., ahora ella solicita de un crédito para seguir ampliando su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Julia G. lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and their four minor children. The children attend school. Ana helps her husband with the expenses that they have for a household with four children. Luis, her husband, receives a very low monthly salary of $180.00 US. With this salary he cannot cover the family expenses and necessities. That is why Ana started her business, which is installed in her house. She did it to generate earnings, which are the great pillar of economic stability for the G. family. She is now asking for a loan to continue expanding her business. This will help her improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy chicken and traditional Mayan blouses

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro Antonio V. O. reside en el departamento de La Libertad, con su esposa y sus dos hijos Pedrito de 9 años y Laura de 3 años de edad. Pedro tiene ocho años en el negocio de motorista, donde inicio como un empleado y ahora se ha comprado su propia unidad de trasporte, la cual tiene trabajando. Pedro posee un bus el cual tiene un recorrido estipulado, su deseo es seguir creciendo , pero es muy difícil hoy en día en El Salvador en este rubro de negocios ,  ya que estas personas se encuentran amenazadas con muchos  chantajes por parte de delincuentes, quienes les demandan cuotas económicas, si bien el negocio de Pedro es difícil, pero es el único medio con el cual él puede sostener a su familia, ahora solo esta solicitando de tu ayuda con un crédito para poderle comprar repuestos a su autobús y así seguir brindando la seguridad que sus pasajeros se merecen.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio V. O. lives in the department of La Libertad with his wife and two children, Pedrito (age 9) and Laura (age 3). He has eight years of experience in the transportation business. Pedro started out as an employee, but he now operates his own mode of transportation. He has a bus that travels on a predetermined route.

Pedro desires to continue growing his business, but it is very difficult to be in the transportation sector in El Salvador at the moment because operators are threatened by many criminals who demand bribes. Business conditions are challenging, but this is Pedro’s only means of supporting his family. He is now requesting your help through a loan so that he can buy spare parts for his bus. This will allow him to continue providing safe transportation that all of his passengers deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his bus

loans.name: Kelly Betzabeth

texts.es: Kelly Betzabeth H. D. D. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Colon municipio del departamento D. La Libertad. Kelly vive con su esposo y su hijo Noé D. 17 años D. edad estudiante D. básica. José el esposo D. Kelly se dedica a las ventas D. manera ambulante y ha Kelly la ha apoyado a instalar un negocio donD. venD. variedad D. artículos como zapatos, perfumes, ropa entre otros. El deseo D. esta paraje es seguir ampliando su negocio con mayor cantidad D. mercadería y es por ello que ahora Kelly solicita D. un crédito para comprar nuevos productos par su negocio.
texts.en:
Kelly Betzabeth H. D. D. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Colon in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and son Noé, who is a 17 year old student. Kelly’s husband José is a traveling merchant and she helps him by selling various items such as shoes, perfumes, clothing, and other products from a fixed location. The couple hopes to increase their business by securing a large quantity of merchandise. For this reason, Kelly is requesting a loan to purchase new products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Rosa María  De La Paz

texts.es: Rosa María D. La Paz S. D. P. resiD. en el pintoresco pueblo D. Panchimalco del área metropolitana D. San Salvador. Rosa tiene 49 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos D. 19, 12 y 11 años D. edad, todos estudiantes. Rosa maneja su propio negocio donD. venD. todo tipo D. frutas y verduras, las que los clientes prefieren por la excelente calidad y precios que ella ofrece, Rosa desea seguir ampliando su negocio surtiéndolo D. mayor cantidad D. frutas que muchos le demandan, para esto es que ella solicita D. un crédito con el cual pueda comprar nueva mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa María D. La Paz S. D. P. lives in the picturesque town of Panchimalco in the metropolitan area of San Alvador. Rose is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three sons, (19, 12, and 11) who are all students. Rosa runs her own business selling all kinds of fruits and vegetables. Her clients prefer her produce because of the excellent quality and the prices she offers. Rosa wishes to grow her business by expanding her inventory and offering more fruits requested by her clients. She will use the loan to purchase new produce for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.es: Francisca Elena Q. M. residente del pueblo de Santiago Nonualco del departamento de La Paz. A sus 57 años de edad Francisca sigue siendo una persona alegre y con gran empeño en su negocio una venta de antojitos y productos como golosinas y bebidas, el cual ha manejado ya por una larga trayectoria de veinte años, Francisca manifiesta que su negocio ha ido mejorando con los años gracias a créditos otorgados que le han permitido consolidar su negocio y crecer económicamente, ella solicita ahora de un nuevo préstamo para poder así seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de materia prima para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Francisca Elena Q. M. lives in the town of Santiago Nonualco in the department of La Paz. At 57 years old Francisca is still a happy person and a hard worker. She has run her business selling fast food, snacks, and drinks for 20 years. Francisca says that her business has been improving over the years thanks to the loans she has received. These loans have allowed her to consolidate and grow her business. She is now applying for a loan in order to continue investing in her business by purchasing supplies and increasing her production.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Silvia Ester

texts.es: Silvia Ester L. C. reside en el municipio de Cojutepeque del departamento de Cuscatlán. Silvia tiene 53 años de edad vive con su hija y sus dos nietas de 11 y 8 años de edad. Silvia crio sola a su hija quien es ahora toda una mujer, que  ha dado sus dos únicos nietos, para Silvia el tener su propio negocio la hacen sentir independiente y activa, ella posee un puesto en el mercado municipal de Cojutepeque donde vende cereales y  otros productos como huevos, cuadernos entre otros. El destino del crédito que solicita Silvia es para invertir en productos para su local como detergentes, comida para aves, huevos y cereales.
texts.en:
Silvia Ester L. C. lives in the municipality of Cojutepeque in the deparment of Cuscatlán. Silvia is 53 years old and lives with her daughter and her two granddaughters (11 and 8). Silvia raised her daughter to womanhood as a single mom. Having her own business makes Silvia feel independent and active. She has a stall in the municipal market of Cojutepeque where she sells basic grains and other products like eggs, notebooks, and other things. Silvia will use her loan to purchase products for business like detergent, bird food, eggs, and grains. .

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza A. originaria de Candelaria del departamento de Cuscatlán, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 21, 14, 11 y 5 años de edad. José esposo de María trabaja como albañil y María se dedica a su negocio con veintidós años de experiencia en la elaboración de puros, las ventas que María realiza son dos veces por semana, cuando ella sale a ofrecer su producto, pero todos días tiene que trabajar en la producción de los mismos para acumular una cantidad suficiente para vender, ella solicita un crédito para invertir en materia prima y así aumentar la producción de puros.
texts.en:
María Esperanza A. from Candelaria in the department of Cuscatlán lives with her husband and her four children (21, 14, 11, and 5). José, María's wife, works as a mason, and María has worked for 22 years operating a cigar-making business. María sells her cigars twice a week, but she works every day making her product to accumulate enough to sell. She is applying for a loan to invest in prime materials and thus increase her production of cigars.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of prime materials to make cigars

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María G. C. reside en la capital del país San Salvador. Ana tiene 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hijo, de 10 años de edad, su madre , un hermano y sus dos sobrinos. Ana posee una gran experiencia comercializando todo tipo de productos, desde hace veinte cuatro años ella se dedica a las  ventas de manera ambulante, ahora ella maneja un pequeño inventario de productos cosméticos desde su casa, negocio que pretende ampliar a través de tu ayuda, el destino del crédito que ella solicita es para comprar variedad de productos y marcas para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana María G. C. lives in the capital San Salvador. Ana is 47 years old. She is single mother and lives with her 10-year old son, her mother, her brother, and two nephews. Ana has a lot of experience selling all kinds of products for the last 24 years door-to-door. Now she has a small inventory of cosmetic products from her home. She hopes to grow this business through your support. The loan she receives will be used to purchase a variety of products and brands to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es: Claudia Guadalupe G. A., reside en el departamento de Sonsonate junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad y estudiantes. Claudia tiene tan solo 27 años de edad y tuvo que pasar por la pérdida de su ser amado, ella es una mujer viuda quien no tiene apoyo económico ni respaldo de nadie, solo cuida de sus hijos quienes son la inspiración y deseo de superación para Claudia, quien se ha dedicado de lleno a su negocio la venta de verduras y ropa que sale a vender de manera ambulante, ella solicita de este crédito para invertir en sus negocio, así poder brindarle una mayor estabilidad económica a sus hijos a través de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Claudia Guadalupe G. A. lives in the department of Sonsonate with her two school-aged children. She is 27 years old and has already experienced the loss of her husband. Being a widow, Claudia does not receive financial support from anyone else. She is the only one taking care of her children, who provide her inspiration and motivation to succeed.

Claudia sells vegetables and clothing as a street vendor. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her business, increase her sales, and provide greater financial stability for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico tiene 33 años, vive en la casa de su madre, con ella, su pareja y madre de su hijo de 5 años, quien ya empezó sus estudios primarios.

Frente a la casa de su madre tiene en un pequeño espacio donde vende productos comestibles de primera necesidad (huevos, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc), además de bebidas heladas.
En esta actividad lleva un periodo de 8 años y atiende todos los días a cualquier hora del día, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y su madre, debido a que durante algunas horas se dedica (desde hace 13 años) también al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro.
Lo que le gusta a Federico de su tienda es que mediante las ganancias apoya con algunos gastos familiares y darles una buena atención a sus clientes es lo principal, menciona.
Además, le favorece que por esa zona es el único que cuenta con este tipo de negocio. Para el futuro quiere constituir un minimarket y así facilitar a sus vecinos con sus compras diarias.

Este es su 10mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que se apoyan entre todos y son muy unidos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad y así seguir implementando su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Federico is 33 years old. He and his partner live at his mother’s house. They have a 5 year old son who just started elementary school.

Next to his mother’s house, Federico has a small space where he sells basic necessities (eggs, noodles, rice, milk, bread, etc.) and cold beverages. He has been operating his store for 8 years and is open 24 hours a day. His wife and mother help out with the business. In addition, he spends a few hours transporting passengers in his motorcycle taxi, which he has been doing for 13 years.

Federico enjoys the fact that his store has provided income to cover some of their household expenses. However, he says providing good service to his customers is what is important. The competitive environment is favorable because he is the only one in his area with this type of business. In the future, he hopes to build a mini-market where his neighbors can come to make their daily purchases.

This is Federico’s tenth loan with MFP. He enjoys working with his Communal Bank because all the members are close and supportive of one another. The money he requested will be used to buy more consumer staples so that he can continue to manage his business properly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana (37 años) es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos; uno estudia en el colegio y el otro es un pequeño de 2 añitos.

Ella es muy buena en la elaboración de zapatos para damas, los mismos que adorna con bijouteria (piedras, perlas, cintas, y otros). Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años de manera continua, pero adicionalmente es profesora (hace 16 años) de nivel primario y trabaja en una institución educativa a 15 minutos de su casa.
Lo que le gusta a Ana de su trabajo es elaborar los zapatos porque se entretiene, le gustan las manualidades y espera satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, quienes son muy detallistas. Por otro lado, considera que sus negocio le es muy rentable porque sus zapatos los vende a sus compañeras de trabajo, madres de familia y sus vecinas, quienes no dudan en hacerle pedidos, los cuales Ana cobra al contado o al crédito. 
Para más adelante le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa, donde también venda los zapatos que confecciona.

Este es su 7mo créditos con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es todos sus compañeros son responsables y se llevan muy bien. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más suelas de zapatos y materiales para decorarlos (piedras, perlas, telas, etc.), así seguirá incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana is a 37 year old single mother of two children; one is a high school student while the other one is only two years old.

She is very skilled at making ladies shoes, adorning them with various decorations (jewels, pearls, ribbons, and other items). She has been engaged in this activity for 2 years, but she has also been working as an elementary school teacher for 16 years. She teaches at a school that is 15 minutes from her house.

Ana likes making shoes because it keeps her entertained. She enjoys crafts and hopes to satisfy the tastes of her retail customers. Ana considers her business to be very profitable because she is able to sell shoes to co-workers, working mothers, and neighbors. They do not hesitate to place orders, which Ana accepts with cash or on credit. In the future, she would like to open a clothing store where she can sell the shoes that she makes.

Ana is receiving her 7th loan with MFP. She like the fact that all the members of her Communal Bank are responsible and get along well with one another. With the loan she is requesting, Ana will purchase shoe soles and decorative materials (stones, beads, fabric, etc.) so that she can continue to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 51 años, vive con sus 4 hijos; 2 de ellos estudiantes y los otro dos, mayores de edad y ya trabajan. Es casada, su esposo trabaja en una compañía maderera.

Desde hace 5 años cuenta con una pequeña tienda de comestibles, siendo sus principales productos las frutas, verduras, carne de pollo, frijoles cocidos listos para comer, pescado y bebidas. Este negocio que lo tiene en un espacio al frente de su casa y gracias al primer crédito que obtuvo con MFP, mandó a construir un pequeño local adecuado para su tienda. 
Lo que le gusta a Dora de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y estar pendiente de los productos que necesitan, además considera que no es un trabajo cansado, pues atiende desde las 6:00 am hasta la 1:00 pm y debido a que está ubicada en una zona muy concurrida tiene gran cantidad de clientes y buenas ventas.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque entre todos se comprenden, son unidos, solidarios y sobre todo, responsables. Con 500 soles del dinero que ahora solicita comprará más frutas y verduras para seguir implementando su negocio. Con lo restante invertirá en la compra de zapatos, ya que una de sus hijas vive en una ciudad donde fabrican zapatos de buena calidad y bajos costos; por lo que Dora planea incursionar en este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Dora is 51 years old. She lives with her 4 children, 2 of them are students and the other two are adults and work. She is married, her husband works at a timber company.

For the past 5 years she has had a small grocery store, the main products being fruits, vegetables, chicken meat, pre-cooked beans ready for eating, fish, and beverages. This business is located at the front of her house and thanks to her first loan with MFP she was able to build small premises for her store. What Dora likes about her work is to serve her customers and administer the stock. She does not consider it hard work as she works from 6:00 am to 1:00 pm; the location of the store is popular and she has many customers and good sales.

This is her second loan with MFP and she likes to work with her group as they all understand each other, are united, solidary, and above all responsible. With the loan of 500 soles she will buy more fruits and vegetables to keep her business growing. The rest will be invested in buying shoes as one of her daughters lives in a town where they make good and inexpensive footwear, and Dora plans to iniciate this new business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Apolonia’s business is selling drinks, candies, and clothing in the city of Leon. She will use the loan to buy sodas, water, juices, caramels, clothing, and used toys. She has been working with CEPRODEL for about 4 years. With loans her business has grown in little increments she said. For instance, clothing and used toys are fairly new items for her store. They are more expensive to buy than the other items she sells.

 About 10 years ago she received permission from the Mayor’s office to set up her goods on the northwest corner of the Park of San Juan. Her store is open-air, underneath a tree that provides shade. This is a good location because many of the people who visit Leon or who are passing through go by this street corner. Apolonia is married with five children. Four of her children are school aged.
texts.en:
Apolonia’s business is selling drinks, candies, and clothing in the city of Leon. She will use the loan to buy sodas, water, juices, caramels, clothing, and used toys. She has been working with CEPRODEL for about 4 years. With loans her business has grown in little increments she said. For instance, clothing and used toys are fairly new items for her store. They are more expensive to buy than the other items she sells. About 10 years ago she received permission from the Mayor’s office to set up her goods on the northwest corner of the Park of San Juan. Her store is open-air, underneath a tree that provides shade. This is a good location because many of the people who visit Leon or who are passing through go by this street corner. Apolonia is married with five children. Four of her children are school aged.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, candies, clothing, and used toys

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa quien lo apoya en todas sus decisiones y objetivos. La casa donde habitan es propia, gracias al arduo trabajo en su juventud.

Desde hace 8 años tiene en su casa con un tanque de 50 metros de altura con el que abastece de agua a más de 100 familias de la zona donde vive. Adicionalmente, se dedica al oficio de maestro constructor y debido a su buena labor es contratado por varias personas.
Lo que le gusta a Eleuterio de sus labores es sentirse activo y útil ante la sociedad, además le satisface mucho su trabajo porque le genera los ingresos necesarios para vivir y seguir adelante. Para el futuro quiere mandar a construir otro tanque en un terreno que tiene a dos horas de distancia de su casa para abastecer de agua a las personas que necesiten.

Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son personas responsables y sobre todo, porque se ha ganado la confianza de ellos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará tubos para abastecer de agua a 50 personas más que requieren de este elemento útil en la vida diaria.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 60 years old, he lives with his wife who supports him with all his decisions and objectives. They own the house where they live, thanks to hard work in their youth.

For the past 8 years he has had a 50 meter tall tank from which he supplies more than 100 families in the area with water. Additionally he works as a building contractor and due to his good work he is hired by many people. What Eleuterio likes about his jobs is that he feels active and useful to society as well as satisfied with his work because it generates the necessary income to live and move ahead. For the future he wants to build another tank on land he owns two hours away from his home in order to distribute water to people that need it.

He has had 3 loans with MFP and he likes to work with his community bank as his partners are responsible and above all he has earned their trust. With the requested money he will buy tubes to supply 50 people, who need this useful element on a daily basis, with water.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tubes

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
El socio JORGE ANTONIO, pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 51 años de edad, es casado tiene 3 hijos (dos varones y una mujer), él trabaja como chofer de camiones hace 7 años, él y su hija tienen un pequeño negocio de venta y compra de plantas medicinales naturales de la región como la maca, llantén, uña de gato, etc., el es proveedor de estas plantas medicinales a pequeños comerciantes que se dedican a preparar bebidas peruanas tradicionales que utilizan estas plantas medicinales, el provee 50 kg. de estas hiervas naturales por semana obteniendo como ganancia S/. 100 nuevos soles, el socio necesita el crédito para poder comprar más plantas medicinales y así pueda  distribuir a más comerciantes e incrementar su distribución.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JORGE ANTONIO is a member of the community bank "PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES". He is from the town of Cusco.

The member is 51 years old, married with 3 children (two sons and one daughter). He has worked as a truck driver for 7 years. He and his daughter have a small business where they sell and buy medicinal plants that grow in the region, such as "maca", Ribwort Plaintain, "uña de gato", etc. He is the supplier of this medicinal plants to small dealers who prepare traditional Peruvian beverages containing these medicinal plants, he supplies them with 50 kg of natural herbs per week obtaining earnings of S/.100 "nuevos soles". The member needs the loan to buy more medicinal plants in order to distribute to more dealers and increase his distribution.

The member is grateful for the opportunity through this means and he promises to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell medicinal plants in the Andean region of Peru.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita tiene 56 años, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos y actualmente vive con una de sus hijas.

Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio lo tiene al frente de su casa, donde cuenta con un pequeño kiosco. Aquí Emerita brinda desayunos, jugos, almuerzo y bebidas, le pareció oportuno este negocio debido a estar ubicada cerca de un mercado y a una empresa petrolera, teniendo como principales consumidores a los trabajadores de dicha empresa.
Para la atención de los clientes tiene el apoyo de su hija y lo que más le gusta es preparar bien los alimentos que ofrece a sus clientes, para que se sientan satisfechos de su buena sazón. 
Para el futuro le gustaría tener un restaurante especializado en platos en base a pollo a la brasa, muy tradicionales en el país y son llamados “pollerías”.

Con MFP ya tiene 3 créditos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros y compañeras son sinceros, no tienen problemas y sobre todo, se apoyan mucho. Con el dinero que ahora solicita invertirá en la compra de ingredientes y utensilios necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Emerita is 56 years old, single with 3 children and at the present she lives with one of her daughters.

For 6 years she has been selling food, the business is located in front of her house where she has a small stand. Here Emerita offers breakfasts, juices, lunches, and beverages. She thought it was a good business as it is located close to a market and an oil company where the workers are her main customers. Her daughter supports her serving the clients and what she likes the most is to cook the food for her customers to make them feel satisfied because of her good seasoning. For the future she would like to have a restaurant, called "pollerías", which specializes in dishes made with grilled chicken, traditional dishes in the country.

She has had 3 loans with MFP and she likes to work with her community bank as all her partners are sincere, have no problems, and above all, support each other. With the money requested she will invest in buying ingredients and the necessary kitchenware to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 25 años, es madre de un pequeño de un año de edad, vive el casa de su madre, con ella y sus hermanos.

Actualmente viene refaccionando un espacio en su casa donde vende medicina natural y bebidas. Adicionalmente, desde hace un año, ha empezado a vender productos de belleza de casa en casa, para lo cual visita a sus amistades y vecinos para ofrecer su mercadería por medio de catálogos y los productos que tiene en stock.
Lo que le gusta a Evelyn de su trabajo es estar en contacto con sus clientes, con quienes comparte ideas y hace muchos amigos debido a su buena atención y jovialidad. 
Por otro lado, considera que su negocio le es rentable porque trabaja para una marca cosmética muy reconocida y sus clientes no dudan en hacerle pedidos.
Al deseo a futuro de Evelyn es tener un minimarket donde ofrezca variedad de productos a sus vecinos y clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y desde ya a notado que sus compañeros de banco comunal son confiables y responsables, por lo que está entusiasmada con el trabajo que empezarán a hacer con miras al progreso de sus respectivos negocios. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos de belleza, medicinas naturales y bebidas para incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a 25-year-old mother of a 1-year-old son who lives with her mother and siblings in her mother's home.
