 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to cook and sell

loans.name: Lacen Kome Tek Arach Judith Group

texts.en: Judith A. is a 50-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. For the last three years, she has made a living selling charcoal. She wants to expand her business, and has applied for this loan with the other members of her group so that she can buy more charcoal to sell. This will allow her to meet the demands of her customers, expand her business and pay for the cost of educating her children.

loans.use: to expand a small charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane K. is the leader of her group in Mukono. She is a hard-working and devoted lady who grows matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes and so on. She also makes local brew for sale as a wholesaler and at a retail price for her customers at her bar. She is happy that the loans help her buy quality seeds, employ manpower, and buy bananas and yeast to make her brew. She is a married woman with 10 children, five of whom are still in school. The rest work at various businesses. She needs a loan to help pay for her children’s school, to pay for farm work and to buy bananas and yeast needed to make her local brew.

loans.use: To buy seeds and labor for her farm and raw materials for making her local brew.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy loves cooking. That is why she owns a restaurant. She has been in this business for a long time. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is 34 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Kayanga

texts.en:
Kayanga M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour and millet to sell.  Kayanga is 40 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family settlement. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour and millet to sell

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline S. sells cooking oil and onions and requests a loan to purchase more jerry cans of cooking oil to sell.  Evaline is 36 years old and is married to a policeman. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop and build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Subhiyya

texts.en:
Subhiyya is a Palestinian women living at Al-Yamoun village near Jenin with around 17,000 inhabitants. She is married with seven children: five girls and two boys, five of them still at school while the elder ones are studying in the university. Subhiyya’s husband is an employee at the Palestinian National Authority and he helps her in managing her business in the evenings.

Subhiyya established her business two years ago, and it is located in a lively neighborhood in the village. She sells kitchenware and equipment, glasses, pans, gifts, etc.

Subhiyya needs 1,500 USD in order to buy new products for her shop. In the photo, she appears at her store with her husband.

loans.use: To buy new products for her shop

loans.name: Lacen Kome Tek Anema Harriet Group

texts.en: A. Harriet is a business lady, 24 years old and married with three children. Two of the children are schooling. She has been selling used clothes for over two months. She is requesting a loan to increase her capital so that she can really stock up on more clothes for her business. She is a promising business lady whose dream is to see her business prosper.

loans.use: To stock more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere sells provisions like noodles, beverages, detergent and washing soap at retail prices. She is 45 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N80, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She hopes to lift her business out of poverty. She says thanks to all who made the loan possible for her.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Yomeba

texts.en:
Yomeba C. sells maize flour and onions. She requests a loan to stock beans and rice to sell. Yomeba is 32 years old and is married to a peasant. She has seven children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni M. sells maize flour and groundnut paste. She requests a loan to purchase charcoal to sell.  Poni is 35 years old and is married to a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family and provide enough food.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kenneth's Group

texts.en: N. Kenneth is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a friendly and very hard working man. He is married with three children, the eldest being 8 years old. Kenneth has owned and run a retail shop in Namayuba for four years. He is able to make 48000/= in profits per week. He ensures that he has good and necessary stock for his customers, enabling him to save. In the future, he would like to buy a plot of land as well as to continuously pay his children’s school fees on time. Kenneth needs a loan to be able to restock his retail business for expansion.

loans.use: To restock his retail business with more goods.

loans.name: Lakeja

texts.en:
Lakeja R. sells local Sudanese bread cooked by frying in cooking oil. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour and cooking oil.  Lakeja is 25 years old and is married to a security guard. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family and provide enough food.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Can Wange Pe Aber Gifter Group

texts.en:
A. Gifter is a business lady, twenty six years old, who is married with two children, both schooling. She also has three dependents who are schooling, too.

Gifter has carried out her tailoring services business so far for three years. She is requesting the loan to add capital to her business stock by purchasing clothing material for making designs.

Gifter is an encouraging businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a screen and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchasing clothing material for making designs

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
N. Mary is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is the mother of four adult children and she takes care of three grandchildren, yet she is a widow herself.

Mary is a hardworking, friendly and devoted lady with a business making and supplying snacks to schools and to the general public. The snacks she makes include sumbusas (meat or vegetable pies) both for meat and for peas, doughnuts and chapattis (flat bread). She supplies them to a school owned by a white man. She is so grateful that she won this tender and her main worry now is ensuring that she has the needed supplies for the day.

Mary needs a loan to help buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder and so on to help make more snacks for sale.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making snacks to expand her business

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a 65-year-old married woman with three children aged between 30 and 50 years, none of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, school fees for her grandchildren and water and electricity bills.

Kasifa sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She buys her clothes from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and incurs additional transport costs to and from shopping. 

Kasifa has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for six years and is servicing her sixteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand clothes.

Kasifa is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Sirenas Group

texts.es:
Este unidad D. desarrollo (UD.) se llama Las Sirenas porque son todas mujeres.  Las UDEs son grupos D. más D. 10 personas que tiene una cuenta D. banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  Este grupo está ubicado en L. comunidad D. Tierra Blanca en el estado D. VeraC..  El grupo está conformado por  diez integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama C. Maria G. A..  C. Maria tiene 33 años, y tiene en total dos hijos (una niña  D. tres años y un niño D. cinco).  ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. colchas y necesita el préstamo para surtirse nuevamente D. colchas y ropa.  Nos comenta que elL. visita a sus clientes en sus domicilios, y son vecinos pero también tiene clientes D. otras comunidades.  Empezó este negocio cuando su prima L. visitó para ofrecerle que le ayudara a L. venta D. colchas que elL. podría llevar desD. Oaxaca.  C. Maria desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para comprar necesidades para sus hijos como libros, uniformes, leche, pañales, y medicina.

Su hermana, Milagros, es parte D. este grupo, Las Sirenas.  ElL. tiene 23 años.  ElL. apoya al negocio D. su madre, que cocina desD. L. casa y necesita el préstamo para L. compra D. maíz, harina, chiles, tomate, queso, y crema.  Los clientes vienen a L. casa por todas las horas del día para comprar su comida, como tortillas, gorditas, y empanadas.  Desean este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para crear otro negocio algún día, como una tienda D. abarrotes.

Jaquelin M. V. se dedica a L. renta D. mesas y sillas para eventos, como bodas, quinceaños (celebración D. cumplir los quince años) y bautizos para bebes.  Los eventos pueden ser D. 200 personas cada uno, y piD. este prestamos para comprar más sillas y mesa, porque a veces sus clientes piden sus servicios al mismo día, y podría servirles mejor.

Los otros siete integrantes son: 
Consuelo V. V., quien venD. zapatos
Yoshelin Gómez A. hace manualidades
Consuelo L. D. L. C. venD. perfumes
Juana R. M. venD. antojitos y dulces y empezar L. venta D. zapatos
Veronica A. L. que quiere vender joyería D. VeraC. 
Concepcion Rivera L. quiere vender ropa interior por catálogo
Maria del Carmen (no en L. foto) también quiere vender ropa interior
texts.en:
This Development Cooperative is called Las Sirenas because they are all women. Development Cooperatives are groups of more than ten people who have a bank account and have to meet weekly or biweekly to make their payments. They have a representative and a governing committee. This group is located in the Tierra Blanca community in the state of VeraC.. The group is comprised of ten members. C. Maria G. A. represents the group. C. Maria is 33 and has two children (a three year old girl and a five year old boy). She sells quilts, and she needs a loan to stock up on quilts and clothes. She says that she visits her customers in their homes. They are her neighbors, but she also has customers in other communities. She started this business when her cousin visited her. Her cousin offered to let her help selling quilts that she could bring from Oaxaca. C. Maria wants this loan to increase her business in order to get the income to buy her children the necessities like books, uniforms, milk, diapers, and medicine. Her sister, Milagros, is part of the Las Sirenas Group. She is 23. She helps with her mother’s business, which is cooking from home. She needs the loan to buy corn, flour, chilies, tomatoes, cheese, and cream. The customers come to the house at all hours of the day to buy her food. She sells things like tortillas, “gorditas” (a small thick tortilL. maD. from corn flour, split open and usually filled with chicken or meat, accompanied by salsa), and empanadas. They want this loan to increase their business in order to get earnings to some day create another business like a grocery store. Jaquelin M. V. rents out tables and chair for events like weddings, “quinceaños” (celebration of the 15th birthday), and baptisms for babies. There can be 200 people at each event. She is asking for a loan to buy more chairs and tables because sometimes customers ask for her services on the same day. This way she could serve them better. The other members are: Consuelo V. V.: Sells shoes Yoshelin Gómez A.: Makes handicrafts Consuelo L. D. L. C.: Sells perfumes Juana R. M.: Sells snacks and sweets and is starting to sell shoes Veronica A. L.: Wants to sell jewelry in VeraC. Concepcion Rivera L.: Wants to sell underwear by catalog Maria del Carmen (not in the photo): Also wants to sell underwear

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy quilts and clothes

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es:
APROXIMADAMENTE A 12KM DE LA CIUDAD DE CUAUTLA MORELOS SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EL POBLADO DE SAN MIGUEL ANENECUILCO PERTENECIENTE AL MUNICIPIO DE AYALA MORELOS.

EN ESTE POBLADO SE ENCUENTRA LA UDE LA CAPILLA CONFORMADO POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES 7 MUJERES Y 2 HOMBRES LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO, LA SRA. RAQUEL C. R., ROBERTA T. P. Y JOSE LUIS P. C. SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE ROPA, LA SRA. PORFIRIA R. G. Y ANGELA P. F. SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS,PERFUMES POR CATALOGO, LA SRA. ARACELI P. C. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO, JARED URIEL C. G. SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA DE PLATA PERO EN LOS PUEBLITOS ALEDAÑOS A SU COMUNIDAD, REYNA C. V. SE DEDICA A LA INDUSTRIA YA QUE FABRICA TRAJES, BLUSAS, PANTALONES Y HACE HECHURAS Y DOÑA ANTONIA G. M. QUE SE DEDICA  ALA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y LEGUMBRES Y DE LA CUAL LES HABLARE UN POCO.

LA SRA. ANTONIA G. M. ES CASADA CUENTA CON 59 AÑOS DE EDAD SUESPOSO TRABAJA DE TAXISTA VIVEN EN UNION LIBRE Y TIENEN 7 HIJOS PERO YA NINGUNO ESTA CON ELLOS YA QUE TODOS ESTAN CASADOS AHORITA SOLO TIENE A SU CARGO UN NIETO DE 16 AÑOS EL CUAL LE DEJO SU HIJA CUANDO EL TENIA 1 AÑO Y DOÑA ANTONIA  LO HA CRIADO DESDE ENTONCES ELLA FORMA PARTE DE LA UDE LA CAPILLA DESDE QUE SE INICIO EL GRUPO YA LLEVAN 6 CICLOS TRABAJANDO CON NOSOTROS NOS COMENTA QUE EL GRUPO SE INICIO POR UNA PROMOTORA QUE ESTABA EN FUNDACION REALIDAD YA QUE A ELLA LE PASARON UNOS CONTACTOS DE ANENECUILCO Y FUE A VISITARLOS EN ESTE CASO VISITO A LA SRA. RAQUEL ALA CUAL LE INTERESO EL PROYECTO Y DECIDIO BUSCAR SU GENTE Y COMO DOÑA ANTONIA ES SU COMADRE LA INVITO JUNTO CON OTRAS PERSONAS Y ASI FUE COMO COMENZARON. EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE PIDIO DOÑA ANTONIA FUE DE $4000 Y LO INVIRTIO EN LA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y LEGUMBRES YA QUE DESDE ANTES YA VENDIA PERO DEJO DE VENDER Y COMENZO A VENDER PICADAS Y DOBLADAS PERO COMO NO LE FUE MUY BIEN DECIDIO REGRESAR A LA VENTA DE LAS FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, SU CREDITO DE AHORITA ES DE $3000 YA QUE CON ESTA CRISIS QUE ESTAMOS PASANDO NO SE QUISO ANIMAR CON MAS HASTA QUE LA SITUACION MEJORE SU CREDITO LO VA A UTILIZAR EN COMPRAR JITOMATE,TOMATE,CEBOLLA,CHILE,AGUACATE,EJOTE,MANZANA,PLATANO,NARANJA,, CHAYOTE PARA SURTIR SU PEQUEÑO GRAN NEGOCIO YA QUE EN SU CASA TIENE UN LOCAL PEQUEÑO EL CUAL NO TIENE NINGUN NOMBRE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN CALLE 3 DE MAYO No 45 DE LA COL. LA CAPILLA EN ANENECUILCO MOR. Y AHI TIENE SU VERDURA PERO TAMBIEN SALE A RANCHEAR A TODAS LAS COLONIAS DE ANENECUILCO PARA PODER ACABAR SU MERCANCIA.

NOS COMENTA QUE ELLA A PASADO POR MUCHOS PROBLEMAS YA QUE COMO SE SALE A VENDER SE HAN METIDO A ROBAR A SU CASA EN DOS OCACIONES LLEVANDOSE DINERO,APARATOS ETC.Y QUE AUNQUE LOS MISMOS VECINOS VEN NO LE DICEN NADA SE QUEDAN CALLADOS YA QUE COMO ES UN PUEBLITO EN UN CERRO COMO QUE LES DA MIEDO QUE VALLAN A HACERLES ALGO DESPUES A ELLOS Y EN OCACIONES SU ESPOSO TAMPOCO A TENIDO TRABAJO Y TIENEN QUE VER LA FORMA PERO ELLOS TIENEN QUE SALIR ADELANTE YA QUE DICE AHORITA SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES QUE SU NIETO TERMINE SUS ESTUDIOS PARA QUE LE DEMUESTRE A SU MAMÀ QUE VALIO LA PENA QUE LO DEJARA CON SU ABUELA.Y DICE DOÑA ANTONIA QUE SI LOBA A LOGRAR POR MEDIO DE LOS PRESTAMOS Y DEL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO VA A CONTINUAR HASTA LOGRAR TODO LO QUE ELLA QUIERE.

ELLA ESPERA EN UN FUTURO PODER AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO Y VENDER TAMBIEN UN POCO DE ABARROTES YA QUE EN SU COMUNIDAD CASI NO HAY NEGOCIOS.


POR ULTIMO AGADECE A LA EMPRESA POR OTORGAR PRESTAMOS A PERSONAS QUE EN VERDAD LO NESECITAN Y MAAS QUE NADA POR BRINDARLES LA CONFIANZA DE SABER QUE SI LES VAN A PAGAR Y A KIVA POR ASOCIARSE CON FUNDACION REALIDAD YA QUE ES UNA EMPRESA MUY SERIA Y SOBRE TODO HONRADA.
texts.en:
The village of San Miguel Anenecuilco belongs to the Ayala Morelos municipality, which is located approximately 12 kilometers from the city of Cautla Morelos. You will find the Capilla Development Cooperative in this village. It is comprised of nine members, seven women and two men who work in commerce. Raquel C. R., Roberta T. P., and Jose Luis P. C. sell clothes. Porfirio R. G. and Angel P. F. sell cosmetics and perfumes by catalog. Araceli P. C. sells shoes by catalog. Pared Uriel C. G. sells silver in towns bordering his community. Reyna C. V. makes outfits, blouses, pants, and handicrafts. Antonia G. M. sells fruit and vegetables, and she will tell us a little about it. Antonia G. M. is 59 and married. Her husband works as a taxi driver. They have a common law marriage. They have seven children, but none of them live with them. Their children are all married, and now they are raising their 16 year old grandson. Their daughter left him when he was one. Antonia has raised him since then. She has been part of the Capilla Development Cooperative since it started. The group has worked with us for six cycles. She tells us that the group was started by a loan representative who was with Fundación Realidad. She had some contacts from Anenecuilco, and she went to visit them. One of the people she visited was Raquel, who was interested in the project. She decided to look for other people like Antonia, the Godmother to one of her children. She invited her and other people, and that is how they started. The first loan that Antonia asked for was for $4,000, which she invested in her fruit and vegetable sales. Then she stopped selling fruits and vegetables and started selling snacks and “dobladas” (folded over tortilla). That did not go very well for her, and she decided to return to selling fruits and vegetables. Her current loan is for $3,000. She did not want more until the crisis we are in improves. She will use the loan to buy tomatoes, onions, chilies, avocadoes, green beans, apples, bananas, oranges, and vegetable pears to stock her small, great business. She has a small stand in her house, which is located on the 3 de Mayo street, number 45 in the Capilla Colony in Anenecuilco Morales. That is where she has her vegetable sales, but she also goes to all of the colonies in Anenecuilco to be able to finish selling her merchandise. She tells us that she has experienced many problems like her house being robbed twice while she was out selling. They took money and appliances, etc. Even though the neighbors see, they do not say anything. They keep quiet because, being a town on a hill, they are afraid that the robbers will do something to them afterwards. At times her husband has not had work either. They have to find a way to get ahead. She says that her biggest wish now is that her grandson finish his studies to show his mother that leaving him with his grandmother was worth it. Antonia says she can do it with the loans, and with her husband’s support. She will continue until she achieves everything she wants to achieve. In the future she hopes to be able to enlarge her business and also sell a few groceries. They are hardly any of these businesses in her community. Lastly, she thanks the company for giving loans to people who truly need them. More than anything, they offer the confidence of knowing that they will be paid. She is grateful to Kiva for associating with the Fundación Realidad. It is a very serious, and above all, honorable company.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar tomates, chiles, cebollas y aguacates,etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 46-year-old married woman living with her husband and her three children. In 2005, she decided to work as a tailor to support her husband with the household expenses after having twenty-five years of experience in this field.

Today, Aida is requesting $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine to be able to support the demands of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
N. Florence is such a hardworking and friendly lady. She is a businesswoman with a business of selling agricultural produce including cassava, sweet potatoes, matooke (plantain) and fresh beans from the Total market.

Florence is a married lady with six children, the eldest being a candidate in senior four while the last born is still a baby.

Florence is grateful for her loans because they have always helped her in having enough stock for her stall as well as being able to save for the well-being of her children. This is Florence’s second loan with the group and she hopes to buy more agricultural produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more matooke, sweet potatoes, cassava and fresh beans to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man. He has owned a beauty salon called "Abelardo" since 2008 and has eight years of experience in this field. He decided to have his own business to earn a good income.

Today, Mahmoud is requesting $1,200 to buy more tools and merchandise in order to expand and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy more tools and merchandise

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 38-year-old married woman with six children aged between 9 and 15 years, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises, school fees for her children and feeding the family.

Prossy sells to all categories of people and also offers outside catering. She buys her foodstuffs from Kalerwe Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and incurs additional transport costs to and from shopping.

Prossy has been in this business for twelve years and with MCDT for seven years and is servicing her twentieth loan. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling only in wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like Irish potatoes, bunches of bananas, and beef

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a married woman with three children. She has been working as a private nurse since 2000 to provide, along with her husband, better life conditions for her family. She's a very hardworking woman who likes to help people.

Today, Jeanette is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a small car to help her in her work travel and be able to arrive on time to the patients.

loans.use: To buy a small car

loans.name: Erina's Group

texts.en:
N. Erina has a drugstore that she is running and, since she is the only one in her locality with this business, she is a necessity for her customers. She has had the drugstore for four years and, although it is doing well, she still needs to stock up on drugs that are missing due to her limited cash on hand; hence, the need for a loan.

Erina is young, hardworking and devoted with a lot of goals for the future. She is a single lady with no children yet. She believes that if she is to find a good husband and have kids they'll want a smooth landing, and that is why she is working so hard. She is the leader of her group in Mukono.

loans.use: To restock her drugstore

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami has been the owner of a car repair shop in his town since 1989. Over the years – thanks to his business income – he has been able to meet his children's needs. There is a great demand for his shop; thus, he wants to take out a loan of $1000 to buy more tools and enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more tools

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en: Fadwa is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of three children who still go to school. She has been the owner of a mini market in her town since 2000, selling a variety of food products. Today, Fadwa is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy merchandise needed for the mini market so she can carry more products and earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 23-year-old married man. He has been the owner of a barber shop since 2005, after 10 years of experience in this field. With his new business, he has been able to earn a good income and get married. Now, Ahmad is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase new chairs for his salon and add some modifications to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 35-year-old engaged man. He has been the owner of a car painting shop since 1994, with 20 years of experience in this market. There is great demand for his shop's work – that's the reason he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase materials such as paint and some tools.

loans.use: To purchase paint and tools

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en: Nasser has been the owner of a bakery called "Nasser Bakery" since 2006. He services the neighboring villages with delicious breads. Recently, he decided to make bread deliveries to homes. That's why he needs a loan of $1,200 to purchase a Rapid Car to make his idea work, so he can deliver his products and make a good income.

loans.use: To purchase a Rapid Car to make deliveries

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has been a carpenter since 1999, distributing his products to clients upon request. He is a 43-year-old single man living with his parents and six brothers. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy additional wood to make more products in order to satisfy the heavy demand of the market.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has had her retail business for 10 years. She is a 35-year-old single mother with three children, ages 13, 11 and 5. In her shop, she sells new clothing for women and children as well as secondhand curtains for the home. She also sells new shoes for men in her store. Violet's business is located in Kapsabet town. She operates her business from a shop made from cement. Her sister also uses this shop for her tailoring business.

This is Violet's first loan with KADET. She has never had a loan before and was introduced to KADET by an existing client. She is taking out a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings. With her loan, Violet plans to purchase curtains worth 25,000 shillings and use the remaining funds to purchase new men's clothing and shoes to add to the stock in her store. In the future, Violet wants to own a wholesale business that sells curtains, new clothes and shoes.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To purchase men's clothing and new shoes

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: In 2004, after 24 years of experience in the car repair sector, Mohamad, a 38-year-old married man, decided to open his own shop to satisfy the needs of his three children and wife. Today, Mohamad is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase an electric motor for his business.

loans.use: To purchase an electric motor

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario #1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Melania is the group coordinator for Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Desarrollo Comunitario (Community Development). Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients.  Melania lives in Samana with her husband and four children. Her community has unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity. 

Melania is a successful Esperanza client and this will be her seventh loan.  She makes and sells home decor items like curtains and cushions.  Melania will use this loan to buy cushions, fabric and a sewing machine. Melania hopes to continue to grow her business with the help of this loan.  She would like to use the money she earns in her business to improve the floor of her home and purchase a vehicle. She also hopes to have an employee working for her in the future.  Her dream is for her family to be united together and for her business to continue to grow so that she can continue to work with Esperanza. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase cushions, fabric, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Maurice Obonyo

texts.en:
Maurice is a 26-year-old father of a three-year-old child called Obama, named after President Barack Obama when he visited Kenya in 2006. He is married to Jecinta Obonyo.Their son goes to a nearby school. 

He was introduced to Kadet by his friend who is a Kadet client. With this first loan he plans to clear school fees for his younger brother and purchase additional fabric for his tailoring business.

His business is located on a street in town and he pays rent for the space he occupies. He has done the business for six years and he hopes to continue to expand his business and generate additional income to buy a plot of land and build a home for his family.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To pay school fees and purchase fabric.

loans.name: Las Colmenas #1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Hilcia is the group coordinator of Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Las Colmenas.  Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients. Hilcia is a single mother of two who lives in the Samana province of the Dominican Republic.  She lives in a rented house that has unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity. 

This will be Hilcia's first loan with Esperanza.  She plans to use it to start a retail business selling clothing.  She will purchase pants, blouses and skirts to sell out of her home to the others in her community. 

Hilcia wants to use the profits from her business to help improve the living conditions for her family.  She will be able to buy clothes, shoes, and books for her children so they can attend school.  She hopes to be able to save enough money to purchase a computer and someday to purchase her own house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, and skirts to resell

loans.name: Francis Njuguna

texts.en:
Francis is a 35-year-old father of three children who are 10, 7 and 4 years old. He is married to Jane Wanjiru. All three children go to a primary school in Kapsabet town.

He was introduced to Kadet by a Kadet client and is happy to have joined Kadet. With this first loan, he plans to purchase more bags of oranges and mangoes to supply to an increasing number of retailers.

His business is located at the market in the town centre. He wishes to become a big supplier of oranges and mangoes in the town. With the profits, he wishes to educate his children and to buy a plot where he can build his own home.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more bags of oranges and mangoes to sell to retailers

loans.name: Zenobio Eusebio

texts.en:
Zenobio is 25 years old and he currently attends night school where he is studying to be a technician.  Zenobio and his wife have a handsome one-year-old baby.  They work with dairy cows in the production of milk, which they sell to a man who uses the milk for various dairy products.

Zenobio lives in the Maica Central zone of Cochabamba, which is just outside the suburban area of Cochabamba city.  Currently, because he and his wife do not own a home of their own, they live with his mother.  There, they tend to their eight dairy cows.  

This loan will be used to purchase another dairy cow to incrementally increase their milk production and improve their earnings.  This, Zenobio hopes, will help improve their quality of life.  Zenobio hopes to build a house of their own soon, and above all, to finish his studies while also continuing to increase his dairy production.  This way, he can offer his wife and son an improved quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Reylda

texts.en:
Reylda is 29 years old, and she sells groceries in the market of Cochabamba city. She is very responsible and works hard.  

Reylda has three small children who are her motivation to work each day beginning early in the morning. Her husband works as a bricklayer, but his hours have reduced recently because of the economic situation in Bolivia. As a result, their earnings have been scarcely reaching their needs to cover the cost of food and education of their children.

The loan will be used to finish construction of Reylda's home, which will be a big improvement for the family's quality of life. Currently, they live in a small and humble rented apartment. Reylda dreams that one day her children will be able to finish high school and establish their careers. Her youngest daughter wants to be a doctor when she grows up, so that she can help sick children like the ones in her school.

As a child, Reylda lived with her parents in the city of Potosi. Sadly, Reylda lost her mother when she was young. When her mother died, her father abandoned their family, and Reylda and her siblings were forced to work in order to move forward. Today, she works each day, so that her children can have a better childhood than hers, and that they can always rely on their parents for help.

loans.use: Construction material for their home

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is married and has one child. She has no educational background. Sarah sells foodstuffs such as garden eggs, onions, tomatoes, raw fresh pepper, palm oil, palm kernel oil, smoked fish, and so on, at Elmina near Bantama. She has been engaged in this activity since 1990. Her husband is a fisherman. Sarah uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Sarah will use the loan to purchase more foodstuff for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto S.,  tiene la edad e 47 años,  habita en la Borgoña ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual vende comida los fines de semana para apoyarlo con los gastos del pago de agua, luz, y los alimentos que hagan falta, ellos tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya son casado y un joven de 18 años que actualmente estudia su secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es lograr comprar un terreno  para heredarle a cada uno de ellos. Don Norberto desde hace 25 años trabaja como agricultor  ya que con sus propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno y trabajar por si solo, agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su segundo crédito y por la asistencia técnica, lo cual le ayudo a tener una mejor producción y pagar el préstamo en tiempo y forma. Tiene una comioneta que compro para poder trasladar sus frutos al centro del mayoreo que es donde entrega la piña, un mercado central.Con este préstamo comprara fertilizantes para mejorar la producción de piña y poder vender a buen precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Norberto S. is 47 years old and lives in Borgona in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who sells food on weekends to help him with the costs of paying for water, electricity and the food they need. They have three children, two of whom are already married and a young man of 18 who is currently studying in high school. Mr. Noberto's plan for his family is to buy land for each of his children. Mr. Norberto has been working for 25 years as a farmer, and by his own efforts, he strives to buy land and work on it. He thanks the institution for the proper approval of his second loan and the technical assistance, which helped him to improve production. He promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. He also has a van, which he purchased to deliver his fruits such as pineapple at the central market. With this loan, he plans to buy fertilizer in order to improve production of his pineapples and sell them at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his pineapples in order to have a better harvest

loans.name: Rogert

texts.en:
Rogert is a client of Asociación Arariwa. He is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Anta. The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion. He is from Anta and lives in Cusco. He is 51 years old and is married with three children.

Rogert has been working as a metal mechanic in a compressor factory for 20 years. He owns 5 machines that are utilized in the mining industry, and he will use the loan to maintain them.

Rogert appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain his mining machines

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El joven Marlon Antonio A. J. , tiene la edad de 26 años , habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como despachadora de una tienda , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen un hijo de dos años a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su vivienda , ya que actualmente habita en un cuarto que le dio su mamá , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez , el joven Marlon desde hace tres años labora como bombero en el municipio de Ticuantepe , agradece a Afodenic por la confianza y el apoyo con su primer aprobación de su préstamo . El cual va a invertir en materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, zinc y poder comenzar a construir.
texts.en:
The young man Marlon Antonio A. J. is 26 years old and lives in the town of Juan Ramon Padilla with his wife. He works as a dispatcher for a store in order to support their household expenses. They have a two-year-old son, and their plan is to build a house, because right now they live in a room that his mom gave them. The biggest challenge is that his salary has not been raised in order to purchase construction materials this one time. Marlon also works as a firefighter in the town of Ticuantepe for the past 3 years. He thanks Afodenic for the trust and support given with his first approved loan. He will use it to invest in building materials such as stone, cement, sand, iron, zinc and will be able to start building their home.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc and other materials to begin building his house

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.en:
Maria is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members and her group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta.  She is from Cusco and lives in Cusco.  She is 52 years old and married with three children.  One works in tourism, one studies at the university and the other is in high school.

Maria works at home.  She intends to use this loan to help her husband maintain his metalworking machines.  He works in is in Cusco.

Maria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To help her husband maintain his metalworking machines

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 35 years old and married with four children. He runs a butchery and also earns some income through small-scale farming. He is requesting a loan for Kes. 40,000 to buy cattle for slaughter. He has successfully completed two loans through Faulu in the past.
He describes himself as confident and determined and hopes to expand his business to be a wholesale distributor of meat.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy cattle for slaughter

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a kiosk selling groceries like tomatoes, sukuma wiki (kale), spinach, onions, and fruit. She has been running her kiosk for nine years and mainly sells to families in the area. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy fruit, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes. She hopes to enlarge her grocery business and compete better with the goal of building her family a home. She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious and says that loans from Faulu have enabled her to sustain her family.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more fruit, tomatoes, onions and potatoes

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 30 years old and a married mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She has a green grocery business selling maize, beans, grains, and vegetables and has had her business for four years. She now has one employee and hopes to be able to expand into a wholesale food supplier. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to increase her inventory.
She describes herself as hardworking, committed, and loyal and says that since joining Faulu she has been able to increase her income enough to pay educational fees for family members.  


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. sells smoked fish at the Elmina seashore.  Grace has received a junior high education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Grace has been selling smoked fish since 2004. She is responsible for supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business save to build and to invest.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 47 years old, runs a barbershop in Burma Market in Nairobi and has two employees. He has been running his shop for one and one-half years and previously ran a video library. He is married with two children who are both attending school. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to invest in his business.
Since joining Faulu, Sammy feels that he has become more serious about his business, such as keeping records properly, and has experienced high growth. He describes himself as hardworking and hopes to open many barbershops and employ more people in the future.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Jaquelin Sugey

texts.es: La Joven Jacquelin Sugey González tiene la edad de 26 años habita en la comunidad las enramadas, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como transportista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen un hijos a cargo , los planes hacia su familia es poder brindarle un mejor educación y un techo digno , ella desde hace un año trabaja como domestica trabajo en el cual es cansado por que tiene que cocinar, lavar ,planchar a varias persona lo cual lo hace para en un futuro tener su casa mas amplia , anteriormente laboraba como cajera y despachadora de una pulpería pero por las ventas bajas la liquidaron.  La mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no puede comprar de una solo vez los materiales de construcción, por el sueldo que devenga es bajo y el de su esposo también pues tiene cubrir las necesidades diaria del hogar,  Agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su segundo préstamo; el cual lo va a invertir en compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento para ajustar ya que con el primer crédito compro una parte para hacer un cuarto el cual va a terminar de construir para mejor seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Jacquelin Sugey González is 26 years old and lives in the community of Las Enramadas. Her husband works as a delivery driver in order to help with the household expenses. The couple has one dependent child. Jacquelin’s plan for her family includes providing a good education for her child as well as a decent home. She has been working as a domestic employee for a year. She easily tires from having to cook, clean, and iron for different people, but she does whatever it takes so that she can have a larger home in the future. Jacquelin previously worked as a cashier and dispatcher at a grocery store before her employer went bankrupt because of low sales.

Her greatest challenge is not being able to purchase all of her construction materials at once because she does not make enough money and her husband’s salary is used to cover their daily household necessities. Jacquelin thanks AFODENIC for approving her second loan. She will use the funds to purchase materials such as stone and cement. Her first loan was used to buy enough materials to finish a room, but she would like to complete the construction of the entire house so that she can provide better security for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 28 years old and runs a business hawking tea leaves (going door-to-door). She has been doing this for four years and is requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more stock of tea leaves. Rose describes herself as hardworking and says the she has now developed savings skills from her experience at Faulu. She has hope for a bright future and that she will improve her standard of living through her business and continued loans. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of tea leaves

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 24 años, vive con sus padres y con el amor de su vida, Karol que tiene 23 años. Esta joven pareja tiene un pequeño y travieso hijo que se llama Carlos que recién ha cumplido un año. 

Carlos ha logrado salir adelante haciendo lo que tanto le apasiona; la música, ella le ha permitido sostener a su familia, darle tranquilidad y también lo acompaña desde niño, cuando Carlos empezaba a hacer los primeros sonidos con un pequeño tambor. Desde entonces, no ha podido dejarla de lado, y hoy se dedica a ella casi todos los días y desde hace 3 años lo contratan profesionalmente para diferentes eventos, shows artísticos y cualquier reunión familiar.
A veces trabaja  con todo su grupo musical “Los cómplices del sabor”, integrado por 4 jóvenes más, y ellos amenizan cualquier jornada y le ponen el sabor a los eventos donde se dan cita gran cantidad de personas en busca de diversión, sobretodo los fines de semana. 
Él tiene grandes aspiraciones musicales y sabe que puede crecer aún más y hacerse conocido en el mundo musical, para esto piensa primero patentar su grupo con nombre propio y modernizar, en el futuro, todos los equipos de sonido.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP e indica que será puntual, como siempre, porque desea salir adelante y hacer una vida de la música, pues sabe que toca los instrumentos muy bien y las melodías que produce hacen bailar a cualquiera. Para empezar a cumplir con sus anhelos, invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en mejorar la calidad del sonido, comprando parlantes nuevos, mezcladoras y amplificadoras.
texts.en:
Carlos is 24 years old and lives with his parents. His wife Karol is 23 years old and the love of his life. The couple has an energetic little boy who is also named Carlos, who just turned one year old.

Carlos has managed to succeed by pursuing his passion – music. This has allowed him to support his family and provide peace of mind. As a little boy, his interest started by banging on a small drum. Music has been an unavoidable part of his life since then. Carlos now engages in his music every day and has been performing professionally for 3 years at various events, artistic shows, and family reunions.

Sometimes he performs with his group “Los Cómplices del Sabor” (The Accomplices of Flavor), which consists of four young members. They add excitement to any occasion and also provide some spice to weekend events attended by large numbers of people looking to have a good time. Carlos has great aspirations for his musical career. He knows that he can continue to grow and eventually become famous in the musical world. First he wants to trademark the name of his group and modernize his sound equipment sometime in the future.

Carlos is taking his sixth loan with MFP. He says that he will continue to be punctual, as always, because he wants to succeed and making a living from his music. He plays a number of instruments very well and can produce melodies for just about any dance. Carlos will use the money to fulfill his aspirations by buying new speakers, mixers, and amplifiers to improve his sound quality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sound equipment

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 45 años, es una dama muy trabajadora, comparte su vida con su esposo Juan de 50 años, quien trabaja repartiendo dulces en diferentes  tiendas de la ciudad. Ellos tienen 4 hijos: Claudia de 26, Juan Alberto de 25, Luis de 22 y Carol de 13 años.

Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una marca que se encuentra posicionada a nivel mundial; se inicia en este negocio motivada por una amiga y desde entonces han pasado muchos años, pero sigue teniendo el entusiasmo de al principio. Su actividad le es muy rentable porque no requiere de mucho tiempo y lo puede compartir con su trabajo de asistente en un consultorio dental que desempeña durante el día.
Pero en las noches y los fines de semana se dedica por entero a la venta de los productos de belleza, Juana es una mujer muy hacendosa y le gusta siempre verse bien, por eso le gusta también ofrecer estos productos, además le sobra poder de convencimiento para que sus asiduas clientes le compren los cosméticos. Pues ella aprendió mucho sobre ventas en los talleres que brinda esta compañía de belleza, además es una líder en su zona.

Este es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con cada pago, porque así manifiesta ser una persona responsable. Juana ya tiene pensado el destino del dinero que solicita, pues lo invertirá en comprar mercadería, es decir productos de belleza. También lo usará en la reparación del auto de su esposo con el que reparte los pasteles.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old and a hardworking woman. She shares her life with her husband Juan, who is 50 years old and works as a distributor of sweets to different shops in town. They have 4 children: Claudia (age 26), Juan Alberto (age 25), Luis (age 22), and Carol (age 13).

For 6 years, Juana has been selling beauty products from a well-known global brand. She was encouraged by a friend to start this business and continues to display the same level of enthusiasm that she had when she first began many years ago. Her business is very profitable because it does not require much of her time and she can continue her day job as a dental assistant. In the evenings and on the weekends, she devotes herself entirely to selling beauty products. Being an industrious woman who likes to look good, Juana is very credible when convincing her frequent customers to buy cosmetics. She has learned a great deal about sales in the workshops her company offers. As a result, she has become a leader in her district.

This is Juana’s seventh loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with each payment because it demonstrates that she is a responsible person. With the funds that were requested, she will purchase more beauty products and use some of the money for repairs to her husband’s vehicle used for delivering pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of beauty products & pay for repairs to her husband's delivery vehicle

loans.name: Cecily

texts.en:
Cecily is 54 years old and married with four children, aged between 15 and 27. She sells ladies' jackets from a strategically placed business in a highly populated location.

Cecily is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to increase her inventory. She has had her clothing business for nine years and also earns income from rental houses.

In the future, Cecily hopes to expand her business to be able to employ ten people and own her business premises. She describes herself as ambitious, hardworking, and organized. Her dream is to have her own store.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of ladies' jackets

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es:
Cástulo tiene 44 años, él es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante; auque es divorciado y no tiene hijos, siempre piensa en darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres, con ellos vive y con una prima, en una amplia casa ubicada en un populoso distrito de Lima.

Este hombre trabajador se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que tiene en su casa y que desde hace 15 años lo mantiene muy bien. Compra ropa al por mayor y la vende a sus clientes, que le cancelan a fin de mes, con esta actividad no pasa ningún tipo de carencia y le ha permitido adquirir los electrodomésticos necesarios para vivir en regular comodidad junto a sus ancianos padres. 
Como Cástulo es un hombre emprendedor, también vende cerveza en su casa, sobretodo los fines de semana cuando esta bebida tiene más salida entre amigos y conocidos del barrio.
Así es la vida de este hombre que empezó a ser negociante desde muy joven y que ha aprendido a crecer honradamente a base de esfuerzo y mucho trabajo. Nada ni nadie lo desaniman en cumplir sus objetivos en la vida; quiere  llegar a ser un gran comerciante y tener su propia línea de ropa, además de una bien surtida licorería. Algún día, no muy lejano, sabe que lo logrará con su esfuerzo y habilidad.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y promete ser responsable con cada pago, porque sabe que habrá otros préstamos que le permitirán crecer económicamente. También está conforme con el trabajo y puntualidad de su banco comunal, siendo la mayoría de sus compañeras, mujeres. Ya tiene pensado en qué destinará el dinero que solicita, y será en comprar mayor cantidad de ropa de verano, pues ya empezó la temporada y los clientes están ansiosos por comprarla.
texts.en:
Cástulo, 44, is a man who is very eager to get ahead in life. Although divorced and childless, he strives to provide a better quality of life for his parents. He lives with them and a cousin in a large house located in a populous district of Lima. This hard-working man has sold clothing from his home for the past 15 years and has done quite well. He buys clothing at wholesale and then sells to his customers who pay him at the end of the month. This activity has allowed him to suffer no deprivations and has allowed him to buy the necessary appliances to furnish his home with a measure of comfort for his elderly parents. Because Cástulo is an enterprising fellow, he also sells beer from his home, especially on week-ends when this beverage is more popular among his neighbors and friends. Such is this man's life who learned very young to be a businessman and has learned to grow honestly thanks to his efforts and lots of work. Nothing dissuades him from reaching his goals in life; he wants to become a great merchant and have his own clothing line as well as a well-stocked liquor store. Some day, not too distant, he knows he will reach it with his effort and ability. This is his third loan with MFP and he pledges to be responsible with his repayments because he knows there will be future loans which will allow him to grow economically. He is also satisfied with the work and punctuality of his communal bank where most of his partners are women. He has decided to spend these funds in the purchase of a larger quantity of Summer clothing since the season has begun and his customers are anxious to buy it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer muy luchadora, tiene 54 años y vive feliz con su esposo Carlos de 64 años y sus hijos; Mercedes de 31 y Daisy de 27 años. Ellos viven en una agradable casa, la cual es propia e invirtieron mucho en que esté bien construida.

Ella se dedica a la preparación de toda clase de pasteles; para lograr emprender este negocio  habilitó un espacio en su casa y allí produce los más variados sabores de postres, tortas, queques, entre otros bocadillos; los cuales despiden un agradable y provocativo olor capaz de convencer al más exigente cliente.
Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a endulzar los paladares, labor que aprendió en una escuela de repostería y cada cierto tiempo toma cursos para como ella misma dice “estar actualizada, porque todo cambia hasta los tipos de pasteles”. 
Julia empezó el negocio vendiendo a sus familiares y conocidos, pero en la actualidad vende desde su casa a muchas personas desconocidas, que se desesperan por comprarle; además  quien escribe esta historia puede dar fe de las delicias que prepara esta dulce señora. 
Es así que esta trabajadora mujer que se proyecta en cada preparación, mezcla diversos ingredientes selectos y obtiene lo mejor día a día en cada pastel.

Ya es la quinta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está segura de cumplir con sus pagos como siempre lo ha hecho. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de ingredientes e innovar en algunos tipos de pastelillos, pues quiere modernizar las herramientas que utiliza y así ofrecer los mejores postres.
texts.en:
Julia, 54, is a very hard-working woman. She lives happily with her husband, Carlos, 64, and their children Mercedes, 31, and Daisy, 27. They live in a pleasant home which they own and have invested heavily in to insure its good construction. She prepares all kinds of cakes. To do so, she equipped part of her house and there produces the most varied flavores of desserts: turnovers and cakes, among others, which emit a provocative and pleasant aroma capable of convincing the most demanding customer. She has sweetened tastes for over 20 years, a task she learned in pastry school and, ever so often, through courses she takes in order, as she herself states: "to be refreshed and up-to-date because everything changes, even cakes." In the beginning, Julia sold to her family and acquaintances but now she sells to many strangers who come to her home anxious to buy from her. The person writing this account can attest to the delicious delicacies this sweet woman prepares. This is how this hard-working woman injects herself into each preparation, mixes various select ingredients, and obtains each day the best in each cake. This is the fifth loan with MFP and she is sure to repay in a timely fashion as she has always done in the past. The funds requested will be used to buy a greater quantity of ingredients and to innovate some of the types of pastries because she wants to modernize the tools she uses to be able to offer still better desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and utensiles for dessert preparation.

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.es:
Vitaliana es el singular nombre de esta carismática señora, que a sus 48 años se siente más joven que nunca. Ella vive con sus tres hijos: Denisse de 26, Kelly de 21 y Giancarlo de 16 años, a quienes logró sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Ella es una mujer dedicada en todo lo que hace, también en su trabajo como consultora de belleza, hace 3 años que empezó con la venta de productos cosméticos de una reconocida marca a nivel internacional y no sólo obtiene ganancias de las ventas que realiza, sino también la empresa ofrece la oportunidad de crecer y llegar a ser una gran empresaria, permitiéndole incorporar a diferentes consultoras de belleza que quieran trabajar para la compañía. 
Para eso la capacitan, dependiendo del tiempo de trabajo, y esto a ella le gusta porque sabe que en otras compañías no ofrecen esto a sus consultoras de belleza, quiere crecer económicamente y aprender a realizarse, porque es una mujer trabajadora y porque así se lo enseñaron desde pequeña, y ella también se lo enseña a sus hijos. 
Vitalina tiene una actividad paralela, es enfermera pediátrica durante las mañanas, trabaja en un albergue para niños y esta tranquila actividad también le genera buenas ganancias económicas. 
Para el futuro quiere llegar a ser una gran empresaria de esta línea de cosméticos, porque como ella misma dice “quiero hacer carrera en la empresa que me permite realizarlo, a pesar de mi edad”.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y será muy responsable como siempre es en cada una de sus responsabilidades. Además esta muy conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque está integrado por mujeres responsables como ella. Con el dinero que ahora solicita quiere abastecerse de mayor cantidad de productos cosméticos para tener como un stock que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vitalina is the unique name of this charismatic woman who, at the age of 48, feels younger than ever. She lives with her three children, Denisse, 26, Kelly, 21, and Giancarlo, 16. Through much effort and dedication she mananged to raise them well. She is a very dedicated woman in everything she does, including her business which is being a beauty consultant. Three year ago she began selling cosmetics from a well-known international brand. Not only does this produce profits from her sales but the company also offers her growth opportunities to become a big businesswoman letting her incorporate various beauty consultants who want to work for the company. They train her for this, depending on time at work, and she likes this because she knows that other companies do not offer these opportunities to their beauty consultants. She wants to grow economically as well as to grow personallly because she is a hard-working woman having learned this from a very early age and passing it on to her children as well. Vitalina has a second job: she is a pediatric nurse and works mornings at a children's shelter. This peaceful activity also generates good income for her. For the future, she would like to become a great businesswoman with this line of cosmetics because, as she herself states: "I want a career with this company that gives me the opportunity to do so despite my age." This will be her fifth loan with MFP and she will be very responsible with her repayments, as usual. In addition, she is very happy with the work of her communal bank because it is made up of enterprising women like herself. With the funds she is requesting now she will stock up on a greater amount of cosmetics to have available for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia MARINA, pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 59 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos (cuadro mujeres y un varón), ellos trabajan y estudian. Ella tiene un negocio familiar donde todos sus hijos apoyan, la actividad comercial de la socia es de lunes a sábado es vender ropa y artefactos en el centro comercial “El Molino”, el día domingo vende y compra artesanía en la ciudad de Chincheros en el Cusco, la artesanía lo compra de los hermanos pues ellos son artesanos, la socia necesita el crédito para poder comprar más ropa (jeans) de la ciudad de Lima pues así aumentar  más la venta en esta navidad que esta próxima y también aumentar la venta de artesanías que es bien solicitada por los turistas que llegan a la ciudad Imperial del Cusco.
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARINA, 59, is a member of the "PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES" (PROGRESS OF THE ANDES) communal bank and is from the city of Cusco. She is a widow and has 5 children (four girls and one boy) who work and are students. She has a family business where her children all participate that consists of selling clothing and handicrafts Monday through Saturday at the "El Molino" market . On Sundays, she buys and sells handicrafts in the city of Chincheros in Cusco. She buys the crafts from the brothers who are artisans. She needs these funds to buy more clothes (jeans) in Lima so that she can increase her sales this Christmas season which is near and also to increase the sale of handicrafts which are in high demand by the tourists who come to the Imperial City of Cusco. She is grateful for the opportunity offered in this manner and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and handicrafts for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth creates sweaters and skirt suits in her business, "Ndinda Knitting". She is 38 years old and married with three children, ranging in age between 4 and 14. She started this business one year after being retrenched from Kenya Railways. She employs four people. She is requesting a loan for 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase a hand flat knitting machine and knitting yarn.

This is Ruth’s second loan and she says her first loan of 30,000 KES helped her business a lot. Her hope for the future is to have a big business that creates employment for others and to be able to leave an inheritance for her children.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking micro-finance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a knitting machine and yarn

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar Danilo P. tiene la edad de 36 años ,habita en el Km. 13 carretera a Masaya , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa privada , para apoyarle con los gastos del agua, luz y la compra del gas butano ,ellos tiene un hijo el cual estudia secundaria , los planes futuros hacia su familia es poder apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios para que pueda estudiar en la universidad y sea una persona de bien , don Oscar desde hace cuatro años labora para ULTRANIC como chofer, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no tiene todos los recursos para poder construir su vivienda de una solo ves , lo cual agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su crédito el cual espera poder  lograr sus metas en la construcción para una mejor comodidad en la familia ya que es muy pequeña, el desembolso lo va a invertir en materiales de construcción , para el anexo que le hará. Comprara: cemento, arena, piedra, hierro para comenzar  hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo P., 36, lives with his wife, who works as a domestic in a private home to help him with household expenses like water, electricity and butane gas, at Km.13, Masaya highway. They have a son who is a middle school student. His future plans for his family is to help his son with his studies so that he can go to university and become an upstanding citizen. For the past 4 years, Oscar has been employed as a driver by ULTRANIC. His greatest obstacle is that he lacks the necessary funds to build his house once and for all. He is grateful to Afodenic for approving his loan with which he hopes to reach his goal of finally having a more comfortable dwelling for his family since their present house is very small. He will use the funds to buy building materials for the addition he plans to build. He will buy: cement, sand, stone and iron to start construction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone and cement.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una joven mujer de 34 años, tiene tres pequeños hijos: Kevin de 13, Nicole de 10 y Milena de 6 años. En la actualidad solo vive con ellos, porque su esposo Roberto se encuentra trabajando en otra ciudad, pues se dedica a la agricultura.

Desde hace 2 años por circunstancias de la vida empezó a dedicarse a la venta de carbón en un mercado ubicado en la zona por donde vive. Al principio era temporal, porque tomó el puesto de una señora que lo dejó a su cargo y con el tiempo se hizo su trabajo fijo, el que le permitía ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y otras cosas personales.
A ella le gusta atender en su tienda porque no tiene competencia y le es rentable porque según sus propias palabras “si no lo hubiera dejado, lo continué porque me rendía bastante”.
Martha puede atender el negocio en el mercado y al atardecer regresar a su hogar para ver a sus hijas, ella no se cansa porque es una mujer muy laboriosa, pues quiere salir adelante; y algún día ampliar el negocio para vender carbón al por mayor en un amplio local, ya casi lo puede imaginar porque su mente de empresaria se lo permite.

Es por eso, que aunque ya es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, está completamente segura de cumplir con puntualidad porque sabe que tendrá otros préstamos que le permitan mejorar en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita mejorará las instalaciones del local que tiene en la actualidad, ya que está medio deteriorado. Empezará por arreglar el piso para que su tienda de carbón proyecte una mejor imagen.
texts.en:
Martha is a young woman of 34 with three children: Kevin, age 13; Nicole, age 10; and Milena, age 6. She currently lives alone with them, since her husband Roberto is working in another city in the field of agriculture. Two years ago, due to the circumstances of her life, Martha began selling charcoal in a market near her home. At first, the work was intermittent; she substituted for a woman who would leave the shop in her care. Over time, it became her permanent job, allowing her to help her husband with the household costs and other personal expenses. Martha enjoys running her shop, because she has no competition and it is profitable. In her own words, "if she hadn't left it, I still would have continued, because it brought me plenty of income." Martha is able to run her business at the market and return home in the evening to see her daughters. She does not get tired, because she is an extremely hardworking woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She hopes someday to expand her business and sell charcoal wholesale in a large facility; thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit, she can already picture this in her mind. This is Martha's fourth loan with MFP, and she is completely confident that she will repay it punctually, because she knows that she will have other loans in the future that will permit her to enhance her business. With the funds she is requesting, she will improve the infrastructure of the shop she currently operates, since it has deteriorated somewhat. She will begin by repairing the floor, so that her charcoal shop will project a better image to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovating her charcoal shop

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina, a client of Asociación Arariwa, is part of a communal bank called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta, consisting of 19 members. A resident of Anta, she is 52 years old and married, with eight children and two grandchildren. Alejandrina works selling eggs and other food at the Sunday market in the main plaza. With this loan, she will pay the monthly school expenses for her son, who is studying to be a machine operator.

Alejandrina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s monthly school expenses

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, 43, works as a farmer and as a bricklayer. When Juan was a little boy, his father abandoned their family. At that point, to help support his family, Juan learned agriculture and dairy cow farming. Juan has been married for over twenty years, and has six children whose ages range from 2 to 19 years. They are a poor family with few economic resources. Their oldest daughter, who could only attended primary school, is now working in Argentina and sending helpful remittances back to her family.

Juan lives in a small home in the community of Chaupisuyo, which is in the city of Cochabamba. He has three dairy cows that produce milk. Juan sells the milk to a business that turns it into various milk products. This loan will be used to purchase another dairy cow, which will help Juan grow his milk production. That will help him increase his profits and improve the quality of life for his family.
