He hopes to use the extra earnings to remodel his home and help his five younger children pursue professional careers.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow

loans.name: Si Se Puede 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Carolina, 29, is from Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Si Se PueD. (Yes You Can), and her story is representative of the other borrowers of the group.

Carolina lives in a part of Santo Domingo called Guaricanos VilL. MelL., one of the poorest parts of the capital. Here, running water (never potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Despite these difficulties, Carolina runs a successful business selling clothing to her friends and neighbors. Unlike many others who sell packets of used clothing, Carolina only buys new clothing to sell. With this loan she plans on buying two dozen blouses, six dozen pairs of pants, and also a new case of perfumes. 

This is Carolina’s second loan with Esperanza International. She appreciates the opportunity of financing that her business now receives. Carolina’s dream is to have a business big enough that she will need to hire two or three employees. For her family, she hopes to one day build a house that they can call their own. Thank you for lending to Carolina and the Si Se PueD. group!

loans.use: Blouses, pants and perfume

loans.name: Mario Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Mario Alejandro R. es padre de familia, tiene un hijo pequeño de edad que actualmente esta empezando a estudiar.
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera. 
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene como encargado de una tienda de pinturas. Su deseo es que su hijo tenga su propio cuatro y viva mejor.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Angélica Bueno ya que el señor Mario Alejandro no se encontraba en su vivienda el día de la visita, estaba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mario Alejandro R. is the father of a young son who recently started school. With two prior loans from FVP, he has built a room which still needs a roof. He also wants to put in concrete flooring so that the house is safer and sturdier. He is requesting a loan for this project and plans to repay the loan with the income he earns as the manager of a paint store. He wishes for his son to have his own room and better living conditions. The person who appears in the photo is his wife, Angélica Bueno. Mario Alejandro wasn't home the day of this visit because he was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing.

loans.name: Marannatha 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Edline is a 33-year-old borrower from Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Marannatha (Christ is Coming), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Edline and the Marannatha group live in a difficult part of Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Although most of the city has access to running water and somewhat reliable electricity, their neighborhood has none. Edline is a single mother of one, a three-year-old son. Despite raising her child on her own and living in a difficult part of town, Edline runs a successful small business selling clothing to her neighbors and friends.

With her new loan, Edline will buy “ropa de paca”, or packs of used clothing, usually from the United States. This is a common way for people to purchase clothes here; it is cheap and, although used, the clothes are usually in great condition. With the profits from her expanding business, Edline hopes to send her son through school, all the way up through university. This way he can have opportunities that were not available to her as a child. Thank you for lending to Edline and the Marannatha group!

loans.use: Packs of used clothing

loans.name: La Superacion 6 Group

texts.en: Colasa, 37, and the other borrowers from L. Supernacion live in difficult conditions in Samana, Dominican Republic. Colasa lives in a house with a dirt floor and wood panels for walls. In the middle of hurricane season, this is far from sufficient. Her community lacks potable water and is often without electricity. Despite these difficulties, Colasa runs a successful empanada stand from her home. Empanadas (dough stuffed with cheeses and meats and then fried) are a favorite food in the Dominican Republic. Colasa is the coordinator for the group L. Supernacion ("Overcoming") and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. This is Colasa’s very first loan with Esperanza International, and she is very excited about the possibilities. In her home, and therefore her business, she hopes to have enough profits to put in a cement floor. This will add to her family’s security and safety. Colasa also hopes to send all of her children to school through university. Finally, she is excited about Esperanza’s financial services, which will allow her to save responsibly for the future. Thank you for lending to Colasa and L. Supernacion group!

loans.use: To buy chicken and flour

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.en:
Hilda, a 45-year-old single woman with one child, cooks and sells meals out of her home on the weekends. This began three years ago when she was raising and fattening pigs; she began making and selling chicharron (pork sausage) on the weekends. Now she sells food from Friday to Monday and also runs a small general store where she sells soft drinks and a variety of groceries. These two businesses are run out of her home in the Maica area outside the city of Cochabamba.

Because things became a bit crowded, Hilda began constructing an additional room so that her small general store could be relocated there. It still needs a roof, so with this loan Hilda will purchase the construction materials she needs to finish it. Then she will move her shop to the room which will allow her to then begin providing more goods for sale through the shop.

Hilda looks forward to the future and the opportunity to improve her quality of life once the relocation of her shop is complete.

loans.use: The purchase of construction materials for relocating store

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Celia es viuda y trabaja  en la vecina ciudad Laredo Texas limpiando una casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar la diferencia de una casa por medio de un crédito gubernamental, ya que actualmente dende vive es prestada y le están pidiendo que desocupe la propiedad. Pero ella no tiene a donde ir y las casas de restas  en este momento están muy  altos el costo de la renta.
Es por eso que decidió mejor tener su propio patrimonio y mas seguro para ella.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Celia is a widow, and works in the neighboring city of Laredo Texas cleaning a house. She is requesting a loan to help finance the purchase of a home (to pay the difference between the cost of a house and a government loan.) The home she lives in now is rented and the owners have asked her to move out of the property, but she has no place to go, and the houses that are currently available have very high rents. For this reason, she decided it would be better and more secure for her to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to use along with a government loan to buy a home

loans.name: Mario Samuel

texts.en:
With a loan from his father eight years ago, Mario, 28, opened a general food market in the Fortin district of Guayaquil. His store is located on Fortin's main street, which provides a steady flow of customers. Mario works everyday from 5 a.m. to 7 p.m. selling rice, chicken, eggs, cola and other food items to people who work in the area. He has been marginalized from the traditional financial system due to the fact that he is single.

Mario requests a loan to buy more products for his store, including oil, chicken and especially rice, a staple in Ecuador. This will help him scale up his business and serve more customers. Mario dreams of fixing the roof around his store so that he can rent out the extra space to other vendors. Hopefully, an increase in sales will help him achieve this!

loans.use: To buy rice and chicken

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre que a sus 51 años se da tiempo para trabajar y criar a su pequeña hija (Camila) de 6 años, con quien pasa sus días entre risas y juegos en su modesta casa ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Como buen padre trata de criar a su hija correctamente, aunque está separado de su pareja, hace lo posible por cumplir el rol de padre y madre. Además presta el servicio de taxi durante las mañanas y las tardes, hasta que su hija llega del colegio, pues en ese momento debe atenderla y ayudarla con sus tareas. 
Hace 15 años que empezó a dedicarse a este oficio porque sabía manejar autos y le pareció que podría ser muy fácil, pero el tiempo le ha demostrado que todo trabajo merece esfuerzo, y hoy tiene un doble esfuerzo porque el ser padre es una gran obligación de la cual jamás escapó, por lo contrario adora los momentos que pasa con la niña de sus ojos. 
A Juan le gusta salir a taxear en horas punta, pues le es muy rentable. Con este trabajo no tiene problemas económicos y le alcanza el dinero para vivir cómodamente al lado de su pequeña. Sabe que debe dar lo mejor de sí, es por eso que tiene planeado para el futuro comprar un auto más y brindarlo en alquiler, porque su mayor preocupación es la educación y el futuro de su hija, además ella es el motor que lo impulsa a seguir trabajando diariamente.

Este es su sétimo préstamo con MFP y será responsable como en las anteriores ocasiones, ya que ese es el principal valor que le inculcaron desde niño. Le dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la reparación de su auto, para brindar seguridad a los diversos pasajeros que moviliza.
texts.en:
Juan is a 51-year old man who spends his time working and caring for his small 6-year old daughter (Camila), with whom he passes his days between smiles and games in his modest house located to the south of the city of Lima. As a good parent, he tries to raise his daughter correctly. Although he is separated from his partner, he does everything he can to fulfill the role of both father and mother. He offers his taxi service during the mornings and afternoons, until his daughter arrives from school. At that point he must attend to her and help her with her homework. It has been 15 years since he began in this trade, because he knew how to drive an automobile, and it seemed to him that it would be quite easy. But over time he has found that all work takes effort, and now he has to double his efforts because to be a father is a big commitment from which one can never escape. On the contrary, he loves the time he spends with the apple of his eye. Juan likes to go out with his taxi during peak hours, when it is very profitable. With this work, he does not have economic problems and he is able to raise enough money to live comfortably with his daughter. He knows that he must give his best, and for this reason he is planning to buy another car in the future and offer it for rent. His main concern is for the education and future of his daughter. In addition, she is the engine that drives him to continue working daily. This is his seventh loan with MFP and he will be responsible as in the previous occasions, since this is a principal value that was instilled in him from the time he was a child. The money that he is requesting now will be invested in the repair of his auto, to provide security to the various passengers that he transports.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his auto

loans.name: Nanci

texts.es:
Nanci es una carismática mujer de 39 años, vive con su esposo, Jorge, que tiene 41 años y con sus dos pequeños hijos; Nicole de 13 y Jorge de 8 años. Ella vive con su familia en la casa de su padre y también con una de sus hermanas. 

Desde hace 3 se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una marca reconocida a nivel mundial, este negocio le ha permitido crecer económicamente, a tal punto que ya piensa en tener un bazar donde pueda vender estos productos de belleza y alternarlo con la venta de otro tipo de artículos. 
Nanci tiene ganas de salir adelante y para eso se esfuerza a diario para ayudar en los gastos del hogar a su esposo y también le alcanza para comprarse sus gustos. Es por eso que el negocio le parece muy rentable, ya que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo, además la empresa para la que  trabaja le ofrece incentivos como electrodomésticos y productos para el hogar, y por esta razón  se siente muy feliz, doblemente motivada para continuar en el negocio. 
Para el futuro tiene planes de crecer y aumentar su stock de mercadería, además también incursionará en el alquiler de disfraces, ya que por el lugar donde vive no hay competencia y ser ha dado cuenta que hay bastante demanda.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente muy comprometida con este crédito, ya que según sus expectativas será el primero de varios, porque tiene ganas de salir adelante. Con el dinero que solicita piensa comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería en cosméticos y también ropa de niños para comercializarla entres sus amistades y vecinos.
texts.en:
Nanci is a charismatic 39 year old woman. She lives with her husband, Jorge, who is 41, and their two small children. Nicole is 13 and Jorge is 8. She lives with her family and one of her sisters in her father’s house. For three years she has been selling a brand of cosmetics that is known on a worldwide level. This business has allowed her to grow economically to such a degree that she is now thinking of having a bazaar. She would be able to sell her beauty products as well as other types of articles in the bazaar. Nanci has the desire to get ahead. In order to do so, she puts forth great effort everyday to help her husband with the household expenses. She is also able to buy some niceties. The business is very profitable, and does not now require as much effort. Also, the company she works for offers incentives like domestic appliances and products for the home. That is the reason she feels very happy and doubly motivated to continue with the business. In the future, she has plans to grow and increase her stock of merchandise. She also wants to explore renting out costumes. There is no competition where she lives, and she has realized that there is enough of a demand. This is her first loan with MFP. She feels very committed with this loan. According to her expectations, this will be the first of many because she has the desire to get ahead. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a larger quantity of cosmetics and children’s clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer muy simpática de 50 años, vive con su esposo, Segundo, que tiene 52 años, y con su hija, también de nombre Nora, que es una joven de 21 años. Ellos viven felices en una acogedora casa de un distrito sobresaliente ubicado al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una conocida marca y con el pasar de los años ha crecido y se ha convertido en líder de su zona, esto significa que además de vender estos cosméticos capta nuevas vendedoras, y esto le favorece aún mas económicamente, porque recibe grandes incentivos por sus ventas.
A Nora le gusta su trabajo y ya se acostumbró a persuadir a sus clientes para que compren mayor cantidad de cosméticos, ella ha aprendido bastante de este rubro y sabe crear una necesidad en las personas. 
Cada mes recibe los frutos de su esfuerzo y para el futuro piensa seguir trabajando con esta marca de cosméticos que tantas satisfacciones le ha brindado, además de poner un bazar en su casa donde vendería esto productos de belleza y otros artículos  necesarios para el hogar.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y sabe que si es responsable en sus pagos podrá salir adelante con sus sueños. Además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo porque está compuesto por mujeres emprendedoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará lo necesario para implementar su bazar y ya tiene pensado cómo colocar todo en la habitación que está junto a su sala, donde será su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Nora is a very likable 50 year old woman. She lives with her 52 year old husband, Segundo, and her daughter. Her daughter is also named Nora, and she is 21. They live happily in a cozy house in an excellent district, which is located to the south of the city of Lima. She has been selling brand name cosmetics for 15 years. With the passage of time, her business has grown, and she has become a leader in her area. This means that in addition to selling cosmetics, she attracts new sellers. This helps her even more economically because she receives great incentives for her sales. Nora likes her work, and she has become used to persuading her customers to buy larger quantities of cosmetics. She has learned a lot in this field, and she knows how to create a cosmetic need for people. Every month she receives the fruit of her efforts. In the future she plans to keep working with this brand of cosmetics that has brought her so much satisfaction. She would also like to set up a bazaar in her house where she would sell her beauty products and other necessities for the home. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP. She knows that if she is responsible with her payments, she will be able to get ahead with her dreams. She is also very satisfied with the work her group does because it is comprised of hard-working women. She will use the money that she is now asking for to buy what is necessary to start a bazaar. She has already thought of how to place everything in the room, which is next to the living room. That is where her future business will be.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up her store

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es un simpático caballero de 47 años, vive junto a su familia, compuesta por su pareja Gloria de 44 años y sus hijas: Shirley de 22 y Gloria de 13 años. Ellos viven en su acogedora casa en una tranquila zona al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Él se dedica al servicio de taxi, tiene un auto propio en el que trabaja durante todo el día, todos los días sin descanso. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a esta actividad porque le parece muy rentable, además la experiencia le ha hecho conocer a qué zonas debe dirigirse y a qué tipo de personas movilizar, y ha escogido trabajar de día porque es más seguro. 
Roger recuerda su antiguo trabajo con nostalgia, antes era obrero de construcciones pero después de un tiempo logró ahorrar dinero y pudo adquirir su auto, así es como se decidió a dedicarse al taxi, ahora puede trabajar tranquilo y mantener, sin problemas, a su familia. 
Este entusiasta taxista tiene la meta de llegar a tener una flota de taxis donde él sea el propietario y administrador, pero sabe que para llegar a concretar este objetivo debe esforzarse y trabajar con empeño, y ya ha empezado a proyectarse al futuro porque piensa refaccionar su actual vehiculo y asociarse con su cuñado para comprar un auto nuevo y entre los dos brindarlo en alquiler.

Roger es un hombre de negocios, por eso es muy responsable con cada uno de sus pagos, pues sabe que aunque este sea el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP debe seguir demostrando responsabilidad. Además, añade que es puntual porque sólo las personas que son así triunfan en la vida. Tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la reparación de su vehículo para poder trabajar tranquilo y brindarles seguridad a los diferentes pasajeros que día a día moviliza.
texts.en:
Roger is a likeable 47 year old gentleman. He lives with his family, which is comprised of his 44 year old wife, Gloria, and their daughters. Shirley is 22, and Gloria is 13. They live in a cozy house in a peaceful area to the south of the city of Lima. He works as a taxi driver. He has his own car, which he works in all day, every day, and without rest. He has been doing this for 15 years because it is very profitable for him. Also, his experience has made him know which areas he should head towards and what type of person he should pick up. He has chosen to work during the day because it is safer. Roger remembers his old job with nostalgia. He used to be a construction worker. After a time he was able to save money so that he could get a car. That is how he decided to be a taxi driver. Now he can work calmly and support his family without problems. This enthusiastic taxi driver’s goal is to have a fleet of taxis where he would be the proprietor and the administrator. But, he knows that in order to reach this goal he has to put forth great effort and work with determination. He has already started to plan for the future because he plans to refurbish his current vehicle. He will also associate himself with his brother-in-law in order to buy a new car; the two of them will rent out the car. Roger is a businessman. Therefore, he is very responsible with each one of his payments. He knows that even though this is his seventh loan with MFP, he needs to keep demonstrating responsibility. Also, he adds that he is punctual because the only people who triumph are this way. He plans to use the money he is asking for to refurbish his vehicle in order to be able to work peacefully and offer security to the different passengers that he transports day to day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish his car

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer laboriosa de 41 años que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos: Anthony de 16, Lizeth de 10 y Johanna de 3 años, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. No ha sido fácil, pero lo ha logrado, y sola pues así vive muy feliz con ellos.

Ella se dedica a la asistir en diferentes eventos sociales durante los fines de semana, la contratan para apoyar en boletería, en la venta de recuerdos o para ayudar en la organización de las personas. Así pasa los fines de semana entre el bullicio de los shows, se gana honradamente la vida y está muy orgullosa de trabajar duro para mantener a sus hijos.
Yolanda dice que este negocio es muy rentable porque en los eventos pagan bien a las personas que colaboran en la producción, además ella es enfermera y también se dedica a su profesión durante los días útiles de la semana. 
Así es como ella se las ha ingeniado para mantener a sus hijos y darles una buena educación, para que en el fututo sean hombres de bien, ya que sabe que esa será la mejor herencia que les pueda dejar.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable con sus pagos, ya que no le gusta tener deudas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita remodelará las habitaciones desocupadas que tiene en su casa, para alquilarlas y así obtener un ingreso adicional para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard-working 41 year old woman who has known how to get her three children ahead. Anthony is 16, Lizeth is 10, and Johanna is 3. She has worked with much effort and dedication. It has not been easy, but she has done it alone. She lives very happily with them. Her work is assisting at different social events during the week ends. They contract her to help in the ticket office, in selling mementos, or to help in the people’s organization. That is how she spends the week ends. She honorably earns a living among the excitement of the shows. She is very proud to work hard to support her children. Yolanda says that this business is very profitable because the people who collaborate in the production are well paid for the events. Also, she is a nurse. She works in this profession during the week days. This is how she figured out how to support her children and give them a good education. It is so that in the future they will become good people. She knows that this will be the best inheritance that she could leave them. This is her third loan with MFP. She promises to be responsible with her payments because she does not like to have debts. She will use the money that she is asking for to remodel the unoccupied rooms in her house to rent out. That way she will get an additional income for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel the unoccupied rooms in her house to rent out

loans.name: Ana Fabiola

texts.es:
Ana  vive en la Calle Gregorio Reynolds zona Villa Calama de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa de sus padres es soltera, egreso de la carrera de Comunicación Social.

Ana trabaja vendiendo productos energéticos, además distribuye ropas por docena a las tiendas y almacenes.


El crédito lo destinara para aumento de capital. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con IMPRO  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ana lives on Gregorio Reynolds Street in the Villa Calama district in the city of El Alto. She is single and lives with her parents. Ana earned a degree in communications.

She sells energy products and also distributes clothing to a dozen shops and department stores. Her loan will be used to increase her operating capital. This is Ana’s second loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated that she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the operating capital for her businesses

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María de Lourdes A. es madre de familia y  tiene paco tiempo que se quedo viuda y con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad.
Ella trabaja de maestra en un colegio, este es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para darle lo mejor a su hijo. 
En este momento tiene un problema, uno de sus hermanos necesita realizarse unos exámenes medico, y la señora María De Lourdes desea ayudarle con estos gastos ya que son muy carros, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder apoyar a su hermano es por eso que solicita este préstamo y así su hermano se realizara los estudios médicos que necesita y comprar el medicamento que se le va a requerir.
texts.en:
Sra. María de Lourdes A. is a working mother. She has very little free time because she is a widow and still has a child who depends on her.

María is a high school teacher. This job is her only source of income that allows her to provide the best for her child. She has a problem at the moment. One of her brothers needs medical attention, so she would like to help with some the expenses since they are very high. She does not have the money at the moment to help her brother, so she is requesting this loan so that he can see a doctor and purchase the medications that are required.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her brother's medical expenses

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz vive en la comunidad de Caluyo “Batallas” Provincia Los Andes de la Ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto con sus cinco hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de la misma comunidad, su esposo esta en la Republica de Argentina por motivos de trabajo.

La señora se dedica a la extracción de leche y lo vende a PIL (Planta Industrializadora de  leche) aparte realiza trabajo de cestería y el tiempo restante se dedica a la crianza de sus hijos.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de un ganado vacuno así aumentara la producción de leche y a la vez aumentará sus ingresos. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con IMPRO  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in the community of Caluyo – Batallas, which is in Los Andes Province of the city of El Alto. Her five children attend school in the same community, while her husband is currently in Argentina for business reasons.

Beatriz extracts milk from her dairy cows and sells it to PIL (an industrial milk plant). She devotes part of her time to basket weaving and spends the remainder looking after her children.

Beatriz will use the funds to buy a cow so that she can increase her milk production as well as her income. This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated that she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Emerita Yolixa

texts.es:
La señora EMERITA YOLIXA, tiene  24 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Ella presenta estudios técnicos de docencia (profesora). 
Ella se dedica a dar servicio de locutorio instalado en la casa de sus padres, en sus ratos libres se dedica a la alfabetización.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro tarifadores, sillas, teléfonos para poner mas cabinas de locutorio en su casa. 
Con este préstamos de 800.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá para poner otro locutorio en la casa de sus padres como así también comprar máquinas tragamonedas.
EMERITA sueña con expandirse, lograr tener una cadena de locutorios y también comprar máquinas tragamonedas.
texts.en:
Sra. Emerita Yolixa is 24 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Esfuerzo de Mujeres II” (Effort of Women II). Emerita has a teaching degree.

She provides calling services out of her parents’ home. In her free time, Emerita teaches literacy classes. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought tarifadores (devices that measure and monitor telephone usage), chairs, and telephones so that she could install more phone booths in her house.

Emerita is requesting a new loan of 800 soles in order to establish another call center in her parents’ home. In addition, she will use part of the money to buy slot machines. She dreams of expanding her business by owning a chain of call centers and purchasing more slot machines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish a call center in her parents' house & purchase slot machines

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene vive en la comunidad D. Caluyo “Batallas” Provincia Los Andes D. la Ciudad D. El Alto.

Tiene seis hijos D. los cuales cuatro ya son casados y viven en la ciudad D. La Paz, las otras dos todavía están en colegio y  viven junto a ella, su esposo es albañil y esta en la ciudad D. Cochabamba por motivos D. trabajo.

La señora se dedica a la extracción D. leche y lo venD. a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora D.  leche) aparte realiza trabajo D. cestería y el tiempo restante se dedica a la crianza D. chanchos y conejos.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. un ganado vacuno así aumentara la producción D. leche y a la vez aumentará sus ingresos. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con IMPRO  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Irene lives in the community of Caluyo – Batallas, which is in Los Andes Province of the city of El Alto. She has six children, four of whom are married and living in the city of La Paz. The other two are still in high school and live with her. Her husband is a mason and works in Cochabamba.

Irene extracts milk from her dairy cows and sells it to PIL (an industrial milk plant). She devotes part of her time to basket weaving and spends the remainder raising pigs and rabbits.

Irene will use the funds to buy a cow so that she can increase her milk production as well as her income. This is her first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated that she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Miriam Danixa

texts.es:
La señora MIRIAM DANIXA B. P., tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LUIS ALBERTO SANCHEZ. Presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
MIRIAM se dedica a la venta de pollo en el mercado cercano a su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró mayólicas para arreglar su puesto del mercado y también compró pollo.
Con este crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles comprará pollo y también guardará un poco para capital para poder comprar pollo al por mayor para las fiestas de fin de año y así poder estar bien abastecida para cubrir todos sus pedidos y poder aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ganancias.
Ella sueña con tener aumentar sus ventas,ahorrar un poco de dinero y tener otro puesto de pollo en otro mercado
texts.en:
Miriam Danixa B. P. is 40 years old and lives in Las Delicias district of Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to the Luis Alberto Sanchez community bank. She has finished schooling through the 5th level of secondary school, is married, and has 4 dependent children. Miriam sells chicken in the market near her house. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought ceramic tiles to fix her market stall and also bought chicken. With this loan of 1,500 PEN she will buy chicken. She will also save capital to buy poultry at wholesale prices for the holidays at the end of the year, so that she will be well-stocked to cover all her orders and thus increase sales and earn greater income. She dreams of increasing sales so that she can save enough money to open another poultry stall in a different market.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and working capital reserve.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo Antonio tiene 27 años, a esta edad es un joven que ha sabido ganarse la vida por lo que su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que cuando el inicio recibió el apoyo de su Mama para que pudiera recorrer distancias mucho más extensas, logro comprar un triciclo y entonces podría tener mucha más facilidad de transportar sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, faldas, camisetas, ropa interior que es la más solicitada por mujeres. Su deseo es tener su propio lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Antonio is 27 years old. This young man has managed to make a living from buying and selling clothes. He has been in this business for more than 8 years. Rodolfo started out with the help of his mother. He later bought a tricycle so that he could easily transport his merchandise and travel greater distances.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy pants, skirts, shirts, and underwear that are most requested by women. He hopes to have his own location where he can sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años y es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales uno es mayor de edad, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que funciona en su casa y además trabaja junto a su esposo vendiendo arena y ripio (material de construcción). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que utilizó en la compra de algunos artículos para su bodega.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1400 soles que será utilizado una parte para comprar productos para su bodega y otra parte invertirá en la compra de arena y ripio. La meta de Rosa es surgir en su bodega y tener una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a dynamic and hardworking woman who lives in Pucallpa city, in the region of Ucayali. She is 37 years old, the mother of 2 younger children and 1 adolescent. Rosa has a small grocery store in her house and also works with her husband selling sand and cobblestones (construction materials). She has been a member of "Las Flores de los Próceres” community bank for 3 years. Her first loan for 300 PEN was used to purchase items for her store. She now needs a loan of 1,400 PEN that will be used to stock her store inventory as well as to buy sand and cobblestones. Rosa's goal is to develop her grocery store and to offer a better variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her grocery store and purchase of sand and cobblestones for resale.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa vive en la comunidad D. Caluyo “Batallas” Provincia Los Andes D. la Ciudad D. El Alto.

Tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela D. la comunidad, su esposo tiene una tienda donD. venD. productos para la crianza del ganado vacuno.

La señora se dedica a la extracción D. leche y lo venD. a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora D.  leche) aparte realiza trabajo D. cestería y el tiempo restante se dedica a la crianza D. las vacas.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. un ganado vacuno así aumentara la producción D. leche y a la vez aumentará sus ingresos. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con IMPRO  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Luisa lives in the community of Caluyo "Batallas", in Los Andes province of El Alto city. She has 3 children who attend school in the community. Her husband has a store where he sells products for the care of cattle. Luisa milks cows and sells the milk to PIL (Planta Industrializadora D. Leche - Industrial Milk Plant). She also makes baskets and raises cows. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production, thus increasing her income. This is Luisa's first loan with IMPRO; the credit evaluation qualifies her to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Floria

texts.es:
Floria es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 60 años, es madre soltera de 9 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de menús (alimento), su negocio esta  ubicado en el mercado de Yarinacocha, en este negocio trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” desde hace ocho años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en productos e insumos para cocinar.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1300 soles, que será utilizado para comprar arroz, azúcar, carnes y venderlo al por mayor. La meta de Floria es tener un local propio para su restaurante, ya que el que tiene es alquilado.
texts.en:
Floria is one our dynamic and collaborative members. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 60 years old and a single mother of 9 children. She sells prepared meals at her business in the Yarinacocha Market, which enables her to support her children.

Floria joined the New Eden Communal Bank 8 years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy ingredients and cooking supplies. She is now requesting a loan of 1300 soles to purchase rice, sugar, meat, and other products in bulk. Her goal is to acquire her own space for her restaurant because she is currently in a rented location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, meat, and other products in bulk

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es:
La  alcancía comunal denominado “Club de la Amistad” esta ubicado en las Lomas de Horacio zevallos, en el distrito de ate, se encuentra  representado por la señora  Giovanna L. y conformada por 9 socios que radican en dicha zona. La señora Giovanna tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de 18, 16 y de 1 año de edad, todos ellos dependientes, el negocio al cual se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza  mediante catálogos desde hace 1 año y 1 mes.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 5 años, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta de comida rápida en los mercados, otros socios a la venta de jugos, golosinas y otros socios a la venta de ropa; con el reciente préstamo otorgado, la señora Giovanna comprara productos en stock para aumentar sus ganancias y también piensa en comprar puertas y ventanas para implementar su vivienda, todos los demás socios incrementaran su capital para así obtener una mayor productividad, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayores clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran, muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos, seguir trabajando y no defraudarlos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Club de la Amistad” is located in Las Lomas de Horacio zevallos, in the district of ate. The communal bank is represented by Mrs. Giovanna and has 9 members who live in the area. Mrs. Giovanna is 35 years old, has a live-in partner and 3 children ages 18, 16 and 1, all of them dependents. She has had a business selling beauty products from catalogs for a year and a month.

They have worked with EDAPROSPO – prosperidad for 5 years, our members are involved in different activities like selling fast food in markets, other members sell juices, sweets and others sell clothing; with the funds from the loan, Mrs. Giovanna will buy products to add her stock to increase her earnings and she is also thinking of buying doors and windows to install in her home. All the other members will increase their capital to achieve more productivity, improve their position in the market and attract more clients. The members have big dreams and goals and they are very appreciative of the institution for all the support given and promise to comply with the payments, to continue working and to not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali,  tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues tiene una bodega en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desde hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de  300 soles, que lo utilizó en la compra de abarrotes.
En la actualidad ella requiere de un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc., y surtir su negocio. La meta de Luz es tener una tienda más grande y seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is thirty years old and sells groceries from a store in her home.

She has been a member of the village bank "María Montessori" for six years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which she used to buy groceries. Now she needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy goods like rice, sugar, and pasta to stock her store.

Luz's goal is to have a larger store and move forward with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries at wholesale

loans.name: Jessica Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora JESSICA ESMERALDA V. P. tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta estudios técnicos de cosmetología,  es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y también realiza cortes e cabello, pintados, peinados, etc. a sus vecinos, amistades y familiares. Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró 2 tijeras, 1 secadora y tintes.
Con este crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles tiene planificado viajar a Lima y comprar tintes de  cabello al por mayor para así poder aumentar sus ganancias. JESSICA sueña con tener su propio centro de belleza en su domicilio para así poder trabajar con mayor tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs Jessica Esmeralda V. P. is 32 years old and lives in the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo, department La Libertad in Peru. The member belongs to the Community Bank "Las Empresarias al Exito II (The Businesswomen Toward Success). She has completed technical studies in cosmetology, lives with her partner and has 2 school age children who financially depend on her. The associate sells cosmetics and also cuts, colors, and styles hair for her neighbors, friends and family members. She used her first loan of 300 New Soles to purchase 2 pairs of scissors, a hair dryer and hair dyes. She is planning to use this loan of 1,500 New Soles to travel to Lima to buy hair color at wholesale and thus be able to increase her income. Jessica dreams of having her own beauty center in her home and therefore be able to work more peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To travel to Lima to buy hair color at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es una socia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 43 años, madre de dos hijos menores, Rosario se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y motocarro, este negocio funciona en su casa, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la venta. Integra el Banco Comunal “Las Caribeñas” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de lubricantes.
Con este crédito de 2,500 soles comprará accesorios y lubricantes de motos y  motocar. La meta de Rosario es seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ventas y así poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosario, 43, is a cheerful, hard-working member who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is the mother of two minor children. Rosario sells replacement parts for motorcycles and vehicles from her home. She and her husband work together. She has been a member of the “Las Caribeñas” communal bank for the past 3 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy lubricants. With this 2,500 sol loan she will buy vehicle replacement parts and lubricants. Her goal is to continue working to increase her profits in order to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años, es madre D. seis hijos mayores D. edad, Mercedes se dedica a la venta D. plátanos y carbón D. esta región en el puerto D. la ciudad, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien trabaja como vigilante (servicios). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” desD. hace un año, el primer préstamo que recibió D. este banco fue D. 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra D.  plátanos. Actualmente, requiere un crédito D. 1000 soles, monto que será utilizado para comprar carbón y luego venderlo al por mayor. La meta D. Mercedes es llegar a tener una tienda D. abarrotes y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 57, has been a dynamic, optimistic member of the “Corazón D. Jesús” communal bank for the past year. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has 6 adult children. She sells bananas and charcoal from the region in the city's port. She has her husband's support; he is employed as a watchman. The first loan she received from this bank was for 300 soles which she used to buy bananas. Now, she needs a 1000 sol loan which will be used to buy charcoal to resell at wholesale. Mercedes' goal is to have a grocery store and to keep helping her husband meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal at wholesale.

loans.name: Vianca Vanessa

texts.es: Vianca es una mujer colaboradora y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 24 años y es madre de un menor, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es jefe de almacén de una tienda de repuestos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, desde hace 3 años, el primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que  utilizó para invertir en productos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de abarrotes y bebidas para  vender en su bodega. La meta de Vianca es tener una distribuidora de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Vianca, 24, is a cheerful, cooperative woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has one child and sells groceries from a store that she has set up in her home. Her husband, who is the warehouse manager at a replacement parts store, supports her. She has been a member of the "La Lupuna" communal bank for the past 3 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy inventory for her store and she needs a 1500 sol loan to buy more inventory items, groceries and beverages, to sell. Vianca's goal is to be a soft-drink distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Santos Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora SANTOS EMILIANA, tiene  53 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Santos, tiene estudios hasta 6º de primaria, tiene 4 hijos y todos son independientes. La Señora Santos se dedica a la venta de comida, por las noches vende tallarines con papa guisada y migadito (plato típico de la zona), así como también tamales, cabrito, pato, pavita. Por las mañanas también se dedica a la venta de menús para algunos conocidos.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que piensa utilizarlo para comprar sus mesas y sillas donde poder atender a sus clientes. 
Santos, sueña con tener restaurante en su casa, poder habilitarla y hacer su  sueño realidad, de la mano con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
SANTOS EMILIANA, 53, lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II communal bank. Santos finished 6th grade. She has 4 children, all of whom are independent. She sells prepared meals. At night she sells pasta with fried potatoes, migadito (a dish typical of the area), as well as tamales, goat, duck, turkey. During the mornings she also sells prepared meals for her regular customers. This is her first loan. She needs 300 soles to buy tables and chairs where she can serve her customers. Santos dreams with having a well-equipped restaurant in her home and to make her dream come true hand-in-hand with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Aenid

texts.es:
La señora AENID C. C., tiene 33  años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios  hasta 5to. de secundaria, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad quienes depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de plástico como: tinas, vasos, colgadores, tazas ,platos ,jarras ,etc.
Compra sus productos al por mayor y los lleva a vender a los pueblos aledaños de la cuidad de Pacasmayo para posteriormente viajar los fines de semana a realizar sus cobranzas. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró productos de plásticos como : jarras tinas, patos, vasos, etc para llevar a Pacasmayo a venderlos.
Con este crédito de 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará también productos de plásticos como: jarras, platos, tinas, vasos , etc.
AENID sueña con aumentar sus ventas por fiestas de fin de año y así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
AENID C. C., 33, lives in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II communal bank. She finished 5th grade. She lives with her life partner and has two minor children who depend upon her economically. She buys and resells plastic items like: tubs, glasses, hangers, cups, dishes, jars, etc. She buys her products wholesale and then takes them to sell in the various towns surrounding the city of Pacasmayo. Then, she returns on the weekend to collect payment. With her first 300 new sol loan she bought plastic items like: jars, tubs, dishes, glasses, etc. to take to Pacasmayo to sell. With this 3,000 new sol loan she will again buy similar plastic items. AENID dreams with increasing her sales during the end-of-year festivities thereby increasing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic items like jars, dishes, tubs, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora   SONIA ELIZABETH D. T., tiene 36  años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios  hasta 5to  de secundaria y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad quienes depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de lencería (ropa interior) para ambos sexos de jóvenes, niños y adultos. Compra su mercadería en Lima o Chiclayo al por mayor para vender a sus vecinos, familiares y amistades. Este es su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles y lo invertirá en la compra de lencería.
Sonia sueña con aumentar sus ventas y ganancias para alquilar un stand en el mercado cerca de su casa para así poder vender con mayor frecuencia y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia Elizabeth D. T. is 36 years old and lives in the District of Salaverry, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Empresarias al Éxito II” (Successful Businesswomen II). Sonia completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has two dependent children.

Sonia buys and sells lingerie and underwear for young people, children, and adults of both sexes. She purchases her products in either Lima or Chiclayo at wholesale and then sells them to her neighbors, relatives, and acquaintances. This is her first loan, which is in the amount of 300 soles and will be used to buy lingerie. Sonia dreams of increasing her sales and profits so that she can rent a stand at the market near her house. This will enable her to make more frequent sales and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
La señora Sara es la secretaria D. la alcancía comunal "María Auxiliadora", lleva trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por más D. 2 años, tiempo en que ha crecido, cumpliendo metas y proponiéndose otras nuevas.
Sara es madre D. 6 hijos, todos ya son independientes, aunque siempre buscan a su madre para estar en su compañía o para escuchar una voz D. ayuda.
Hace algunos atrás cuando sus hijos aun eran pequeño, como la mayoría D. las madres, era ama D. casa pero siempre tenia el deseo que hacer otras cosas, pasaron los años y el mayor D. sus hijos comenzó a trabajar en Topy Top, porque tenia que hacerse responsable D. su hijo que pronto iba a nacer, pero, al mismo tiempo en que su pareja iba a dar a luz, el hijo D. Sara se enferma D. los bronquios, llegando a estar muy grave, entonces Sara, una buena, madre tuvo que buscar como sanar a su hijo y comenzó a venD. menú, con el fin D. obtener ganancias con las que compraría las medicinas para su hijo y a la vez para el cuidado D. su nuera y su nieto.
Fue un tiempo difícil que supero para el bien D. todos, ahora después D. un tiempo ella aun continua vendiendo menú en su casa por descubrió que es una manera fácil y entretenida D. hacer dinero, en todo el tiempo trabajando ya se compro su cocina, su refrigeradora, y otros instrumentos D. cocina.
Ahora su gran sueño es tener un minimarket y un restaurante, sueño que dentro D. poco será una meta, y meta que cumplirá gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sara is the secretary of the María Auxiliadora Communal Bank, which has been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than 2 years. The group has grown over time, with the members completing their goals and proposing new ones.

Sara is the mother of 6 children. Even though they are adults, they still look to their mother for company or as a voice of support that will listen to them. Like most mothers, she was a homemaker when her children were still young. However, she had the desire to do other things. After many years passed, her oldest son began working at Topy Top (a Latin American chain of apparel stores) because his partner was about to give to their child and he wanted to be responsible. After the baby was born, Sara’s son developed a serious case of bronchitis. Being a good mother, Sara began selling prepared meals during his recovery so that she could purchase his medicines and look after her daughter-in-law and grandchild.

Even though this was a difficult time, everything turned out well in the end. Sara continues to sell meals out of her home because she found it to be an easy and enjoyable way to make money. She spends most of the time working out of her kitchen, utilizing her refrigerator and cooking utensils. Sara now hopes to open both a mini-market and a restaurant. With her hard work and perseverance, she knows she can fulfill this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Martha Regina

texts.en: Martha Regina is a very good customer of Fundacion Leon 2000, this is also her second loan on Kiva. Martha Regina is married and has two children, ages 9 and 2. She will use this loan to purchase cleaning materials: hand towels, sponges, etc. Previously she was selling clothing, but she has decided to switch to a product with lower overhead. Martha Regina dreams of being able to best serve her customers, with a solid business and quality products.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Marcelina Katherine

texts.es:
La señora MARCELINA KATHERINE  V. S., tiene 33 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios superiores de secretariado y técnicos de manualidades en tela y vidrios, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica elaboración de manualidades como: carteras, manteles, vitrales, bolsos, etc. Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar telas, pinturas, cintas, hilos, algodón, etc para elaborar sus manualidades.
Marcelina sueña con aumentar sus ventas para asi obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcelina Katherine V. S. is 33 years old and lives in the District of Salaverry, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Empresarias al Éxito II” (Successful Businesswomen II). Marcelina completed secretarial school as well as technical training in fabric and glass handicrafts. She has two young children who are financially dependent on her.

Marcelina makes handicrafts such as satchels, tablecloths, stained glass, purses, etc. This will be her first loan of 300 soles, which will be used to buy fabrics, paints, ribbons, yarn, cotton, and other materials for her handmade items. She dreams of increasing her sales so that her earnings will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, paints, ribbons, yarn, cotton, and other materials

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es el nombre D. un grupo  que pertenece al Centro Focal  Juan Pablo II, con 17 integrantes, su mesa directiva esta conformada por Ana María J. como la presidenta, Lidia A. ocupa la cartera D. Tesorera y Manuela C. es la Secretaria D. Actas. Del total D. sus integrantes tres D. ellas venden productos D. belleza en diferentes ferias, cuatro venden CDs y DVDs, cinco se dedican a la venta D. ropa (pantalones, chompas y otros) uno confecciona trajes, otra teje mantas, una venD. masitas, otra venD. material D. escritorio y una venD. comida.

Ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Esperanza (“Hope”) is the name of a group that belongs to Juan Pablo II Center. There are 17 members. The board of directors is maD. up of Ana María J., president; Lidia A., Treasurer; and Manuela C., Secretary.

Three group members sell beauty products in various markets, four sell CDs and DVDs, five sell clothing (pants, sweaters, etc.), one makes suits, one sews blankets, one sells cakes, one sells office supplies, and one sells food.

The group is seeking a loan that will be used to purchase merchandise and raw materials for all these various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise and raw materials for various businesses

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.en: Sonia is 58 years old, and has three adult children. Her business is the sale of nacatamales and tamales relleno and other typical Nicaraguan foods.  She also makes and sells natural juices and a typical Nicaraguan drink called atol. These skills have been passed down from her mother and she has developed a strong reputation for her excellent products. This loan will go towards the purchase of ingredients for the tamales. She dreams of improving her business so that she is able to provide for her grandchildren. Sonia has a good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Ursula Marina

texts.es:
La señora URSULA MARINA E. A. tiene 29 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque se casó a temprana edad y tiene 1 hijo  de 5 años de edad quien dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como : arroz, menestras ,jugos, golosinas ,leche, cerveza, gaseosa, etc en la tienda que tiene en su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro: 2 sacos de arroz y azúcar al por mayor, botellas de aceite y cerveza.
Con este crédito de 1,500 comprará productos como; arroz, azúcar, cerveza, gaseosas, golosinas, leche, etc para surtir su tienda
URSULA   sueña con poco a poco ir implementando su tienda y así poder tener todo lo necesario para vender.
texts.en:
Sra. Ursula Marina E. A. is 29 years old and lives in the District of Salaverry, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Empresarias al Éxito II” (Successful Businesswomen II). Ursula completed her education through the 3rd year of secondary school. She did not continue her studies because she married early and now has 5 year old child who is financially dependent on her.

Ursula sells food products such as rice, dried vegetables, juices, candy, milk, beer, sodas, etc., from the store she operates out of her home. With her first of 300 soles, she bought two sacks of rice and sugar at wholesale, bottles of oil, and beer. She is now requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy rice, sugar, beer, sodas, candy, milk, and other products to restock her store. Ursula hopes to gradually expand her store so that she can sell every type of necessity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory to restock her store

loans.name: Brisas De California Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Brisas de California”, esta ubicado en la entrada de Chosica, distrito de Lurigancho es una alcancía que trabaja con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace unos días, esta conformado por 7 socios, asume el cargo de presidenta la señora Celia Rosa de 45 años de edad, casada, con 6 hijos dependientes, se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de maíz, papa, queso, morón, menestras, entre otros. Celia incursiono en este negocio porque ella es de la Sierra Central D. país y tiene la facilidad de que su familia le provee los productos para poder venderlos, un grupo de socios se dedican a las actividades de servicio como ayudante cocinero, otro presta servicio de albañil y chofer de transporte publico y otro grupo se dedica a la venta de  comidas y refrescos en los mercados.
 Nuestros socios decidieron el nombre de Brisas de California ya que en el lugar donde viven tiene dicho nombre y se sienten mas identificados con el, con su reciente préstamo todos los socios lo invertirán para ampliar su pequeño negocio y con ello tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Los socios están muy contentos y valoran el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a la devolución  D. préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The “Brisas de California” [California Breezes] communal bank is located at the entrance to Chosica, Lurigancho district. It’s a new communal bank that has been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for a few days. It is made up of 7 members. The president is Celia Rosa. She is 45 years old and married, with six dependant children. She sells corn, potatoes, cheese, vegetable stews, and other things as a street vendor. Celia got into this business because she is from the central mountains areas of the country and she has the advantage that her family supplies her with the products to sell. One group of members work in services, such as: being a cook’s assistant; another works as a mason and a bus driver. Another group of members sells food and drinks in the markets. Our members decided to use the name “Brisas de California” because this is the name of the place where they live and they identify with it. Their recent loan, each member will invest to expand their small businesses and therefore have a better quality of life. The members are very content and they value the support provided to them and they pledge to repay the loan in the determined amount of time.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: con su reciente préstamo todos los socios lo invertirán para ampliar su pequeño negocio

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora ELENA G. S., tiene 58 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. Elena es madre soltera por lo cual desde joven tuvo que trabajar arduamente para criar a su hijos sin ayuda del padre de ellos, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad quienes no dependen económicamente de ella; sino ella cuenta con el apoyo de ellos ya que mensualmente ellos le dan su propina y cuando se enferma la llevan al médico.
La socia se dedica a la venta de menús y cenas en su domicilio. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró productos alimenticios como: arroz , menestras, fideos, aceite, papa, etc para preparar los menús y cenas.
Con este crédito de 3,000 nuevos soles comprará productos alimenticios para preparar sus menús como: arroz, aceite, menestras, fideos, etc
Elena sueña con tener su restaurante en su domicilio para así aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
ELENA G. S., 58, lives in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO communal bank. She finished 11th grade. Elena is a single mother and had to work very hard from a very early age to support her children without any help from their father. She has 4 children, all of whom are adults now and do not depend upon her economically. Quite the contrary, she receives some help from them in that they give her their tip money each month and they take her to the doctor when she gets sick. She sells prepared meals and dinners in her home. With her first 300 new sol loan she bought food products like rice, vegetables, pasta, oil, potatoes, etc. to prepare her meals and dinners. With this new 3,000 sol loan she will again buy similar products to continue preparing her meals. She dreams with having a restaurant in her home and thereby increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her meals like rice, oil, vegetables, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Rubith

texts.es: Rubith es una persona dinámica y  trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 27 años, está casada y es madre de un menor de edad. Su esposo es obrero de construcción. Rubith  se dedica a la venta de zapatos, actividad que realiza junto con su mamá, este negocio funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en  la compra de zapatos para vender. Actualmente,requiere un crédito de 1200 soles, monto que invertirá en la compra de zapatos, que trae desde la ciudad de Lima. La meta de Rubith es tener un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Rubith, 27, is a dynamic, hard-working person. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is married and the mother of one child. Her husband is a construction worker. Rubith sells shoes with her mother from her home. She has been a member of the “Corazón de Jesús” communal bank for the past 2 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy shoes to sell. Now, she requires a 1,200 sol loan to invest in shoes which she brings from Lima. Rubith's goal is to have a sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Darlyn Yessenia

texts.en:
Darlyn is 26 years old and has two children, ages 8 and 3. Darlyn Yessenia has a small store, called a pulperia. She started her business six years ago when she began selling ice and beverages, then little by little she expanded her inventory to include staple foods and basic household items. Darlyn has established a good customer base, to whom she offers small credit lines. 

This loan will go towards the purchase of a new refrigerator so Darlyn can expand her inventory to include popsicles, soft drinks and meat. She will also buy more grains to replenish her stock. Her goal is to put in a floor in her  house, currently it is made of dirt. Darlyn is a very good client of Fundacion Leon 2000.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for storing perishable inventory

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
Hipolita is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is from Anta, and is part of a communal bank there consisting of 19 members.  The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta.  She is 50 years old and married with four children and two grandchildren.

Hipolita has a grocery stall at the Sunday market in the main plaza.  She also raises 80 chickens.  Each one costs 40 Peruvian soles (about $14 US) but the price can rise and fall with the market so her business changes.  With this loan, she will feed her chickens and stock her grocery stall.

Hipolita appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To feed her chickens and stock her grocery stall

loans.name: Jhon Angel

texts.es:
El socio JHON ANGEL, pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 3 hijos los tres son varones, el mayor tiene 3 años y esta en el jardin, el segundo tiene 1 año y el ultimo tiene 3 meses de nacido, el es abogado y tiene 2 años ejerciendo su profesión, el actualmente tiene una empresa de asesoria, el trabaja junto con su esposa que también es abogada, el socio necesita el crédito para poder implementar cosas que faltan en la oficina, como comprar libros actualizados, escritorios(muebles), computadoras, etc. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JHON ANGEL, 31, is a member of the “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES" communal bank. He is from the city of Cusco. He is in a common-law relationship and has 3 sons. The eldest is 3 and is in kindergarten, the second son is 1 year old, and the youngest is 3 months old. He is a lawyer and has been engaged in his profession for 2 years. He has a consulting firm which he operates with his wife, who is also a lawyer. He needs these funds to furnish is office with up-to-date books, desks, computers, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity offered in this manner and pledges to make his repayments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide consulting services to commercial establishments.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 57 years old. He is married and has three children ages 19, 17, and 15. Only the youngest is in school - the older two have jobs.  His business is the creation and sale of large baskets, rope and leather pieces. He has had this business for 19 years.

This loan will go towards the purchase of materials to make his crafts. Antonio hopes that he will one day be able to include in his inventory products like hammocks, chairs and embroidered products. Antonio has been a good client of Fundacion Leon 2000 for many years.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Celinda

texts.en:
Maria Celinda T. Obanda runs a restaurant in the Fortin district of Guayquil. She is married and has 5 children.  Only one of her daughters still lives with her.  Maria Celinda works every day from 5 a.m. to 2 p.m. serving breakfast and lunch to people who work in the area. Her husband helps out in the kitchen when he is needed.

Her restaurant is a popular place to eat and has a lot of regular clients. During the weekdays she has about 30-35 clients daily, while during the holidays/weekends she can have up to 80-90 clients daily. 

Due to high activity, Maria Celinda has hired two employees who help her in the restaurant. Among the dishes served in the restaurant are local dishes of fish, steak and pork.

Maria Celinda requests a loan to buy more products for her restaurant such as rice, olive oil, fish and meat. This will help her scale up her business and serve more customers. 

Maria Celinda dreams of upgrading her house from cane to bricks, and hopefully an increase in sales will help her achieve this.

loans.use: To buy fish, steak and pork

loans.name: Lionel

texts.en:
Lionel is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  He is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Anta.  The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta.  He is from Anta and lives in Anta.  He is 46 years old and lives with his partner and has 2 children.

Lionel sells wood to carpenters. With this loan, he will buy more trees and wood to sell.

Lionel appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy trees and wood to sell

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa Ysabel es una socia activa y perseverante, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 56 años, es madre D. seis  hijos mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y además es costurera, su esposo es profesor jubilado. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza” desD. hace ocho años, ella empezó en el Banco con un crédito D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en abarrotes para su bodega.
Con este crédito D. 2000 soles, comprará abarrotes, también invertirá en la compra D. telas y repuestos para su máquina D. coser. La meta D. Rosa es ampliar su negocio y surtirlo.
texts.en:
Rosa Ysabel, 56, has been a persevering, active member of the “Juan Zaplana Belliza” communal bank for the past 8 years. She is the mother of six adult children. She sells groceries but is also a seamstress. Her husband is a retired teacher. She began her association with the bank with a 300 sol loan which allowed her to purchase inventory for her grocery store. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy groceries but will also invest in the purchase of fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machine. Her goal is to expand and stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries, fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Edith Bettcide

texts.es:
Edith es una mujer activa y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es madre de tres hijos y uno de ellos es menor de edad, Edith tiene productos de pasamanería y algunas prendas de vestir, que los vende en su casa; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a construcción civil. Edith forma parte del Banco Comunal  “María  Montessori” desde hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles  que le permitió invertir en juguetes y venderlos en campaña navideña.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, comprará prendas de vestir para su tienda. El sueño de Edith es tener un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Edith is an active and enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is not yet an adult. Edith sells upholstery products and some items of clothing from her home. She is supported by her husband who works in civil construction. Edith has formed part of the community bank “María Montessori” for six years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which allowed her to buy toys and sell them at the Christmas fair. With this loan of 1500 soles she will buy items of clothing for her store. Edith's dream is to have her own market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items of clothing for her store

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Anta.  The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta.  She is from Anta and lives in Anta.  She is 52 years old, lives with her partner and has 4 children who are studying at a university in Cusco.

Irma has had a grocery stall for the last 15 years in the Sunday market.  She sells various items such as vegetables and dry goods.  She buys her items from Huancaro, a neighborhood with many wholesalers.  With this loan, she will stock her grocery store with more items.  She feels that Arariwa helps her and her family a great deal.

Irma appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To stock her grocery stall

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 5 meses de nacido y vive junto a su esposa en casa de su padre ubicada en el sector San Juan de Paredones – Muy Finca, en el distrito de Mochumí, a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Cría cerdos, ovejas y patos los cuales vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Paralelamente también trabaja como obrero agrícola y eventualmente ayuda a su padre en el mantenimiento de sus campos de cultivo. Con estos ingresos trata de mantener y sacar adelante a su joven familia.

Hace dos semanas una de sus cerdas parió 10 cerditos. El planea criarlos y mantenerlos saludables para luego venderlos, pero los recursos que tiene no le abastecen para comprar los alimentos balanceados que ellos requieren. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
