Su más grande anhelo es poder construir su casa propia, para ello trabaja constantemente. El es muy conocido por los vecinos de la zona que lo consideran una persona honrada y servicial.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29 years of age and has a 5 month old son. He and his wife live in his father's house, which is located in the San Juan de Paredones – Muy Finca sector, in the Mochumí district, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For four years he has raised small animals such as pigs, sheep and ducks, which he has then sold to businessmen who frequent the area. At the same time he has also worked in agriculture and helped his father maintain his farming land. With this income he has tried to keep his young family going and move them forward. Two weeks ago one of his pigs gave birth to ten piglets. He plans to raise them and keep them healthy so that he can sell them later on, but his earnings aren't enough to provide the balanced diet that they require. For this reason he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 600 nuevos soles. His greatest wish is to be able to build his own house, for which he works constantly. He is very well known by the residents of his neighbourhood who consider him to be an honourable and helpful person.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional food to raise piglets

location.town: Sector Paredones - Muy Finca - Mochumí - Lambayequ

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora ANDREA S. S., tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LUIS ALBERTO S.. Presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria, debido a la falta de recursos económicos empezó a trabajar desde jóvenes. Ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ya todos mayores por lo cual no dependen económicamente de ella.
Andrea sé decida a sembrar maíz en sus chacras que tiene en el distrito de moche pero hace 2 semanas no está trabajando porque se encuentra enferma de las vías urinarias. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro abono y semillas de maíz al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles empezará a sembrar zanahoria, alberja y también comprará abono para sus chacras. Ella sueña con tener una buena cosecha para así poder obtener dinero para sus gastos.
texts.en:
Andrea S. S. is 49 years old and lives in Las Delicias district in Trujillo, a province of La Libertad department of Peru. She belongs to the community bank Luis Alberto S.. She studied up until Year 9 at secondary school, but because of scarce economic resources she began to work from a young age. She is married and has three children who are all adults and no longer depend on her economically. Andrea grows corn on her small farms which are located in the Moche district. However, 2 weeks ago she had to stop work due to a urinary tract infection. With her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles she bought fertiliser and corn seeds in bulk. With this loan of 600.00 nuevos soles she will begin to sow carrots and peas and she will also buy fertiliser for her farm. Andrea dreams of having a good harvest to be able to obtain enough money to cover her costs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin sowing carrots and peas and buy fertiliser for her farms

loans.name: Lidia Lili

texts.es: Lidia Lili es una socia trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 61 años, vende todos los días desde muy temprano de la mañana, tamales y frejol cocinado,  su kiosco funciona en la vereda de su casa.  Ella es madre de un hijo  mayor de edad. Su esposo es mecánico soldador. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desde hace nueve años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su dinamismo y puntualidad. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar pollos y luego venderlos, en la actualidad Lidia necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, que será utilizado para comprar pollos y venderlos en éstas fiestas navideñas. La meta de Lidia es tener una fuente de soda. Además agregó que esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque gracias a los prestamos, ella pudo construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lidia Lili, 61, has been a hard-working, optimistic, member of the “María Montessori" communal bank for the past 9 years. She has always been known for her dynamism and punctuality. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. Every day, from very early in the morning, she sells tamales and cooked black eye beans. She has her vending stall in her yard. She is the mother of one adult son. Her husband is a welder. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy chickens for resale. Lidia now needs 1,600 soles to buy chickens to sell during the Christmas season. Lidia's goal is to have a soda fountain. She added, also, that she is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past loans granted that allowed her to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja (Ladislao) de 42 años, con y sus hijos; en su casa, donde también pusieron su taller de mecánica.

Hace 10 años que ambos trabajan en el planchado y pintado de carros, obteniendo muy buenos ingresos por ello, pues cada vez son más lo clientes que se acercan a su taller para refaccionar sus vehículos. A Esperanza siempre le ha gustado este rubro y trabaja de igual a igual con los dos ayudantes que contrataron para el negocio, ya que todos pensarán que por el hecho de ser mujer no puede ejercer tan pesado oficio, pero están muy equivocados, pues ella es muy buena en lo que hace y lo hace con gusto, ahí radica su principal fortaleza, ya que esto logra que sus acabados sean los mejores. A ella le gusta dedicarse más a su trabajo que realizar las labores del hogar, pero esto no significa que no las realice, pues tiene dos hijos en edad escolar a los cuales debe atender, aun así le alcanza el tiempo para dedicarse a su principal pasatiempo como ella dice, ya que más que un trabajo es un bonito pasatiempo que le encanta realizar. 

Con MFP ya va en su cuarto préstamo y es muy puntual con todos los pagos, al igual que su grupo solidario. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará material para arreglar vehículos como planchas de metal, pintura, masilla, etc. y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 31, lives with her partner (Ladislao, 42) and their children in their home where they also set up their car repair shop. It's been 10 years that both of them have worked in detailing and painting cars and their earnings have been good because more and more customers come to them for their vehicle repair needs. Esperanza has always enjoyed this kind of work and she works shoulder to shoulder with the two helpers they hired despite what some may think that, being a woman, she would not be able to handle such heavy work. But they would be very mistaken for she is very good at her job and she does it happily. Therein lies her greatest strength in that it is her detailing work that turns out to be the best. She enjoyes her work more than housework but this doesn't mean she doesn't do it too for she has two school-aged children to tend to. Even so she finds the time to enjoy her favorite hobby, as she calls it, since she believes that more than a job, it is a pleasant hobby that she thoroughly enjoys doing. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very punctual with her repayments and with her group meetings. With these funds she will buy supplies for car repair such as: sheet metal, paint, putty, etc. to be able to offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her car repair shop.

loans.name: Josue Omar

texts.es:
El socio JOSUE OMAR, pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socia tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero, vive actualmente en la ciudad del Cusco, el es bachiller en administración de empresas y trabaja en la entidad bancaria Scotiabank, el tiene 2 años ejerciendo su profesión, el socio necesita el crédito para poder implementar una oficina para vender tarjetas de celulares pre pago y hacer llamadas virtuales, necesita comprar muebles, computadoras, etc.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JOSUE OMAR, 38, is a member of the “PROGRESO DE LOS ANDES" communal bank. He is from the city of Cusco. He is single and currently lives in the city of Cusco. He is a graduate in business administration and has worked for Scotiabank for the past two years. He needs funding to set up an office to sell pre-paid cell phone cards as well as to make virtual phone calls. He needs furniture, computers, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity this means offers and pledges to make his repayments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell pre-paid cell phone cards.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo (Braulio), de 47 años, y con sus 2 hijas; Cerafine de 13 y Satomi de 3, en su casa propia.

La venta de carne ha significado la principal fuente de sustento de su familia, hace 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde y obtiene muy buenos ingresos por ello. Todos estos años la han hecho una experta en el conocimiento de las carnes, teniendo muchos clientes que prefieren comprar estos alimentos por la confianza que Gloria les da. 
A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite conversar con sus amigas que siempre vienen a comprarle para cocinar el almuerzo de sus familias. Para el futuro le gustaría tener un puesto más grande y mejor equipado, pero sabe que poco a poco se llega lejos, es por ello que trabaja y espera paciente las mejoras que cada vez va obteniendo su negocio.

Este es segundo préstamo con MFP y ella se siente contenta con el trabajo en su grupo solidario, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy puntuales y buenas amigas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de carne para mejorar sus ventas y así poder brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijas
texts.en:
Gloria, 38, lives in her own home with her husband (Braulio, 47) and their two daughters: Cerafine, 13, and Satomi, 3. The family's main source of income is meat sales and she has been involved in this activity for the past 9 years working from 8 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. She has earned good profits. All these years of work have turned her into quite the expert on meats and many of her customers prefer to buy from her because of the trust Gloria inspires in them. She likes her work very much in that it allows her to socialize with her friends who always come to buy ingredients from her for their daily family meal preparation. For the future, she would like to have a larger, better equipped, stand. She knows, however, that little steps lead to big accomplishments so she works steadily and patiently waits for the improvements her business gets over time. This is her second loan from MFP and she is very happy with the support she gets from her fellow members, all of whom are very punctual and good friends. With these funds she would like to buy greater quantities of meat to improve her sales thereby offering her daughters a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Punto Nueve, perteneciente al distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de pescado, dicho producto es adquirido en el terminal pesquero de la región (ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa, a 25 minutos de Chiclayo). El vende su producto de martes a sábado utilizando su mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utlizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). Con la ayuda de esta unidad móvil ofrece su mercadería en los caseríos aledaños a la zona en donde vive.

Durante el tiempo en que no se encuentra vendiendo pescado se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su unidad móvil. Estas dos actividades son la única fuente de ingreso con las que sostiene a su familia.

El continuo uso de su mototaxi ha hecho que esta requiera mantenimiento urgente en el motor así como un cambio de sus llantas que están muy desgastadas. Por este motivo el se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan mantener operativo a su principal herramienta de trabajo.

Su más grande anhelo es terminar de construir su casa, la cual esta construida de material rústico. El es un padre honrado, trabajador y que siempre trata de sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Hilario, 29, lives with his wife and 4 children in the Punto Nueve sector, which belongs to the Mochumí district, which is half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 6 years he has sold fish which he gets from the regional fish distribution terminal (located in the Santa Rosa district, 25 minutes from Chiclayo). From Tuesday to Saturday he travels selling his product using his mototaxi (a motorized, 3-wheel, vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo). With the help of this vehicle he is able to offer his product for sale in the hamlets surrounding the area where he lives. When he isn't selling fish he transports passengers with his vehicle. These two activites are the only source of income with which he supports his family. The constant use to which his mototaxi is subjected makes the need for engine maintenance, as well as tire replacement, urgent. For this reason he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 new soles which will allow him to keep his main work took operational. His greatest hope is to finish building his house which is currently made of rudimentary materials. He is an honest, hard-working father who always tries his best to see his loved ones get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and maintain his delivery vehicle.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a client of Asociación Arariwa. He is part of a communal bank consisting of nineteen members in Anta. The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta. Jose is from Anta and lives in Anta. He is 44 years old and lives with his wife.

Jose sells animals at the Sunday market, particularly sheep and chickens. He also works far away during the week. With this loan, he will buy more animals to sell.

Jose appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

**Note: Because Jose works far away during the week, his wife represents him at the group meetings when he cannot come so she is pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de 34 años, vive con sus 3 hijos: Milton de 17, Antony de 15, Karla de 12 y Adamary de 11 años, en su casa propia.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, actividad que aprendió de su madre y le arroja buenos ingresos, ya que el acabado que le brinda Judith a sus prendas es muy bueno, por lo que todos sus clientes siempre la buscan para solicitar sus servicios.
A ella le gusta su trabajo y lo realiza muy contenta, aunque muchas veces deba lidiar con algunos inconvenientes, como el cansancio por las largas horas de trabajo que le dedica, a pesar de ello siempre logra entregar los pedidos que le realizan y dejar contenta a su clientela.  Para el futuro desea expandir su taller de costura y hacerlo más productivo.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, logrando que sea muy querida en su grupo solidario. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela y otros materiales necesarios para entregar los pedidos que le solicitaron y así mejorar los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Judith is a 34 year old woman who lives with her 4 children: Milton, 17; Antony, 15, Karla, 12, and Admary, 11. She lives in her own house.

For five years, she has been engaged in making clothing, an activity that she learned from her mother that produces good income for her since the styling Judith puts into her garments is very good. That’s why all her customers seek her out in order to ask for her services.

She likes her work and carries it out quite gladly, although many times she has to contend with inconveniences such as fatigue due to the long hours of work she performs. In spite of this, she always succeeds in delivering orders that she carries out and in leaving her customers happy. For the future, her wish is to expand her sewing workshop and make it more productive.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she has always been characterized by being very punctual in making all her payments, succeeding in being very well regarded in her communal bank. With the money that she is now applying for she will buy a greater quantity of fabric and other materials necessary in order to fill the orders given to her and, thus, improve the earnings of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles

loans.name: Betty Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Betty tiene 32  años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios  hasta 3ero de secundaria porque por falta de recursos económicos se fue a trabajar de empleada domestica a la ciudad de Lima, es soltera y no tiene hijos, pero tiene una sobrina de 4 años de edad a su cargo quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, atún, galletas, golosinas, leche, etc en la tienda que tiene en su casa. Con su primer crédito  de 200 nuevos soles compró lo andamios para su tienda.
Con este crédito de 200 nuevos soles comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, leche, jugos, etc para surtir su tienda que tiene en su casa y así poder aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias.
Betty sueña con hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Betty, 32, lives in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the Las Empresarias al Éxito II Communal Bank. She went to school until her third year of high school. Due to the lack of economic resources, she went to work as a domestic employee in the city of Lima. She is single, and she does not have children. But, she is raising her four year old niece who is economically dependent upon her. She sells food like rice, sugar, tuna, crackers, sweets, and milk in the store that she has in her house. With her first loan for 200 PEN she bought scaffolding for her store. With this loan for 200 PEN she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, milk, and juice, etc. to stock the store she has in her house. This way she will be able to increase her sales and her earnings. Betty dreams of making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, milk, and juice, etc.

loans.name: Maria Celeny

texts.es: Maria Celeny vive en su propia casa con su hijo que todavía depende de ella. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa. Anteriormente ella no tenía el capital suficiente para seguir adelante, ya para iniciar a trabajar una amiga le facilito un préstamo y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su humilde vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Celeny lives in her own house with her child, who is still dependent upon her. She has been selling clothes for over ten years. Previously, she did not have enough capital to get ahead. In order to start to work, a friend provided a loan. Little by little her business has been growing. The loan she is asking for is to buy products. Her wish is to provide improvements to her humble home for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 42 años, vive en su casa propia con su pareja y sus tres hijos, los cuales son su adoración y motivo para salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también a la elaboración de ricas “chocotejas” (chocolates), las cuales le resultan muy rentables en época de invierno y primavera, ya que el inclemente frío hace que la gente quiera calentarse comiendo este riquísimo dulce. Pero como ya que estamos próximos al verano, Margarita es conciente que la demanda de sus chocotejas bajará, es por ello que piensa invertir en la compra de más productos de belleza, su otro negocio, el cual le gusta tanto como la elaboración de los chocolates. 
Margarita siempre ha trabajado y le ha puesto muchas ganas a lo que hace, es por ello que al negocio que se dedique le resultará satisfactorio, pues como ella dice: “si uno se dedica bien al trabajo, éste le corresponde”.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP con su nuevo grupo solidario, ya que anteriormente perteneció a otro grupo y ahora espera ser tan puntual como lo fue con sus anteriores créditos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y así logrará buenos ingresos este verano.
texts.en:
Margarita, 42, lives in her own house with her life partner and their three children. She adores them, and they are her motivation to get ahead. For five years she has been selling beauty products and making rich “chocotejas” (chocolates). These are very popular in the winter and spring because the inclement cold makes people want to warm themselves by eating this rich sweet. Now that we are close to summer, Margarita is aware the demand for her chocotejas will go down. That is why she plans to buy more beauty products for her other business, which she likes as much as making chocolates. Margarita has always worked and put much effort into what she does. That is why the business she devotes herself to is satisfactory. As she says, “If one devotes themselves well to their work, the work will respond in kind.” This is her first loan with MFP with her new supportive group. She previously belonged to a different group. She now expects to be punctual like was with her previous loans. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy beauty products. That way she will get good income this summer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 36 años, vive con Wiler, su pareja de 31 años, y con sus 2 hijas; Sandra de 9 y Bárbara de 1 año de edad, en su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a venta de productos de belleza, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 2 años para proveer a su familia de todo lo que quiere ofrecerles. A Ofelia siempre le ha gustado sentirse independiente, es por ello que le gusta mucho su trabajo, aunque si bien le da ciertas libertades en los horarios, no quita que sea muy cansado recorrer las casas de sus familiares, amigas y vecinas para mostrar los catálogos y productos cada mes.
Lo bueno es que Ofelia gana cada vez más experiencia y esto logra que obtenga mejores ventas y mayor clientela. Para el futuro, desea tener una tienda (bazar) donde poder ofrecer, de manera más cómoda, todos sus productos.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, que estén en oferta para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 36. She lives with Wiler, her 31 year old life partner, and their two daughters. Sandra is 9, and Bárbara is 1. They live in their own house. She sells beauty products. She has been doing this for two years in order to provide her family with everything that she wants to give them. Ofelia has always liked feeling independent. That is why she likes to work so much. Even though it gives her a certain amount of freedom in her schedule, it does not mitigate how tired she gets from going to her family’s, friends’, and neighbors’ houses to show them the catalogs and products each month. The good thing is that Ofelia gets more experience each time, and this helps her get more sales and more customers. In the future, she wishes to have a store (bazaar), where she would be able to sell all of her products more comfortably. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with all of her payments. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy a greater quantity of beauty products that are on sale in order to have them in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo, su hija y sus nietos. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y amistosa que se dedica al tejido D. chompas, las cuales venD. por pedido a los diversos clientes que tiene en la zona en la que vive. 

Además D. esta actividad también se dedica a atender la bodega que tiene en su casa, la cual puso en asociación con su hija, para así apoyarse mutuamente en la generación D. más ingresos económicos.
Es así que Teodora se dedica paralelamente a los dos negocios, tejiendo mientras atienD. su bodega y lo hace D. lunes a domingo, ya que es muy demandada por los clientes que día a día se acercan a adquirir sus productos que son muy variados. 
A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le da cierta libertad para poder valerse por sí misma sin depender del sueldo D. su esposo. En un futuro le gustaría hacer crecer su bodega para así generar mayores ingresos a su familia.

Teodora es una clienta muy antigua en MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en sus pagos, sintiéndose muy orgullosa por ello. Con el dinero que ahora solicita abastecerá su tienda con productos más variados y así implementarla D. una mejor manera para captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Teodora, 55, lives in her own house with her husband, daughter, and grandchildren. She is a very happy and friendly woman. She makes sweaters, which she sells by order to the diverse customers that she has in the area where she lives. In addition to this activity, she also tends a convenience store, which she has in her house. She set up the store with her daughter in order to support each other in generating more income. That is how Teodora works simultaneously in two businesses. She weaves while she works in the store. She does this Monday through Sunday. Her various products are in much demand by her customers. They come to the store day to day to get her products. She really likes her work. It gives her a certain amount of freedom and the ability to believe in herself without being dependent upon her husband’s salary. In the future she would like to make her store grow in order to generate greater income for her family. Teodora is a long time client of MFP. She has always been characterized by the punctuality of her payments, and she is very proud of that. She will use the money she is now asking for to stock her store with a greater variety of products. That way the store will be set up better in order to get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up her store with food

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia es una socia activa y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre de dos hijos, uno de ellos es mayor.  Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, su esposo que la apoya, es obrero. Además tiene un motocar que lo alquila, ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús” desde hace dos años, empezó en el Banco Comunal con un crédito de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en zapatos. 
Actualmemnte, Delicia requiere un crédito de 2000 soles, monto que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza y repuestos para su motocar. La meta de Delicia es llegar a tener un bazar y salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Delicia is an active and perseverent member. She lives in the Pucallpa region of Ucayali. She is 44 and has two children. One of them is grown. She sells beauty products by catalog. Her husband, a workman, helps her. She also has a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) that she rents out. She has been part of the Corazón de Jesús Communal Bank for two years. She started in the Communal Bank with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to buy shoes. Delicia currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy beauty products and spare parts for her motocarro. Delicia’s goal is to have a bazaar and to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products and spare parts for her motocarro

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Paz se formo en la ciudad de Cuenca,  ésta es una ciudad muy rica por su cultura y tradiciones como los días de los santos inocentes, el pase del niño viajero, entre otras, costumbres que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero. Sus integrantes  son un grupo de personas que se unieron para buscar mejoras sociales y económicas logrando consolidar una gran amistad, respeto  y ayuda mutua para salir adelante con sus familias.
< p>
La señora  María D. es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la parroquia de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 47 años de edad y se encuentra separada de su esposo hace varios años, tiene 5 hijos de 28, 25, 21, 16 y 4 años de edad, sus  primeros hijos ya trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos de la casa, aun no tienen casa propia viven arrendando. 

María trabaja en el mercado 9 de Octubre de la ciudad de Cuenca desde  hace 28 años, vende  todo tipo de grano tierno y cocinado, su trabajo consiste en recorrer todo el mercado  ofreciendo sus productos.

Este es su tercer año trabajando con los  préstamos de la banca comunal y segura que con ellos ha podido sobrellevar su negocio,  con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACION ESPOIR  va a comprar otra variedad de granos secos como arveja, fréjol, habas, maní, etc. para abastecer mejor su negocio y así atraer a más clientes.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia para tranquilidad de toda la familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Paz" was formed in the city of Cuenca, which is a city that is very rich in its culture and traditions, such as the Day of the Innocent Saints, and El Pase del Nino Viajero (parade honoring the traveling Infant Jesus), among others. These are traditional celebrations that attract both national and international tourists. The members of the communal bank are a group of people that are united in looking to improve their social and economic situation, working to build a great friendship, respect and mutual assistance so that they can move their families ahead. Señora María D. is a member of the communal bank "La Paz." She lives in the Quinta Chica parish in the city of Cuenca. She is 47 years old and has been separated from her husband for a number of years. She has 5 children, age 28, 25, 21,16 and 4 years. Her oldest children already work and they help her with the household expenses; they live in a rented home, as they do not own their own home. Maria has worked in the market "9 de Octubre" in the city of Cuenca for 28 years. She sells all kinds of cooked beans; when she works she walks all around the market offering her products. This is her third year working with the loans of the communal bank, and she is convinced that they have helped her to improve her business. With this new loan that the FUNDACION ESPOIR is making, she is going to buy a variety of dried beans such as peas, kidney beans, broad beans and peanuts, etc., to better supply her business and in this way attract more customers. Her main dream is to be able to own her own home for the tranquility of the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of dried beans such as peas, peanuts, kidney beans, and broad beans to supply her business

loans.name: Ana Yolanda

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Paz se formo en la ciudad de Cuenca,  ésta es una ciudad muy rica por su cultura y tradiciones como los días de los santos inocentes, el pase del niño viajero, entre otras, costumbres que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero. Sus integrantes  son un grupo de personas que se unieron para buscar mejoras sociales y económicas logrando consolidar una gran amistad, respeto  y ayuda mutua para salir adelante con sus familias.

La señora Ana O. es una de las socias más  alegres del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la urbe de la ciudad en  el sector Quinta Chica, ella tiene 46 años de edad  es madre soltera de tres  hijos de 25, 24, 19 años, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente con los gastos de  la casa, su segunda hija es casada y su último hijo estudia  en la Universidad del Azuay,  la educación les da su papá que reconoció solo al primero y tercer hijo. La casa en la que habitan es propia gracias al esfuerzo de su juventud.

Ana trabaja recorriendo el mercado de la Feria Libre en  la ciudad de Cuenca, vende  frutas, verduras,  pescados, etc.  según la temporada, esta actividad la viene realizando desde  hace siete años y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero hay que salir adelante, también teje chompas las cuales les vende a sus amigas y vecinas de la comunidad.

Ana  formó parte del banco comunal durante dos años y se retiró, luego regresó y este es su tercer ciclo  trabajando nuevamente con su banco y asegura que los créditos obtenidos han invertido en su negocio y el nuevo préstamo que la institución le entregue va a comprar frutas y verduras variadas para a bastecer mejor su negocio y captar más clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank, La Paz, is in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is a city rich in culture and traditions, such as The Holy Saints and the celebration of Christ’s birth (a large Christmas pageant in Ecuador) among others. These are celebrations that attract national and international tourism. Her companions are a group of people who are trying to improve their social and economic situations and have formed a strong friendship with respect and mutual aid which helps their families get ahead.. Mrs. Ana O. is one of the most cheerful members of the communal bank La Paz. She lives in Quinta Chica, an area of the city. She is 46, the single mother of 3: 25, 24 and 19. Her oldest son works and helps her with the household expenses. The second is a married daughter, and her last is a son, a student at the University of Azuay. Their father only educated the oldest and youngest. The house that they live in belongs to her, thanks to her hard work. Ana goes around the Central Market of Cuenca selling fruit, vegetables, fish, etc. depending on the season. She has been doing this for the past seven years and she says that she has good days and bad days, but you have to keep going to get ahead. She also knits sweaters which she sells to her friends and neighbors in the area. Ana was a member of the communal bank for two years, then she left. She then returned and this is her third cycle working again with the bank. She assures us that the profits that she has earned she has invested in her business. With the new loan that the institution has offered her, she will buy different fruit and vegetables to better supply her business and to attract more customers

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted fruit and vegetables to better supply her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer perseverante y activa, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, distrito D. Manantay, tiene 58 años, es madre D. siete hijos, D. los cuales todos son mayores D. edad. Ella cría patos y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, además ambos se dedican a la preparación D. tamales, juanes, humitas (comida D. la zona), que luego venden en un mercadillo ubicado en el mismo distrito que viven. Elena forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Caseritas” desD. hace un año y cuatro meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue 300 soles, dinero que utilizó para elaborar juanes y comprar refrescos. En la actualidad, ella necesita un crédito D. 1300 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos para preparar comida y refrescos, los mismos que venderá frente a un colegio.
El sueño D. Elena es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Elena is a persistent and active woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the district of Manantay. She is 58 years old and the mother of seven children, all of whom are adults. She raises ducks and counts on the support of her husband. Furthermore, both of them work in the preparation of tamales, juanes, and humitas (food of the region), which they later sell in a market located in the same district in which they live. Elena has been a part of the communal bank "Las Caseritas" for one year and four months. The first credit that she obtained was 300 soles, which she used to make juanes and purchase soft drinks. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,300 soles, which will be used to purchase products to prepare food and soft drinks, which she will then sell in front of a school. Elena's dream is to have a well established restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for preparing food and drinks

loans.name: Humbertina De Jesus

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Paz se formo en la ciudad de Cuenca,  ésta es una ciudad muy rica por su cultura y tradiciones como los días de los santos inocentes, el pase del niño viajero, entre otras, costumbres que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero. Sus integrantes  son un grupo de personas que se unieron para buscar mejoras sociales y económicas logrando consolidar una gran amistad, respeto  y ayuda mutua para salir adelante con sus familias.

La señora  Humbertina Muñoz es una socia activa del banco  comunal La Paz, ella vive en el barrio las Peñas por el sector de Miraflores con su hija de 20 años que es la única soltera de siete hermanos, Humbertina tiene 64 años de edad está  divorciada desde hace cuatro años por que su esposo la abandono. Fruto del esfuerzo de toda una vida logró construir su casa propia.

Humbertina se dedica a la crianza de pollos lleva cuatro años trabajando en este negocio asegura que le va muy bien, sus pollos los vende en pie y pelados  entregando en las tiendas de su localidad o los vende  en los mercados de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia  lleva tres años trabajando con los  prestamos de la fundación todo este tiempo ha invertido en su negocio y  con el  nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos, comida y vitaminas para su crianza e incrementar su criadero, así como para la compra de  algunos utensilios para su hogar.

El  sueño de Humbertina  es  ver a sus hijos gozar de una situación tranquila en su vida matrimonial y  económica.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Paz formed in Cuenca, a city very rich in culture and traditions, such as Los Dias de Los Santos Inocentes and El Pase del Nino Viajero (religious holidays around Christmas time), among others. These are customs that attract national and foreign tourists. The members of the bank are a group of people that united in order to seek social and economic improvements, thereby managing to strengthen a great friendship, respect, and mutual help in order for them and their families to get ahead. Mrs. Humbertina Muñoz is an active partner of La Paz. She lives in the neighborhood Las Peñas, in the sector of Miraflores, with her 20-year-old daughter, who is the only single one of seven siblings. Humbertina is 64 years old and has been divorced for four years, since her husband left her. Through her life-long efforts, she managed to build her own house. Humbertina makes a living raising chickens. She has been working in this business for four years and she assures that it is going very well for her. She sells her chickens plucked, delivering them to the stores in her town, or selling them in the city's markets. Our partner has been working with loans from this foundation for three years, all this time investing in her business. With the new credit that FUNDACION ESPOIR provides her, she will invest in the purchase of more chickens, food and vitamins for raising them, and will expand her farm, as well as purchase a few utensils for her home. Humbertina's dream is to see her children enjoy a laid-back situation in their married life, as well as economically.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens, food and vitamins for raising them, and utensils for her home

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es una emprendedora mujer de 46 años, vive con su pareja (Mauro), de 50 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Jonathan de 20, María de 15 y Luis de 13 años, en su casa propia.

Claudia ha trabajado durante toda su vida en variedad de oficios para brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida; pero desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa, actividad que le gusta realizar, ya que la hace sentirse independiente y encaminada hacia un futuro mejor
Realizar su trabajo de forma ambulatoria le da más opciones de ganar clientela que si lo haría en un puesto fijo, ella ofrece diversas prendas; como ropa interior, medias, polos, etc. siendo la parte difícil de su labor caminar durante casi todo el día, aún así ella se siente contenta, pues sabe que cada sacrificio trae su recompensa y es por ello que piensa seguir trabajando por el bienestar de su familia.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en su crédito anterior fue muy puntual en todos sus pagos y se compromete a seguir haciéndolo así. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mercadería en ropa de verano para llevarlas a vender a otras ciudades, fuera de la capital para así lograr mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Claudia is an enterprising woman. She is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her partner Mauro, who is 50 years old, and their three children: Jonathan, 20, Maria, 15, and Luis, 13. Claudia has worked her whole life in various jobs in order to give her family a good quality of life. For the past two years she has worked selling clothing, which she greatly enjoys. She feels independent and her hard work is leading her to a bright future. She sells her clothing on foot, which gives her a greater client base than if she had a physical store. She sells various garments such as underwear, stockings, polos, etc. The most difficult part of her job is being on her feet all day. However, she is happy moving around and knows that her sacrifices will bring rewards. This motivates her to keep working so that she can improve the life of her family. This is her second loan with MFP and she was very punctual with all of the payments for her first loan. She is very dedicated to continuing her punctual payments. With the loan she will purchase summer clothing to sell in cities outside the capital, where she can earn greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es:
Heydi tiene 25 años, comparte su vida con Juan, de 27 años. Tienen 2 hijos: Maira de 6 y Sebastian de 3 años, todos viven cómodamente en su casa propia.  

Desde hace un años se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa, tanto la que ella misma elabora, como la que compra al por mayor. Ella ha trabajado desde muy joven y ha aprendido las “artes del comercio”, que como ella dice, es por ello que siempre está  sonriendo y brindándoles mucha confianza a sus clientes, aconsejándoles sobre si la prenda le queda bien y si los colores le asientan. 
Heydi vende las prendas de forma ambulatoria, y aunque es muy cansado tener que caminar de un lado a otro, lo hace con muchas ganas, pues sabe que de todo gran esfuerzo obtendrá una recompensa. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser muy puntual con sus pagos, ya que se considera una persona muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para la elaboración de los polos que elabora y adorna con mostacillas y lentejuelas.
texts.en:
Heydi is 25 years old and is married to Juan, 27. They have two children: Maria, 6, and Sebastian, 3; and they all live comfortably in a home they own. For the past year Heydi has made a living selling clothing, which she makes herself and also buys at wholesale. She has worked from a very young age and has learned "the art of commerce," as she says. That is why she's always smiling and providing her customers with a lot of confidence, advising them on what outfit fits them the best and what colors match. Heydi sells the clothing outdoors, and although she gets very tired walking from one end of town to the other, she does it with a strong will because she knows that all her efforts will be rewarded. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with her payments since she considers herself a very responsible person. With the money she is requesting, she plans to purchase a larger quantity of fabrics for the polo shirts she makes and decorates with beads and sequins.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase textile materials

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
ANGELICA MARIA C. H. tiene 24 años y es madre de una niña de un año y ocho meses, estudió la carrera de cosmética dermatológica en un CEO del estado. Hace tres años sus hermanos y su madre le apoyaron con un pequeño capital (préstamo) que necesitaba para comenzar con la venta de algunos abarrotes en un espacio de su casa; al inicio compró arroz, fideos, gaseosas, pañales, champú, galletas lo que con el tiempo generó ganancias debido al esfuerzo y perseverancia de María, los ingresos que obtuvo de sus ventas lo invirtió en mercadería para su pequeño negocio que lo trasladó en la casa de su suegra. Los siguientes préstamos que obtuvo compró algunos implementos de cosmética y un exhibidora de helados, porque piensa más adelante instalar un salón de belleza dado a que en la zona donde radica no hay ese servicio. Gracias a sus ventas apoya a su esposo en los gastos de la familia, como la alimentación y salud dado a que ninguno cuenta con un seguro. 
Necesita el préstamo para comprar juguetes porque se acerca campaña navideña y así de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Angelica Maria C. H. is 24 years old and the mother of a 1-year, 8-month old daughter. She studied for a cosmetic dermatology degree at a state-run school. Three years ago her mother and siblings supported her with a small loan that she needed to start selling some groceries from a space in her home. At first she purchased rice, noodles, soft drinks, diapers. shampoo and cookies, and with time earned an income thanks to her hard work and perseverance. She reinvested her profits in merchandise for her small business, which she moved to her mother-in-law's house. With additional loans she was able to purchase some ice cream and cosmetic equipment because in the future she plans to set up a beauty salon since there isn't one in her area. Thanks to her sales, she is able to help her husband with family expenses, like food and health care, since neither has insurance. She is requesting a loan to purchase toys because Christmastime is nearing and in this way she can continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys for Christmastime

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 45 años, vive con su pareja (Enrique), de 45 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Luis de 21, Melisa de 15, Yanira de 19 y Johana de 11 años. Todos viven muy contentos en su casa propia.	

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, actividad que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de su familia. Además le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que la relaja y se siente más libre. Conversando con su clientela y vendiendo la mercadería pasan sus días y ella no pierde las esperanzas de mejorar su negocio para obtener más ingresos, aunque muchas veces el cansancio la desmotiva un poco, ella no se deja vencer y sigue adelante, pues quiere forjarse un mejor porvenir. 
Para el futuro quiere tener una tienda- bazar donde pueda ofrecer productos variados y novedosos, además de la ropa que ya vende.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará sandalias para vender en época de verano, ya que quiere aprovechar la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years old and lives with her partner, Enrique, 45, and their four children: Luis, 21; Melisa, 15; Yanira, 19; and Johana, 11. All live very contently in a home they own. Nelly is a very hard-working woman who has made a living selling clothing and accessories for the past three years, an activity that provides the necessary income for her family's well-being. She also loves her work since it relaxes her and makes her feel freer. She spends her day conversing with customers and selling merchandise, and she is still hopeful she can improve her business to earn more income. While many times it can get discouraging, she doesn't stop fighting and keeps making headway because she wants to forge a better future. In the future she wants to have a general store where she can offer varied and innovative products along with the clothing she already sells. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very content with her work with her community bank group, since all the members have been very responsible with their payments. With the money she is requesting, she plans to purchase sandals to sell in summertime so she can take advantage of the seasonal demand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandals

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa es una mujer muy trabajadora de 42 años, vive con su esposo (Luis), de 52  años, y con su pequeña de Maricielo de 1 año y 7 meses.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa (lencería), tiempo que le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para realizar esta actividad de la mejor manera y así lograr buenos ingresos. Pero eso no es todo, también incursionó en la venta de comida, actividad que está empezando a crecer y gracias a su buena sazón tiene cada vez más clientes. 
A Santa le ayuda su cuñada para llevar las porciones de comida hasta los negocios o viviendas que le solicitan, es así que aprovecha de la mejor manera su tiempo, ya que la otra parte debe emplearla en la atención de su hija, la cual está en una edad en la que necesita mucho de las atenciones de su madre. 
Santa se siente tranquila, ya que tiene un trabajo que le da libertad y además le genera buenos ingresos para la mejora de la calidad de vida de su familia, también tiene la esperanza de tener un negocio más estable, como un librería.

Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de lencería y además invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para cocinar sus ricos platillos.
texts.en:
Santa is a very hard working 42-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, Luis, 52, and her 19-month-old daughter, Maricielo. For the last 4 years, she has sold clothing (lingere), and in that time she has gained the necessary experience to acheive the best results with this business and earn a good salary. But this is not all; she also tried her hand at selling food, a venture that is starting to grow, and, given her good acumen, she keeps gaining customers. Santa is helped by her sister-in-law in taking the orders of food to the business or homes that ask for them. This way, she makes the best use of her time, since the rest of her time must be spent caring for her daughter, who is of the age that needs a lot of attention from her mother. Santa feels at ease with her job that gives her freedom in addition to generating a good income to improve the quality of life for her family. She also has the hope of owning a more stable business, such as a bookstore. This is Santa's eighth loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual in making payments. The money that she is now asking for will be used to buy better quality lingere and will be invested in buying more ingredients in order to cook her delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock of merchandise and ingredients for food

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo (Filomeno), de 60 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Ricardo de 28, Rubén de 25, Katherine de 18 y Antony de 15 años.

Ella es una mujer muy amable y carismática que se ha venido dedicando desde hace 6 años a la atención de su tienda. Cuenta su esposo, que comenzaron con un pequeño kiosco con muy poca cantidad de productos y poco a poco lograron mejorar y habilitar su casa para poner una pequeña bodega. 
Hoy en día este negocio es la primera fuente de ingresos de su familia, dándole ciertas facilidades para mantener a sus hijos menores, pues los mayores ya trabajan. Viviana se encuentra muy feliz porque gracias a su negocio puede mantenerse al lado de su esposo, quien la ayuda en la atención y al lado de sus hijos. 
Para el futuro quiere mejorar e implementar mejor su negocio para que arroje mayores ganancias.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y espera que todo su grupo sea tan responsable como ella para cumplir en los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas y algunos productos comestibles para atraer a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Viviana is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her husband (Filomeno) of 60 years of age and their 4 children: Ricardo 28, Rubén 25, Katherine 18 and Antony 15.

She is a very nice and charismatic woman who since 6 years ago has taken care of her store. She has the support of her husband and when they began their business they had a little kiosk with a very limited quantity of products. Little by little they were able to better and set up their home and to start a small grocery store.

To this day the business remains the main source of income for the family especially to the younger children since the older ones work. Viviana is very happy because thanks to her business she can be with her husband who helps her with the responsibilities at home and work and they are able to be close to their children.

For the future she wants to improve her business and have greater earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and hopes that all of her group will be as responsible as her in their payments. With the money loaned, she will buy more drinks and groceries to attract a greater number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mot R. is a 54-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Mot R. is a Khmer cake seller in the market, selling the cake that she produces in her home. She is married with six children, three of whom are married and have already started new homes. Another source of family income comes from her husband's driving a motorbike taxi.

Mot R. said that her current income is now not adequate. To better meet her family's living expenses, she wants to operate another business but she doesn't have the money to invest in it. Therefore, she would like a loan of US$1,000 to be used as capital to begin selling snack food.

loans.use: To be used as capital to begin selling snack food

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mr. Prak V., age 34, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He currently earns an average of $4 a day and has been running his service for more than four years.

Prak V. is the father of two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. His wife, Ot Sovany, sells snack cakes at the market. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals. He and his wife appear in the photo.

Prak V. requested a loan in order to purchase a machine which will enable him to make fish paste during this coming fish paste season.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for making fish paste

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man S. is 57 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a married woman and the mother of six children. Three of her daughters are garment factory workers.

Man S. earns a living as a tailor, providing her service to neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. From her business, she can earn an average of US$4 per day. 

Man S. will be using half of her loan to purchase additional tailoring materials and the rest to buy small fish to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring materials and to buy small fish to raise

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
Cyril M. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 25 years old. Cyril is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cyril owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cyril has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Cyril joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cyril is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cyril from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is from the village of Bantangan, Valencia City. She is 29 years old. Emma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products like t-shirts, plastic ware, bags, pots, and more in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jhunabelle

texts.en:
Jhunabelle is 31 years old and is married to a farmer named Arcadio T.. They are blessed with three children, namely: Siegfred, 11 years of age and first year high school student; Ariabel,8 years old, grade 3 student; and Julius Ceasar, 2 years old. They lived in a small village called "Nungnungan", a place where some people create their own business in a unique way. Their house is located near their vegetable plantation and rice farm.

She has been engaged in vegetable farming and vending for almost two years now, and her daily net income is PHP 300.00. At present, she is requesting a loan amount of PHP 5,000.00 from KIVA lenders to provide capital for her business. She will purchase some organic fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable farm so that she is able to have a good harvest. She believes that "every step you make will provide success, and along with perseverance will build a strong and fruitful foundation in the end".

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som T. is a 38 year old garment worker who lives in Phnom Penh. Som T. is married with two teenage children, while her husband, Say Chea, aged 38, is a local ox trader. He also buys oxen at reasonable prices from the rural people and fattens them for a while before selling for a profit. Currently, this couple owns a plot of land which they use for farming work. Som T. hopes to generate extra income by borrowing a loan to purchase watermelon seeds, and fertilizer, to grow on her farmland. Note: Som T. was not available for photographing, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase watermelon seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lung

texts.en:
Lung L., 34, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling porridge at a nearby local market in the town, earning approximately US $1.66 per day. The family is also assisted mainly by her husband who is currently involved in a business of repairing electronic appliances such as televisions and radios. He is able to earn an income of US $2.83 per day as a primary source of income for his family and to support the three children’s studies.

Mrs. L. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase spare parts for televisions and other electronic devices to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy television and electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Marites is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice and corn in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean V., 39, is married with seven children. Five of her children are enrolled in a local school. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. The family is assisted mainly by her husband who is currently involved in a business of buying fish from the local fisherman and reselling it at a fair profitable price. He is able to earn an income of US $14.50 per day as a primary source of income for his family and to support the three children’s studies. One of her children is employed at a restaurant in the town as a waiter, earning an income of US $2.66 per day to partly cover the household expenses.

Mrs. V. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, V. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase more fish to expand her husband’s current business and to generate extra income.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Her principle in life is to continue gaining success in her business in order to support her family's needs, and help in the struggle to maintain their life. Venus, 47 years old, has managed a livestock business (hog raising) for almost three years now, and her net income when she sells one piglet is PHP 2,800.00. She wanted to purchase additional hogs to raise but her capital is not enough. Therefore, she would like to take out a loan of PHP 4,000.00 to help to provide an adequate income and to finance one bag of hog feed. She also has a poultry business, raising chickens and ducks.

She is married to Reynaldo C., a simple citizen in their town who works as a farmer. They have been blessed with two loving children, namely: Bernard, 23 years old, also a farmer; and Reynaldo Jr.,15 years of age, fourth year high school student. They are harmoniously residing in the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, where their house is located near the irrigation area and rice fields. Most of the people there are simple businessmen and businesswomen. She is thankful to those people who have helped her throughout her life.

loans.use: To purchase some hogs and hog feed.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran D., 28, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in the agricultural business of raising pigs, and she also goes to the market to sell fish every day, earning approximately US $10 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who is currently employed in a local factory that produces bricks. He is able to earn an income of US $5 per day to support the three children’s studies and to cover the household expenses.

Mrs. D. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, D. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase more pigs to raise and fish for resale at the market.

loans.use: To buy pigs and fish.

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita M. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 27 years old. Anelita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Anelita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products, as well as firewood in the local community. Anelita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Anelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Sros Y., 37, is married with four school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children.

Mrs. Y. is engaged in the business of selling chickens and vegetables at a nearby local market in the town and raising pigs at her home, earning approximately US$17 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who helps his wife at the market and with raising pigs at home.

Mrs. Y. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Y. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to buy a motorbike with compartment attached to easily transport chickens to sell. With the remainder, she wants to invest in her pig-raising business. She hopes that her new business of selling chickens will enable her family to generate extra income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting her chickens

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 41 years old and married to Cristomae, who is 42 years old and works as a vegetable farmer.  They have two children, Jervish John, a second-year college student, and Imee Flor, who is in her first year of high school.  

Imelda has been a vegetable vendor for 14 years.  Her business has been helped her earn the money needed to send her children to school and to provide them with a school allowance.  

She wants to expand her vegetable farm but she needs additional resources to buy seeds for planting so she can increase their harvest and earn more income.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 for this purpose.  This way their family income will improve and also their way of living.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mit

texts.en: Mit D., age 57, is a widow and mother of six children. Two of her daughters are married and live with their own families, and they work as garment factory workers. The remaining children are attending school. Mit D. has a plot of farmland on which she cultivates rice and other vegetable crops. Mit D. is applying for a loan to buy a cow which will help her with hard labor tasks on the farm. She also plans to raise her cow to have babies in the future. She and one of her daughters are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Kev

texts.en: Kev H., age 29, is married with three children. One of her children is enrolled at a local primary school.  Mrs. H. lives with her husband and children in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. To make a living, she grows rice and raises chickens, earning an income of about $3 per day. The family is mainly supported by her husband who is a skillful fisherman. He is able to earn about $6 per day which is the primary source of income for his family and pays for the education of his three children. Mrs. H. and her husband wish to improve their standard of living by earning a better income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new fishing boat so her husband can more easily transport fishing traps to the lake.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Klod

texts.en: Klod S., 29, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living she grows rice, earning approximately $6 per day. The family is mainly supported by her husband who is a skillful fisherman.  He earns about $5 per day and this income pays for the education of their two children. Mrs. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a $700 loan to purchase a machine for her husband’s fishing boat. By doing so, her husband will be able to more easliy transport his fishing traps to the lake to go fishing.

loans.use: buy a machine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel S., known as “Joe” in his village, is married to Mrs. Cherry S. and they are blessed with two children. They live in a rural area of Bagahabag, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. They aim to improve their status of living so they can send their children to school and give them a better future. In this regard, they both work to earn income to provide for the welfare of their children.

Joel uses their jeepney (pictured) to earn income while his wife is engaged in selling vegetables in the market. Though their patience and sacrifices, they now earn a net income of PHP 6,000 a month which they used to satisfy the basic needs of their family and to finance the education of their children. 

Due to the rising cost of commodities they need to earn more income. Joel requests a loan of PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders for the maintenance of their jeepney. He knows that this amount will be of great help to his family, and hopes the loan will be granted.

loans.use: For maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn M. is 21 years old and lives in the rural place of Barangay General Balao Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Victor M., age 25, who is a local farmer in their community. They are blessed with a child named Vhie Jhay who is three years old.

Jonalyn raises hogs to earn good profits. She sells her pigs to the slaughterhouse every three months when they are big enough to be sold. Jonalyn is a responsible mother and neighbor and she wants to increase her income through her business. Jonalyn is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 from the KIVA lenders to buy more piglets for her small piggery. The loan will help to improve their family finances.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Tor

texts.en: Tor C. is a 53-year-old widow and mother. She has two school-aged children, as well as a grown daughter who is married and lives with her own family. Tor C. earns a living by planting various crops on her own farmland. She currently plants a watermelon crop, which she will harvest when they are mature. Recently, her crop is requiring more fertilizer. Because of that, Tor C. has decided to seek a loan to buy more fertilizer which she will use to improve her crop yield. She will use the other half of her loan to purchase a used moto for transport.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a transport moto.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Muth C., 21, is married with a young child and two older children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she sells a few types of cakes, earning approximately $15 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who is currently employed as an electrician in the town. He is able to earn about $4 per day to support the education of their three children and help cover the household expenses. Mrs. C. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to transport fruit to the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transport.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo C. has managed a typical retail store in his village for almost 10 years now. He has a daily net income of PHP 500. But that income is not enough for the daily needs of his family, especially now that two of his children are enrolled in college. He is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve his retail store. He plans to purchase more merchandise such as canned goods and soft drinks. Aside from his retail store, farming and rasing hogs provides additional income for their family.

He hopes that his requested loan will be granted. Marcelo is married to a vegetable vendor in their village and blessed with three children - Angielhea, age 21, is a teacher who is already married, Evangeline, age 19, is a third-year college student, and their youngest Jojo, age 18, is a second-year college student.

loans.use: To buy morel merchandise for his retail store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta N. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 34 years old and married with 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta resells fruits like bananas, as well as managing a video karaoke in their village. Julieta earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Julieta recently joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that will help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of 5000 PHP, so she can purchase additional products to sell and grow her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
The selling of fruit is the main source of income of Jovy B.. She is married to Joseph, her partner in her buy and sell business. They have five children: Ma. Loreta - 17 years old, a high school graduate; Mark Joe - 13 years old, in 3rd year high school; Mary Joy - 10 years old, in grade-V; Maria Josefa - 7 years old, in grade I; and Mark Joseph - 5 years old, already in preschool.

Jovy and her husband are engaged in the buying and selling of bananas. She wishes to make her business grow and with this in mind she is borrowing PHP 5,000. She hopes that the lenders will grant her request so she can purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 49 years old, is married to Ruben C. and they live in the village of Nagassican, Santiago city. Virginia’s husband is the one who makes some furniture.
